story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Fashion Skills Lab Series- A New Approach To Learning & Creating Fashion.

MANY people want to bring fashion to life. They have great ideas, so they know the desire, but what about the HOW?  Hiring people for EVERYTHING is risky and expensive. 

Fashion is personal, and until I created the Fashion Skills Lab (FSL) Series, finding the right learning platform that engages your schedule and your learning style with thoughtful and easy topic classes has been difficult! 

The Fashion Skills Lab (FSL) Series is a series of online fashion learning portals and workshops onsite in Los Angeles.

Classes on the industry-  such as:

  • sampling
  • costing
  • construction
  • patternmaking
  • choosing fabrics
  •  merchandising  

Affordable and accessible.  

So YOU can know it and do it, without having to hire a consultant or a company. 

FASHION INDUSTRY STUFF 

 That NO ONE TEACHES!!!!

Along with the online learning series, ALL students can take part in classes  - beginner, intermediate, and master - at the Fashion Skills Lab (FSL) Series Studio in Los Angeles personally taught by Amy Bond and the FSL Education Team; including other faves from Project Runway! 

You can ASK the questions and GET the answers, without having to spend loads of time and loads of money!  Keep your day job~until you don't want to!  

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO LEARN? !?

So How? 

It's simple:  Learn 100% online or pair your learning with online classes and visits to our Los Angeles fashion studio - it's your choice!

Who is Amy Bond?  :) 

If you have already seen me on Project Runway, then  you know fashion has always been in my life - from learning to sew super young  to owning my own fashion company. 

Along with appearing in numerous fashion magazines, TV shows and runway shows, I have also been an award winning fashion educator with Academy of Art University, Otis Design College, and the Art Institutes. 

 

The Challenge In Going From Wanting To KNOWING. 

My road to learning all things Fashion lead me to obtain my Bachelors' Degree in Fashion from Stephens College in Missouri, and my Masters Degree in Fashion from the Academy of Art University in California.

 It was a lot of time and a lot of money, but it  gave me the opportunity to teach thousands of students about fashion and design. 

You will always learn at a fashion college and trade school, but that time and money might be too much.  What do you need?

I constantly hear the same story from people thinking about building their fashion skill sets, but not ready to invest in a set school program:

I want to understand the kind of fabrics in the industry.  I want to know how to use fabric.  I want to feel secure with my choices - but a traditional school is way too much for me.

I developed the ideas I already had, but needed to hire others to do everything, because I didn't know enough about construction to talk the language of fit and samples - but a traditional school is way too much for me.

I needed to understand how to communicate the issues - but a traditional school was way too much for me.

A bachelor's degree in fashion design can cost around $36,000 annually on the average, although the range can vary widely from $13,000 to around $60,000 a year. That amounts to almost $144,000!  These estimates only include the cost of tuition and not other fees like books and supplies, as well as that of room and board.

An associate degree normally takes two full years and includes class in fashion analysis, visual merchandising and textiles. You often have to complete an internship in the program as well. A bachelor degree takes four years, but offers more classes in design and business.

The Fashion Skills Lab Series- A Simple Campaign For Everyone!

  • Students get to personally create their own schedule of classes for them to learn at their pace within a preset learning curriculum timeline.  
  • Each online video is pre filmed but also comes with *live discussion sessions with Amy Bond and the FLS Education Staff. *Students will have a choice of discussion session dates and times to choose from.
  • By helping us reach our goal you will be affecting thousands of people build a foundation of learning, and we believe some will change all our lives for the better.

So let's build your fashion foundation together, because too many hours on YouTube is too impersonal, and enrolling in a fashion college or trade school can be too costly.

What We Need To Raise

Here's the breakdown:

ONLINE VIDEOS

  • Each video will be about 45 minutes, with an average per minute production cost of $25. We plan to initially offer 30 videos.  Per minute production cost includes pre production, filming, and post production.  This part will cost approximately $33,750.00.
  • The website for classes and to download videos, plus communicate with FSL staff and build the student's learning platform/pathway will cost approximately $13,500.00.  This cost includes 1 year of site maintenance.

THE STUDIO

  • The Fashion Skills Lab Studio is available to every student, but is an optional part in their learning journey.
  • The Studio will maintain a working classroom with no less then 8 sewing machines (single needle, Machine 2 Machine 3), cutting tables, selection of fabrics and learning computers.
  • We have found two locations (we can find more!).  Both are in the Metropolitan Los Angeles Area (DTLA and Studio City).  The average rent is $2,800 per month.  With utilities and insurance, we are basing the monthly operational cost at $4,200.00.  We want to allocate 6 months rent from what we raise in this campaign.  That equals $25,200.

EQUIPMENT & SUPPLIES

  •  The average cost per sewing machine is $1,000.00 and we expect to use about $5,000.00 to set up the studio with learning computers (3) and all necessary workroom and office supplies.  The cost for the six (6) custom cutting tables are $500 each.  The total amount needed for equipment & supplies is $16,000.00

The Impact

Fashion is personal, and so are our causes.

  • By helping to create the Fashion Skills Lab you will be an important part of inspiring thousand of people to be creative!  To break their barriers of self doubt, their financial placement, and their time limits for bettering their lives!
  • By helping to create the Fashion Skills Lab you will make a difference in the world of education by providing the proper foundation for those who want to learn fashion education!
  • By helping to create the Fashion Skills Lab you will be part of what inspires fashion entrepreneurs to open their own businesses and employ people!
  • BY HELPING FASHION SKILLS LAB BE A 'THING', YOU CAN BRING IN THE INDUSTRY EMPLOYERS WHO WILL HELP SPONSOR OUR SCHOLARSHIPS FOR HIGH SCHOOLERS 

Amy Bond is a proven educator;  creating learning platforms for Otis Design College, Arts Institues, Kadenze (Kadenze.com), and Stitch Factory (Las Vegas), who has the passion and interest to commit to those who want to learn.

Amy Bond has received numerous Educator of the Year Awards and the highest reviews from students due to her passion for learning, and her ability to understand an individual student's ability and process to their learning.

story: Asking for help is never easy, so I'll keep this short. Every single member of this team has given every penny of their savings to make this film happen. We have sold belongings, gotten second jobs, and cut costs in every possible way. Our director, Morgan, worked hard on a script that secured us an art grant, but there was a catch... in order to qualify for the grant, we must raise 8,900 more dollars. If we can prove to the school board that people will get behind this art, they have agreed to fund the remainder of the film. We're not asking for a hand out, we're begging you to put us to work!

story:
Read to Exceed


 Hi! My name is Laura Cvitanovich and I am an English teacher at Woodside High School in Newport News, Virginia. Read to Exceed is a project to fund the purchase a class set (32 books) of current, relevant quality literature.  Woodside is home to more than 2000 students; many of them are urban minorities who come from single parent homes, are on assisted lunch programs, or are considered socio-economically at-risk. Unfortunately, many of these kids have never been exposed to any type of literature or magazines in their homes and it affects their ability to read, comprehend, problem solve, analyze, and succeed at school and in daily life. I have witnessed first-hand how a student's perspective changes when they are introduced to literature that they find relevant, interesting, and engaging; they WANT to read, they WANT to interact and understand the text, and they WANT to discuss it with other students. Reading can open up the world for these kids. Your contribution will help purchase books for students who don't typically read books; you will be providing the tools to extend literacy to at-risk students who, I hope, will learn to read to exceed at school, college, career, and life.

What We Need & What You Get

I would like to raise $500 to purchase a class set of "In the Heart of the Sea," by Nathanial Philbrick. It’s a great read, appealing to everyone but especially to boys, and it syncs up nicely with 11th grade American Literature and US History. We need 35 copies of this book. This will allow each student access to a book that they will close read and discuss as a class. The books will be held at school and will be used and shared by the English and Social Studies departments. If we don’t reach our entire goal, we will purchase as many copies as possible and try to fill in with library loans. If you are willing to donate $50 or more to graciously support our cause, you will receive a Woodside High School T-shirt in black cotton with neon teal and purple graphics.

The Impact

Kids who read are better writers, thinkers, and problem solvers. Exposing kids to well written literature builds understanding, vocabulary, thinking skills, writing skills and prepares students for college and career. It is crucial that we, as a nation, effectively engage our students so they can develop the literacy needed to be citizens and leaders of tomorrow.

Other Ways You Can Help

Okay, so maybe you don’t want to contribute to this great cause. I understand. Please, please, please use the share tools to spread the word and make some noise about Read to Exceed!

story:
Why a Civics Action Lab?

This November, hundreds of 5th graders participated in the election of the first ever Connecticut’s Kid Governor through a pilot program created by Connecticut’s Old State House. After an exciting race, the students elected Elena Tipton, who ran on a Campaign for Kindness platform. Now she needs an office and we need YOUR help in creating it! 

We have the perfect place for Elena’s office: the space that served as the Governors’ Office for 58 years in the state’s venerable Old State House, one of Connecticut’s most historically-significant buildings. We want Elena’s office to double as a Civics Action Lab in our museum. Our initial goal is to raise $6,000, but the more donations we receive the more we can enhance the Lab.

The Civics Action Lab will engage kids and adult visitors alike with activities centered on civic engagement and Elena’s platform of kindness. The space will serve as an office for Connecticut’s Kid Governor, feature information about Elena’s Campaign for Kindness and provide an area where visitors can learn, explore and share ways to make a difference in their own communities.

With your helpful donation, you can bring the historic Governor’s Office at Connecticut’s Old State House to life and connect this space of civic leadership with contemporary examples of civic participation!

Governor Elena Tipton in her future Office and Civics Action Lab

What will be in this Governor’s Office and Civics Action Lab?

With your support, the Connecticut's Kid Governor Office and Civics Action Lab will have:

o  Elena’s official desk where constituents of all ages can write her letters about their acts of kindness or provide suggestions for actions that we can all take to make the world a kinder place.

o  Televisions/tablets showing Elena's messages to voters, media appearances, and State of the State Address, as well as the campaign videos submitted by the final 7 Connecticut’s Kid Governor candidates for the 2015 Election.

o  Take-home “Kindness Cards” suggesting random acts of kindness constituents can do and pass on to others.

o  Interactive activities that help people think about how to take action on the points of Elena’s platform at home, in school, at work – everywhere!

o  A “buddy bench” similar to those Elena wants to bring to 10 schools in Connecticut.

o  A talk-back board where visitors can highlight acts of kindness they have seen or participated in themselves.

o  Lively activities that help people explore the history, process and value of voting and other simple actions that help us share our voices and knit communities together.

Donations will also help launch Elena's 1-year term with a formal Inauguration and support her State of the State address in June.

How can I support this Civics Action Lab and Connecticut’s Kid Governor?

We invite you to help us fill this Lab with tools for learning and  inspirational stories of kids who make a difference. You can support this initiative by making a donation to our project and through other exciting ways! Our initial goal is to raise $6,000 by Elena's inauguration on January 29, but the more we raise, the more we can do in the Civics Action Lab!

Spread the word

The incredible success of the Connecticut’s Kid Governor program during its pilot year is due to word of mouth among friends and fans of Connecticut’s Old State House. You can spread the word about this fundraising campaign and the program by encouraging your local elementary schools to participate in the program this year and next. Perhaps they will consider running a 5th grade candidate in the Fall 2016 Election! You can also visit us at CT.KidGovernor.org and on our Facebook page to learn about Elena’s platform and how to support her Campaign for Kindness – share both sites with your friends and family!

Visit Connecticut’s Old State House

Experience the Civics Action Lab yourself! Visit Connecticut’s Old State House in downtown Hartford this spring and become inspired by the site’s stories, exhibits and programs. Visit www.ctoldstatehouse.org for more information. Click HERE to subscribe to our Connecticut’s Kid Governor email list and receive updates about the program, Civics Action Lab, and our public programs and events at Connecticut’s Old State House.


Did you know that Connecticut has a Kid Governor??

We sure do! This fall, Connecticut’s Old State House in Hartford launched the statewide pilot program Connecticut’s Kid Governor. The program taught 5th graders about our government, how it works and the value of civic engagement through the first ever statewide election for a Kid Governor.

Seven empowered students rose to the challenge of running for Connecticut’s Kid Governor and worked with their classmates to research community issues they care about and create action plans for a better world. Like real candidates, they crafted platforms and filmed campaign videos. Hundreds of 5th graders from 15 towns/cities watched and analyzed the campaign videos, voted and made their voices heard. You can watch all seven videos at CT.KidGovernor.org (they’re pretty awesome).

Fifth graders across the state elected Elena Tipton from Dr. Thomas S. O’Connell School in East Hartford (in the video above) as the first ever Connecticut’s Kid Governor. She won with a Campaign for Kindness platform which you can read more about HERE.

About Connecticut’s Old State House

Connecticut’s Kid Governor is a pilot education program created by Connecticut’s Old State House. A National Historic Landmark, Connecticut’s Old State House was once a state capitol building where citizens and all three branches of government debated matters of national importance for over 80 years. Now serving as one of the Constitution State’s most historically-significant museums, the tradition of civil discourse is carried on through programming, events, tours and exhibits. Learn more about Connecticut’s Old State House by visiting www.ctoldstatehouse.org or by following the Old State House on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

donation to our project and through other exciting ways! Our initial
goal is to raise $6,000 by Elena's inauguration on January 29, but the more we raise, the more we can do in the Civics Action
Lab!
Spread the word
The incredible success of the Connecticut’s Kid Governor program
during its pilot year is due to word of mouth among friends and fans of
Connecticut’s Old State House. You can spread the word about this fundraising
campaign and the program by encouraging your local elementary schools to
participate in the program this year and next. Perhaps they will consider
running a 5th grade candidate in the Fall
2016 Election! You can also visit
us at CT.KidGovernor.org and on our Facebook page to learn about Elena’s platform
and how to support her Campaign for Kindness – share both sites with your
friends and family! 
Visit
Connecticut’s Old State House 
Experience
the Civics Action Lab yourself! Visit Connecticut’s Old State House in downtown
Hartford this spring and become inspired by the site’s stories, exhibits and
programs. Visit www.ctoldstatehouse.org
for more information. Click HERE to subscribe to our Connecticut’s Kid Governor email list and receive updates
about the program, Civics Action Lab, and our public programs and events at
Connecticut’s Old State House.


Did you know that Connecticut has a Kid Governor??
We sure do! This fall, Connecticut’s Old State House in
Hartford launched the statewide pilot program Connecticut’s Kid Governor. The program taught 5th graders about our government, how it
works and the value of civic engagement through the first ever statewide
election for a Kid Governor. 
Seven empowered students rose to the challenge of running
for Connecticut’s Kid Governor and worked with their classmates to research
community issues they care about and create action plans for a better world.
Like real candidates, they crafted platforms and filmed campaign videos. Hundreds
of 5th graders from 15 towns/cities watched and analyzed the campaign
videos, voted and made their voices heard. You can watch all seven videos at
CT.KidGovernor.org (they’re pretty awesome). 
Fifth graders across the state elected Elena Tipton from Dr.
Thomas S. O’Connell School in East Hartford (in the video above) as the first
ever Connecticut’s Kid Governor. She won with a Campaign for Kindness platform which
you can read more about HERE. 




About Connecticut’s Old State House

Connecticut’s
Kid Governor is a pilot education program created by Connecticut’s Old State
House. A National Historic Landmark, Connecticut’s Old State House was once a
state capitol building where citizens and all three branches of government
debated matters of national importance for over 80 years. Now serving as one of
the Constitution State’s most historically-significant museums, the tradition
of civil discourse is carried on through programming, events, tours and
exhibits. Learn more about Connecticut’s Old State House by visiting www.ctoldstatehouse.org
or by following the Old State House on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

story:
Angels are all around us every day.  As we wake up and go through our daily routines an angel is never far away. Even at night when we sleep they peek in on us sending comfort and love.

As people go through their daily trials and tribulations of life,  most have no knowledge of the holy power so nearby. Angels are light and love, protection, guidance and care.  Too many folks suffer unnecessarily through the challenges of life.  That’s because they’re unaware of the fact that world-spanning wisdom and infinite intelligence is always within their reach. If only those people would stop being so busy and take the time to ask…. AND then listen to the answers.

Imagine stepping through a doorway into an enchanting world of Angels. Before you lies an oasis of flowing water and sweet, uplifting music. An harmonious blend of enchanting aromas wafts through the air. Angel images illuminated by a subtle glow of golden light captivate your senses. Sparkling crystals cascade rainbows of beauty throughout.

All your worries dissipate as you step into a room reminiscent of an Ancient Grecian Temple. Sacred energy washes over you as you feel wrapped in Angelic Wings. An Earth Angel approaches, ready to balance your body, mind and spirit.

Our vision is to help as many people as possible find that balance. We realize that as talented as our team is, we’re too small to make an appreciable impact to a world population of roughly 7.3 billion people – with nearly 323 million people in the United States alone.

The purpose of this campaign is to reach out to like-minded individuals to partner with us to manifest this vision into reality.  Partners of our Center will be guided to stretch their psychic muscles in a place of safety and support as they learn to empower their lives or become a full-fledged Prophetic Angelic Messenger™

Morgana Starr

Students of our center will be trained in the Angelic Arts ® under Morgana Starr and her Associates. Reverend Morgana is an Angel Communicator and Psychic Medium who co-hosts on Google TV 's, Angels Unveiled®. She was raised in the wilds of Africa by missionary parents. This along with looking for healing from Fibromyalgia and Chronic Fatigue syndrome, led Morgana to spirituality and her work with Angels. She is a Native American Pipe Carrier, Reiki Master Teacher,  Akashic Records reader, Psychic Development Teacher, Creator/Teacher of Angelic Arts®Certification Program and Past Life Reader. She is internationally known for her work as a Medium and her work directly with Archangel Anael, her books, and group or private sessions. Her readings help clear negative blockages like anger & fear, leaving you feeling peace, hope and a new sense of direction. She is the go-to Psychic for Celebrity Lacey Wildd, Reality TV Star and Actor, who has been featured on MTV, Inside Edition, LIFETIME, Style Network, TLC, 20/20.

The first step is to raise $33,000 for continued seed money to begin to make this Angelic dream a reality. This will be used to establish our first as our first Angels Oasis™ in the Cocoa Beach area of Florida, to provide in-person training as well as deliver our readings to people all over the world. Our wings are fluttering with joy as many of you have already joined us and we are now ready to soar to the next level.

We are inviting people to join in this chance to soar with the Angels. Each perk will enhance your connection with your angels and help you improve your path in life through our own personal attention and devotion to you.

We are grateful for all who donate and/or share this opportunity with their friends.  Together we can do this. Together we are ONE!

May you always feel Wrapped in the Loving Wings of the Angels.

Love and Hugs,
Morgana & the Angel Team

story:
Why Donate For Peace?

In 2015, the time is ripe for peace movements to break out all over the world.

Who says peace is not possible? We saw how suddenly gay marriage happened all over the world, and how fast legal marijuana is happening. These examples show how quickly attitudes can change. Can a new understanding of the possibility of world peace be next?

We think it can. Pacifism is already bubbling all over the world, and a worldwide awakening of peaceful ideals is in the air. Pacifism21.org will provide a voice, a forum and a daily chronicle for peace-builders, activists and concerned citizens as this important movement continues to grow. 

Is the world really ready to move towards peace?  If you are one of those irrepressible optimists who believes the human race can have a better future, please show your support by donating to Pacifism21 today.

We are trying to raise $10,000 to give our website and social media presence a proper liftoff, and your donation will make a gigantic difference in helping us get our message out there, loud and clear, for all the world to hear.

Pacifism21.org is nearly ready to launch ... but we cannot do it without your support. Please make a donation today, and become a part of a vibrant new online community that's about to make a splash.

What is Pacifism?

Pacifism does not have to be an absolute position: it is simply the belief that less war is better than more war. When there is a global conflict (say, in the Middle East today), a pacifist will tend to support peace talks over military escalation. When voting for a candidate, a pacifist will tend to support less military spending, and will be turned off by "let's bomb them!" rhetoric.

A pacifist is not against all reasonable self-defense, and does not have to believe that the problem of war can be solved completely. Dwight David Eisenhower was stating a pacifist position when he said these words: 

"In the councils of government, we must guard against the acquisition of unwarranted influence, whether sought or unsought, by the military–industrial complex."

Eisenhower was also one of the toughest military leaders of the 20th Century, and led the invasion of Europe to defeat Hitler during World War Two. 

Pacifism is a broad position. A pacifist may be left wing or right wing, liberal or conservative, capitalist or socialist, Occupy or Tea Party, Christian or Jewish or Muslim or Buddhist or Hindu or agnostic or atheist. A pacifist does not have to reject violence 100% of the time, does not have to dress like Mahatma Gandhi, is not required to sing folk music.

If you declare yourself a pacifist, you are joining a practical movement to reduce the incidence of military escalation around the world.  It's a common-sense idea: the idea that war is a terrible disease that we ought to try to cure, and that we ought to be able to cure. 

Why "Pacifism for the 21st Century"?

Pacifism21 means "Pacifism for the 21st Century". We chose this name to counter the idea that pacifism is a naive or outdated philosophy after the violent horrors of the 20th Century.  We want to emphasize that pacifism is a realistic, common-sense philosophy that is essential to the well-being of our planet.

We also want to show that pacifists can stand proud, that the broad and open-minded philosophy of life that inspired Dorothy Day, Mahatma Gandhi, Martin Luther King, John Lennon and Yoko Ono is a coherent and cohesive belief system that can no longer be dismissed with a joke or a stereotype.

What We Need Your Money For

Pacifism21.org is a website and non-profit organization that intends to kickstart a movement. You are invited to be a part of this movement whether you donate or not. But one great way to become an instant part of the movement is to donate today, and we really hope that you will!

We are raising $10,000 so we can put Pacifism21.org on a solid footing for its first few months of operation. It takes a lot of work to run a website, to keep the content fresh and streaming, to explore avenues for interaction with members and participants. $10,000 will allow us to:

  • Grow our web/social media presence.
  • Pay some writers and artists.
  • Pay for venues for our initial meetups and events 
  • Publish our first book
  • Create new forms of content that will reach wider audiences, such as entertaining comic strips and innovative data visualizations.
  • Complete our registration as an official non-profit organization so we can pursue further funding opportunities, including government and NGO grants and large private donations.

These things are critical to our longevity. We know that we can launch a website in 2015. But can we launch a website that will last, that will evolve and improve with the changing times, that will be around to make a difference when this is needed the most? That's the question you can help us answer with a big "YES" if you donate today. No matter how large or small the dollar amount is, your support will make a gigantic difference.

What You'll Get If You Donate

If you donate any amount and provide your mailing address, we will send you a package of stickers that you'll be proud to display on your laptops and devices or anywhere you want.  This will also help us spread the word, so please let us send you these stickers by placing a donation of any amount today!


There are other cool perks like coffee mugs available at higher donation levels, also designed to help you proudly share your support for pacifism in public in the most stylish possible way. We will also send you free copies of our first two books at the higher donation levels.

Most importantly: by placing a donation of any amount here on Indiegogo you are introducing yourself to us as a member of our community. We will offer to keep in touch with you at any level of participation that you wish. We know that your donation is an expression of your deep concern with the future of the world we live in together, and we welcome your arrival as a member of the Pacifism21 team.

What If You Have No Money To Donate?

We want you on the Pacifism21 team whether you can donate or not. Go to http://pacifism21.org and enter your email address. We'll take it from there. 

Why We REALLY Need Your Help Today

We are trying to raise $10,000 for a website built around a controversial idea: the idea that pacifism is relevant and essential in 2015. The word "pacifism" is not popular, and is often badly misunderstood. We have to change people's minds to raise $10,000, and that's why this is not an easy campaign to launch.

That's why we REALLY need your help today. If we can raise $10,000, it will be a major symbolic victory for the cause of pacifism itself, and you better believe we will let the world know that we've reached this amazing milestone! Pacifism is an "underdog" belief system in 2015. That means we'll have a great story to tell when a website for pacifism raises $10,000 on Indiegogo.

So, please help us reach our goal ... and become a part of our community as we all change the world together.

story:
Suntem pe platforma nationala Guvern24.md.


Viziune asupra conceptului de restaurare  a unicului monument de istorie si arhitectura din perioada interbelica realizat in stilul neoromanesc(Brincovenesc) in orasul Singerei. Se propune integrarea cladirii muzeului din Singerei si a scuarului din preajma Stelei memoriei, la fel monument de istorie, intr-un complex muzeal de atractie sociala. 

Donați, distribuiți și ajutați-ne să răspândim vestea mai departe!
Vă mulțumim!

Please support our hard work in rescuing, preserving and reactivating historical heritage!

One year ago, we started the rehabilitation a Museum of Singerei building. 


Sintem in campanie continuă pentru a strânge fonduri, am reușit să implicam comunitatea locală și mulți oameni generoși care ne  ajutata să ajungem la faza finală a restaurării, dar acest lucru este doar începutul.

As a continuous campaign to raise funds, we have succeeded to involve the local community and many generous people that helped us reach the final phase of the restoration, but this was only the beginning. 


Proiectul nostru are ca scop reactivarea sitului istoric al  ansamblului muzeal Sângerei, un centru de excelență, cu accent pe arhitectura tradițională, meșteșuguri și arte vizuale, clădirea si scuarul vor prezenta un ansamblu de provincie fermecător.

Our project for the reactivation of the historical site is Museum of Singerei ensamble, a center of excellence , with a focus on traditional architecture, crafts and visual arts, the buildings in the square present a charming provincial ensemble.




Muzeul va avea ca baza componentele memoriale, cu  funcție educațională,  o mare parte a proiectului e axata pe comunitatea locala și se propune implicarea copiilor si tinerilor din oras.

Muzeul va genera  oportunitati culturale și educaționale într-o zonă care are nevoie să fie revitalizata, în apropiere hotarelor dintre Moldova, România și Ucraina.

Prioritatea actuală este de a stringe fondurile necesare pentru a finaliza prima faza a proiectului, adică restaurarea tâmplăriei, acoperișului și fatadei. Acest lucru se estimeaza la 15.000 $.


The Museum will blend the memorial components with an educational function, as a big part of the project revolves around the local community and involving children in the area. 

The Museum will generate a cultural and educational opportunity to an area that needs to be revitalized, near the border between Moldova, Romania and Ukraine.


The priority now is to raise the funds needed to end the first phase of the project, that is the restoration of the carpentry, housetop and facing. This amounts to 15.000 $.


Vă rugăm să donați și ne ajută să păstram  o fila  a istoriei Moldovei!

Please donate and help us preserve an invaluable piece of moldavian history!


Unii oameni  nu pot contribui, utilizați atunci va rugam instrumentele de partajare Indiegogo!

Some people just can't contribute, use the Indiegogo share tools!


Stilul Arhitectural Neoromânesc: origini şi evoluţie

story:
WHO WE ARE

The Cispus Learning Center is a 68-acre campus, located in the Gifford Pinchot National Forest that provides a unique northwest outdoor learning environment for students. It is open 364 days a year to elementary, middle school and high school students for environmental and leadership education, for at-risk students using our challenge (ropes) course, and for any adult group supporting educational objectives.
The Cispus Learning Center is one of two sites of the AWSP Outdoor Learning Centers, a division of the Washington School Principals Education Foundation, a 501(c)(3) non-profit program of the Association of Washington School Principals (AWSP). What does that long list of titles mean for you? As an education-focused, non-profit organization, we are committed to providing affordable retreat opportunities for all audiences.
Since 1970, over 500,000 students, outdoor enthusiasts, and families have experienced its natural beauty and magic. Educational programs at Cispus Learning Center create future business leaders, public servants, policy makers, community leaders, game changers, and those who will positively impact the world.  

We believe that your contribution to this campaign is an investment in a better world tomorrow. 

 WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

One of the facility's limitations is its lack of diverse housing options. Currently, housing is limited to shared and open "cabin style" lodging which may not meet the diverse needs of many groups.

We are proposing a new building: Burley Mountain Dorm, a dormitory style housing facility where privacy can be an option. For large groups, this building will increase capacity and accessibility to better serve our increasingly diverse population. For smaller groups, Burley Mountain Dorm can serve as a more intimate, upscale option with increased privacy.

To make the Burley Mountain Dorm a reality, we need to raise $1.2 million.  This Indiegogo campaign will be the initial spark that will help us raise funds needed through multiple fundraising channels. 

Experience the magic with your friends and family

For the first time ever, we are opening up our magical "summer-camp" experience to the public through this Cispus Experience campaign. This is a unique opportunity for an unforgettable outdoor adventure with your friends and family.

100% of the money raised will be used to build the Burley Mountain Dorm.  Your tax deductible contribution will increase capacity and accessibility of all our educational programs for years to come.  Thank you in advance for your help!
story_txt:
WHO WE ARE
The Cispus Learning Center is a 68-acre campus, located in the Gifford Pinchot National Forest that provides a unique northwest outdoor learning environment for students. It is open 364 days a year to elementary, middle school and high school students for environmental and leadership education, for at-risk students using our challenge (ropes) course, and for any adult group supporting educational objectives.The Cispus Learning Center is one of two sites of the AWSP Outdoor Learning Centers, a division of the Washington School Principals Education Foundation, a 501(c)(3) non-profit program of the Association of Washington School Principals (AWSP). What does that long list of titles mean for you? As an education-focused, non-profit organization, we are committed to providing affordable retreat opportunities for all audiences.
Since 1970, over 500,000 students, outdoor enthusiasts, and families have experienced its natural beauty and magic. Educational programs at Cispus Learning Center create future business leaders, public servants, policy makers, community leaders, game changers, and those who will positively impact the world.  We believe that your contribution to this campaign is an investment in a better world tomorrow. 
 WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

One of the facility's
limitations is its lack of diverse housing options. Currently, housing is limited to shared and
open "cabin style" lodging which may not meet the diverse needs
of many groups.
We are proposing a new building: Burley
Mountain Dorm, a dormitory style housing facility where privacy can be
an option. For large groups, this building will increase capacity and accessibility to better serve our increasingly diverse population. For smaller groups,
Burley Mountain Dorm can serve as a more intimate, upscale
option with increased privacy.
To make the Burley Mountain Dorm a reality, we need to raise $1.2 million.  This Indiegogo campaign will be the initial spark that will help us raise funds needed through multiple fundraising channels.  


Experience the magic with your friends and family
 For the first time ever, we are opening up our magical "summer-camp" experience to the public through this Cispus Experience campaign. This is a unique opportunity for an unforgettable outdoor adventure with your friends and family.
100% of the money raised will be used to build the Burley Mountain Dorm.  Your tax deductible contribution will increase capacity and accessibility of all our educational programs for years to come.  Thank you in advance for your help!

story:
THIS PROJECT IS ESPECIALLY RELEVANT NOW WITH THE ESCALATION OF PREJUDICE AND THE INTENSIFYING VIOLENCE WITHIN ISRAEL...

For anyone who knows that our emotions -- joy, fear, love, anger, hate, longing compassion -- move us to act and react in this world; that our feelings can start conflicts and they can also end them, please help us fund this campaign...

We, the Together Beyond Words Organization (TBW) , are creating a pilot one year 200 hour Peace Leadership Training in Israel that will teach Arab and Jewish participants to create Safe Havens for transforming the pain that is fueling the conflict between Israelis and Palestinians into understanding and empathy....
The program is composed of three long weekends (90 hours total) with teachers from The Nederlands Instituut of Cordium Core Evolutionary, bi-weekly meetings with teachers from Together Beyond Words staff (110 hours), supervision from The Radical Aliveness Institute of California , and research about the effectiveness of our approach in collaboration with Liat Ayalon from the Expressive Arts Department of Haifa University.
To see how our program can work please watch our film: https://vimeo.com/119885376
Purpose of the project:
To create a powerful training experience that allows participants to learn and apply practical skills in holding complexity, deep diversity, emotional process, trauma and conflict in a way that facilitates deep healing and transformation.

20 Israeli Arab and Jewish social activists and peace builders will participate in the pilot program. They will learn the following skills:

  1. Handling strong feelings
  2. Moving and grounding energy
  3. Working with aggression
  4. Being vulnerable
  5. Being aware of cultural differences and the impact this has on work with deep emotional issues
  6. Practicing the ability to be in conflict as individuals around issues of gender, race and nationality while maintaining connection.



What the funding will be used for:

1. Transportation and hosting for six teachers coming from Europe to teach three times during the year for four days each time. The teachers are volunteering their teaching time.
2. Scholarships for some of the participants who are not able to pay for the cost of the program.
3. Accomodations for participants and staff during the 3 four day training workshops at Nes Ammim.
3. Program  administartion.

In the words of Julie Oxenberg...

·  "Achieving enduring security and sustaining peace are feats contingent upon matters of human psychology, far more so than military capacity... Military hardware can have a great deal of force but, on its own, lacks all force to cultivate trust, foster connection, heal deep-rooted enmity, dislodge hopelessness, instill self-worth, inspire love, or generate lasting peace." 

These are the skills we will be teaching the Arab and Jewish participants in our program.

story:
My name is Andy MacIsaac, I am a father, husband and resident of Shrewsbury, Massachusetts.  I am a big believer in the value of team sports for the lessons that can be taught about teamwork, perseverance and commitment. Unfortunately students with Intellectual Disabilities do not always have the opportunity to participate in school based team sports. A collaboration between Massachusetts Special Olympics and local Massachusetts school districts is working to change that with the launch of a Unified Basketball Program.

Unified Basketball enables student athletes with disabilities to participate on an interscholastic athletic team along with traditional student athletes in competition against other schools. With the Unified Program these athletes are competing for their school, wearing their school colors, and playing for school pride.

The State of Maine launched a Unified Basketball Program last year with much success. You can see a video about their program here. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RGQ1Tr4PpZ8

When I saw this video and the expression of pure joy and excitement that these athletes had wearing their school colors and playing with their teammates, I was motivated to see what it would take to bring such a program to Shrewsbury High School.

Shrewsbury High School has already participated in a Unified Track program with much success, and the staff would be very excited to extend the Unified Sports Program this year.  The only barrier is funding and that is why this campaign is being launched.

Our goal is to raise $5000 to cover programmatic costs like uniforms, transportation and officials. Every bit of support will help establish Unified Basketball at Shrewsbury High School for the next two years.  More importantly Unified Basketball at Shrewsbury High School will extend the opportunity for Student Athletes with Intellectual Disabilities to experience the joy and sense of accomplishment that competitive high school sports can bring.

So please make a donation, share this campaign through your social channels and join our Facebook group at: https://www.facebook.com/groups/SHSUnifiedbasketball/

Thank you for your support

Andy MacIsaac

Shrewsbury, MA

story:
Summary

The scope of this project is to launch a reading facilitation tool which aims to help people overcome reading difficulties. This does not in any way limit its potential commercial use. The idea is that the reader application can convert any document format into a traversable mind-map. Each node would have audio-visual cues to help the reader. 

The reader itself builds around a spritz-speed-reading like mechanism, where each node within the mind-map can be individually parsed and read. This allows the reader to comprehend the text being read in a more visually positioned way vis-à-vis the complete text.

This app would allow the user to read a specific text within a mind-map context, where large bulk text is converted into nodes, with each node potentially having children nodes, and so on. This text within the selected node can also link particular key words to hyperlinks outside of the document to provide a more multi-modal approach. The app can automatically read out loud highlighted selected text. Online translation of specific words or sub-text is also being considered.

Documents can be of any format or medium, even web sites. The way it works is as follows. Text is converted into a mind-map, which is in turn traversable, and each specific node is read by the reader. 

For example take http://www.lipsum.com/


The text within it is automatically converted into a mind-map, as per below.




By zooming into each mind-map, the user can decide at what point the reader is activated. The selected text below is processed by the reader automatically from left to right as per image below.


"There are many variations of passages of Lorem Ipsum available, but the majority have suffered alteration in some form, by injected humour, or randomised words which don't look even slightly believable."


The reader can link key words to other sites, audio-visual media etc.. Translate media into various languages etc.. This functionality will be particularly helpful with people who have attention disorders, dyslexia and other learning/reading disabilities

What We Need 

We need funding primarily to fund 2 developers for the duration of the project. This should take approximately 1 year. I shall myself be working on this project on a pro-bono basis. For me this is a very personal endeavor. 

The project itself can be divided into two development phases:
  1. Complete the application to run on traditional Windows OS Environment.
  2. Complete the application to run on Android and OS.
A final third phase is the actual roll-out. At each step the backers will be asked to test out beta or trial versions and give in their feedback. Like this, it will not be just crowd funding but also introduce the idea of crowd testing.
The funding request being made is relatively small, so it is unlikely that we will have unused funds. 

The Impact

If this project is a success than traditional reading is going to be hyped with audio visual technology. Can you imagine the impact of such a technology? This could literally be a game changer in the education sector, and in day-to-day usage of web pages and e-books.

Let's give it a go together! The education system all over the world is letting numerous children behind. Let's give everyone a chance to make it in life. We might not succeed in full, but we owe it to ourselves to try.

Risks & Challenges

The main risk of backing this project is that even when completed it might never make it to main stream markets and just be a little known tool. This is where you come in. Help us by not only backing this project, but by making sure that people get to download it.

I can guarantee I will put all my energy and ensure that all the people that join in will do the same. I am a seasoned software developer and recently completed my PhD in Computer Science. I know the nature of the business and how this all works. More information about me can be found on my linked in profile: 

https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=16393229

Other Ways You Can Help

This is not a project for profit per se. The funding being asked for is primarily to pay developers to develop this application in full and have it available on multiple platforms. Even if the idea might sound simple, a lot of work needs to be done to ensure cross-compatibility on multiple browsers, operating systems and devices. Eventually via marketing or other payment mechanisms which will be introduced depending on the evolving model we will be able to become self-sufficient.

Help us by spreading the word, helping us develop and test this application! Remember that with any help you give us you might help someone with reading disability to go on and further his/her education.

story:
Short Summary

Is There A Need For Court Reform?

My name is Glen Aaron and I’m a retired attorney living in West Texas with my wife, Jane, and our much-loved dogs, Sanger, Gandhi, and Messpot.

The reason for my campaign, Justice For All, came about this way. My last client, a 75-year-old Wall Street Journal heiress and her 50-year-old third husband, a gay interior decorator and what transpired after her death that brought about my two-year incarceration in a federal penitentiary.

While there, my cellmate for 13 months was Colonel George Trofimoff. In exchange for telling me his life story and what caused a high-ranking military officer to be imprisoned for the rest of his life for alleged, but unfounded, acts of espionage, I agreed to help him get a new trial.

What  l learned from George and from studying the full trial transcript he kept with him convinced me that this man, a man who loved his adopted country of America, had been wrongfully convicted.

What my Justice For All campaign is really about is the First Amendment right of free speech and the duty of transparency in jury trials.

The recent book, Unfair, by professor Adam Benforado, (Amazon) sets forth a problem most people don't know about -- the breakdown in our judicial systems, both state and federal. This is very important to every freedom-loving American.

 My book, Observer: The Colonel George Trofimoff Story, the tale of America’s highest ranking military officer convicted of spying, well exemplifies what professor Benforado talks about in his book. It is a true story, one that took me ten years to investigate, write, and complete.

With your help, I’ll use the money to market my book widely. You see, it’s my belief that the citizens of three countries -- America, England, and Germany -- need to know what happened in this trial, and the only way that can now happen is to bring this book to their attention.

Further, with your help, we can educate citizens in these countries to what is happening to free speech and judicial transparency.

What We Need & What You Get

I’ve carefully estimated what it will cost to market the Colonel George Trofimoff Story, and that amount is $7,500. You may know this yourself that marketing one’s book – or any business venture -- is a labor of love yet a labor-intensive work. Some of the money will be used to reach radio show hosts, following the steps detailed in Alex Carroll’s marketing guide. Those steps include printing materials and mailing costs to at least one hundred radio show hosts.

For your part in helping this happen, I want to gift you with Book 3 of The Prison Trilogy: Prison People; the Prison Experience. In it, you’ll read about the people who were a part of my prison existence for those two years, what they were like, and why they were there. It’s an eye-opener, one that will surprise, entertain, and sadden you.

If I do not meet my monetary goal, I will use whatever funds were donated to do as much as I can to get the word out about this important-for-true-democracy-seekers issue.

The Impact

We all like to watch movies like Suits and Boston Legal, where the main characters like James Spader and Michael Macht tear the other side apart with brilliant legal arguments that win the case. Fun Stuff! But in the real world, when we are caught up in an unwanted legal battle, no such heroes seem to be available, because the procedual rules tie their hands.  Here is where the legal system needs to be repaired. Read carefully and take note:

My campaign starts with the premise that an author may have written the next great American novel, but if people don't know about it, it can't be read. In George Trofimoff's story, the expose is not only pertinent to Americans it also needs to be known about in Great Britain and Germany, because many of the events occurred there and will be of interest.

Throughout Colonel George Trofimoff’s trial in a Florida federal court, the media denied him any critical analysis in favor of sensationalism. The Department of Justice was the reverse of transparent by using a former KGB spy, on the take, to help convict the Colonel, and hiding -- or at least not allowing access to -- potentially exonerating evidence. While the defense attorney was asleep to procedural  misjustice in order to earn his court-appointed stipend, the federal judge continued to allow the prosecutor to manipulate the evidence.

While my book is self-published nonfiction because I chose not to deal with the traditional publishing firms, the book is well-edited by editor Natalie Rotunda. The story covers the life of Colonel George Trofimoff, the dishonest FBI sting, the overreach of federal prosecution at trial, and the malpractice of the defense lawyer.

To publish and fund efficient distribution, as well as to sufficiently market the book to let people know about the story, is expensive. I am asking for your help to fund these elements of self-publishing so I can get the word out.

The message of the successful release of Unfair by professor Benforado demonstrates the interest in the problem of judicial dysfunction. The story of Colonel George Trofimoff demonstrates how this occurs in real life, in real courtroom drama.

story:
"An ordinary person can create extraordinary change" - Adam Braun, CEO of Pencils of Promise

Why the education system needs our attention

When the earthquake struck, it not only claimed the lives and homes of thousands, but also spread hopelessness within Nepalese families. Children were left without schools, and despite efforts that helped build temporary facilities, many were unable to attend due to the needs of their own family. 

Already, the public education system, especially in rural areas, face tremendous challenges such as lack of funding, poor infrastructure, lack of parental awareness, and low quality education. Most of the funds the government provides go into the salary for the teachers, who struggle to provide high quality education due to lack of motivation. Hence, with minimal funding in other areas, schools are unable to provide attractive learning environments for students, let alone stationary and materials. Families in the rural areas earn a monthly salary of $40-50, and parents do not prioritize their child's education, especially in the post-earthquake situation. This explains why the number of student enrollment in public schools is decreasing every year along with their SLC result (graduation test).

With $3,500, we can change the live of these children

Our passion to help fulfill the dreams of these students through education reform led to the creation of the Model School Project. This initiative works to provide quality education in public schools through establishing a creative learning environment by focusing on three areas: art, music and sports while establishing quality teaching.

What we are currently doing

Freedom to Learn, a UK based Charity, and ERSF were huge supporters in kicks-starting the idea of Model School Project in Kushadevi Higher Secondary School, and they have also been a great help for many other initiatives undertaken here. Currently, we tested the idea in the pre-primary and primary levels of Kushadevi Higher Secondary School, where the "model classes" are taught by youths who are studying in the +2 or college levels of the same premises.  Not only have we recruited and trained the volunteer youths, we also transformed the classroom into a creative idea-generating machine, where students engage in musical activities and sporting events in a colorful and appealing environment. The results have been exceedingly positive. More students are attending the "Model School" and are motivated to learn. After we launched this campaign, StArt International, a German based organization came and worked for a week in Model School conducting different creative activities that encouraged our campaign.

We have already talked to and gained the support of the headmasters of the public schools, the School Management Committee, and the parents of the community. In addition, a large number of youths pursuing their bachelors in education have expressed high interest in volunteering. Our model classes transformed the classroom, keeping the same curriculum while altering the environment and teaching methods. We want to extend this initiative to the more rural communities, where children are suffering the most. In order to do this, we need your help.

The impact you can make

100% of the profits will go towards providing quality education to the children in the Kushadevi VDC through expanding the Model School Project to the more rural communities. 

With $3,500, we are able to establish the "Model School" foundation in the pre-primary and primary levels for 2 public schools: Phulchwoki Lower Secondary School and Suryajyoti Lower Secondary School. The funds will go towards three main objectives:

  1. Creating an attractive classroom setting with "art" - students will be taught to think creatively and decorate their classrooms. Art class will be held once a week, and each term will culminate with a community-wide art show
  2. Establishing a jovial atmosphere with "music" - students will have music classes on a weekly bases, where they are taught to sing, dance, and play simple instruments
  3. Creating a collaborative environment through "sports" - weekly sports education are held in preparation for the bi-annual school-wide sporting competition, where the entire community will participate in this collaborative event

The funds will be used to purchase supplies and stationary, host community and after-school events, and train volunteer teachers. We will be purchasing new art materials and musical instruments, as well as hosting classes in those two areas once a week. Some amount will also be spent on hosting sports competition.


With $5,000, we will be able to expand the initiative to all of our target schools, adding in Bhaleshwor Higher Secondary School. 

With $10,000, we will be able to expand the Model School Project to three additional schools in Kushadevi VDC and Panauti Municipality.

With $20,000, we will be able to explore hostel infrastructure. Some students have a 3-hour commute to school, and this idea will allow them to stay nearby, allowing participation in more school activities. 

Every dollar counts, and YOU can make this possible!

What can you get from this?

Aside from the deepest gratitude from teachers, children, and parents, we have lined up a list of rewards to thank you for your support! You are DIRECTLY impacting the future of these children.

From postcards and handwritten thank you letters, to authentic Nepali Masala tea, handmade bracelets and unique artwork, to a FREE all-inclusive trip to Nepal, we want you to know just how special you are and how much each contribution means to us. 

See the "Perks" for more details.

Who are we?

Shree Krishna Thapa, founder of the Rural Community Foundation (RCF) Nepal, has dedicated his life to the education system of his Kushadevi VDC, turning down high-paying careers and opportunities to relocate to more developed countries. He was originally based in Kathmandu, working in the education space of a well-developed organization. However, after the earthquake, over 1,800 houses in his Kushadevi VDC collapsed, including his own. Seeing the devastation of his community, he chose to stay and help rebuild its spirit, starting first with its education. Freedom to Learn, a UK based Charity and the ERSF have been supporting his initiatives here. 

Molly Liu, a current student at the University of Pennsylvania Wharton School, has been deeply involved in social impact initiatives and international development. Her passion has motivated her to travel independently to the Gulf countries, where she worked to understand the root cause of the hardships of Nepalese migrant workers. This ultimately led her to Nepal where she realized the core issue lies in the education system. After visiting multiple public schools and meeting the students at Kushadevi, she was inspired to provide them with better programs and support.

Their overlapping passions led to the formation of an everlasting friendship and the expansion of the Model School Project.

Risks & Challenges

We have already gained the support of the headmaster, school management committee and the parents; therefore, implementation is not an issue and can take place immediately. However, the impact of this initiative may take some time to fully realize, but we guarantee that all the funds will be dedicated to fulfilling the needs of the children. 

In the rural areas, a lot of houses have been completely destroyed, and families are dealing with incredible difficulties, but we will be collaborating with them and taking into account all their concerns.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word would mean the world to us. You can share our video with your friends and raise awareness of how the earthquake has affected the lives of many.

We would also appreciate being put in touch with anyone you know who is interested in volunteering or would like to learn more about this initiative.
story_txt:
"An ordinary person can create extraordinary change" - Adam Braun, CEO of Pencils of Promise

Why the education system needs our attention When the earthquake struck, it not only claimed the lives and homes of thousands, but also spread hopelessness within Nepalese families. Children were left without schools, and despite efforts that helped build temporary facilities, many were unable to attend due to the needs of their own family. 



Already, the public education system, especially in rural areas, face tremendous challenges such as lack of funding, poor infrastructure, lack of parental awareness, and low quality education. Most of the funds the government provides go into the salary for the teachers, who struggle to provide high quality education due to lack of motivation. Hence, with minimal funding in other areas, schools are unable to provide attractive learning environments for students, let alone stationary and materials. Families in the rural areas earn a monthly salary of $40-50, and parents do not prioritize their child's education, especially in the post-earthquake situation. This explains why the number of student enrollment in public schools is decreasing every
year along with their SLC result (graduation test).

With $3,500, we can change the live of these children

story:
CESFA (Saint Francis Education Centre) is a 25-year-old school in the inner regions of Brazil – i.e. in the small city of Monte Dourado, in the state of Pará. The school services range from childhood education classes until long distance undergraduate degree. And it is directly accountable for the education, life and success of the city and people there for the past 25 years.

With the economy crisis aggravating in the country, the inner regions of the country have suffered the most. Today, the school faces severe financial difficulties and could cease to exist. Nevertheless, it would be truly sad to loose such quality education in such poor region and to see the entire life of a hard work couple that devoted 25 years of their lives to educate child simply disappear.

It is time to reward such hard work and perseverance!!! It is time for you to make a difference!!!

Let’s please help fund it! Every help and support are welcome.

The entirety of the fund raised shall be used to pay the school’s debt and to keep it on business.

---

“The eagle can live over 70 years. But to reach that age, at 40, it has to make a difficult decision: To die ... or to face a deep and painful process of renovation that lasts about 5 months, plucking her old claws and feathers. And then, with beak, claws and feathers renewed, the eagle returns to live more fully other decades." (BAKHTIN, 1992).

---

Let me share the background of CESFA so you guys can check the evolution of this amazing school:

*  1990-1999 - CESFA was founded and started early childhood education;

* 2000 - CESFA was accredited by the Resolutions 322/2000, Certificate No. 16/2008, as well as by Resolutions No. 254, 261, 262, 263, 264, 265/2010, i.e. from basic to professional education.

* 2000 – Started 1st grade of elementary education;

* 2001 - Started 2nd to 4th grade of elementary education;

* 2002 - Started 5th to 8th grade of elementary education;

* 2003 - Started 1st year of high school and partnership with University of the State of Santa Catarina (UDESC);

* 2004 - Started 2nd and 3rd year of high school;

* 2005 - Partnership with International School of Curitiba (Facinter) and Brazilian Institute of Graduate Studies and Extension (IBPEX);

* 2007 - Partnership with University of the State of Tocantins (UNITINS);

* 2008 - Partnership with Colégio Ideal de Belém; reaches 92% of approvals in entrance exams of public and private institutions.

* 2009/2010 - Set up technical courses of Industrial Automation, Mining, Chemical, Electrical and Forestry;

* 2011 - Partnership with University of North of Paraná (UNOPAR), considered the best national institution for distance education.

* 2012 - Partnership with Rede Pitágoras for basic education material.

* Current – Faces financial difficulties;

---

story:
As the homeschooling  mother and teacher of 4 wonderful children, I have learned that kids need to be able to see the bigger picture and view themselves as part of a global society.   Travel and particularly international travel opens the student to thinking about how they fit into that  picture and how as unique individuals they can contribute  to the improvement of the world .   I wanted to give excellent youth from families who could not, other wise, afford to travel, the same opportunity for travel, learning and personal development as youth from more privileged background.

You may be asking yourself what are some actual advantages. Students who have traveled with EF Tours have already answered the question for us: 

  • Nearly 100% have gone on to earn a BA or higher.
  • About 80% maintain a college GPA above 3.0 & half earn a GPA between 3.5 and 4.0.
  • More than 80% strengthened communication and problem solving skills.
  • 85% are more interested in studying abroad in college.
  • Nearly 90% continue to study foreign language in college.
  • 100% say they think about not just their own specific city, or state or country, but are more interested, aware and active in the well being of other countries and people.

Why Costa Rica you may ask?

  • Its beautiful with a diverse ecosystem that the students will be exploring at great length during the 9 day tour.
  • Spanish is the national language which is also the language which most highschool students take as a foreign language requirements, giving them practice speaking and hearing the language.
  • The students attend  morning session at Costa Rican school to experience the educational workings in another country.
  • The trip to Costa Rica is one of the best deals  to an exotic location for this trip length.

How will this work:

Currently there are 8 students interested in travel abroad.  The funds requested will pay for 14 travelers, expedited passports for all participants and travel cash of 90 per student.  There are six spaces available for student travel if our funding goal is reached.    

  • Each student will need to  be between the ages of 12 & 18.
  • Each student will write an essay on how this experience will change and enhance their lives. 
  • Each student must have a letter of reference stating their outstanding qualities as a person.
  • One parent must write a letter of financial hardship, outlining the financial situation of the family.
  • Myself and three other educators will read the essays and make selections. The students will then be notified. Paperwork will be signed and each student will be walked through the process of passport acquisition and preparing for a trip abroad.

 

Please help me to help these students expand their view of the world. 

Please watch the videos  of the Costa Rica tour to get an idea of what the students will be enjoying and we will be adding pictures of the students engaged in all types of fundraising activities to help with their own cause.

story:
What is Math Tutor?

Math tutor is a newly developing iOS and soon to come Android app that enables students to learn study math in a way they can enjoy. Math Tutor solves problems to crucial and challenging mathematical topics and shows the steps how to do it. Now you may ask yourself, "isn't this cheating?" or "Isn't this app like Symbolab?" 

And to answer those questions, No. This app is not to let students see the answers and help them do their homework the "easy way" but rather as a tool to walk them though an equation to help them understand a topic they did not get in class or rusty on something. After each problem, in order for the student to solve another problem they must answer a multiple choice question to test their knowledge about the topic. And to answer the question about Symbolab, it is like it in away but also very different. The app will allow students to take a picture of an equation and solve it based on the keywords and equation given. Math Tutor will also have a chemistry function (a later function) and a physics function (also a later function) which allows students to see how to balance chemistry equations, or do kinematic equations by plugging in a few variables. Also coming soon in later updates after the release of the app, are SAT and AP style mathematics practice tests which will show the user what they need to work on! 

 

Currently, the layout is very                                 The current functions the 

basic and easy to use.                                            app can do include Algebra,

                                                                                        Trig, and Calculus!



Perhaps the coolest and most innovative feature is the ability to take a picture of any equation and have it solve it. The program looks for keywords from an algorithm currently in progress which the user can use on any type of problem. It doesn't matter if it is typed or hand written, the program will still be able to understand it!!! 

About (me) the Developer

I am Joshua Baney. I am a Senior high school student who loves Science, Technology and Mathematics. I grew up with computers and I love to write code and build electronics. I got this idea for Math Tutor after a few peers I tutor from my school wanted me to help them, and for a project to submit in addition with my Massachusetts Institute of Technology  (MIT) application.  Because my busy schedule constantly caused me to have conflicting times with my peers I tutor, decided to come up with an app that will do the tutoring for me! It will show how to do math problems and give them a problem afterwards to see how they are advancing. In my opinion, Math Tutor can be another great resource, like Kahn Academy to let students have access to a resource that would typically cost an arm and a leg such as a tutor for absolutely no cost. Thats right, completely free! That is, if I can fund the development of this app. 

Here is a little bit of a background about me and my skills and interests:

-I was an intern with University of Maryland, Baltimore County as a software engineering intern to develop software to work with Beagle Bones and instruments I've built to help scientist and chemistry students collect data from experiments.

-I am fluent in C, C++, Java, Python, and MatLAB languages. 

-I like to develop software and programs that can help people's lives.

-I also enjoy filmmaking and producing YouTube channel's for people. 

-I am a huge music enthusiast. I love to play the Clarinet, and make Electronic Dance Music. I took AP Music Theory, and I love to compose music. My favorite bands, composers and artist include: Fall Out Boy, All Time Low, Skrillex, Flux Pavilion, Twenty One Pilots, Imagine Dragons, The Bleachers, John Williams and Beethoven. (my list can go on and on and on....)

       

Me looking all snazzy and stuff...                      Jimmy and I after our school's 

                                                                                   pep rally. Go class of 2016! 

 

- Because of my interest I am developing a program for the computer platforms that allows someone to sing or hum a melody and detects the key signature they are in and then converts it to musical notation on a music staff to help songwriters get their ideas out! 

-My favorite sport is lacrosse but I love to kayak and snowboard whenever possible. 

- I want to study Electrical Engineering and Computer Science and minor in Mathematics. Hopefully I can study this at MIT (if I get in) but other school's I am looking at include Rice, Cornell, University of Maryland and Johns Hopkins. 


The Impact of how this will help students learn Math

For a lot of people, math is challenging due to the material not being engaging. Also, coming from a school where I had a bad math teacher, I was not prepared as well for upper level math classes such as Pre-Calculus or AP Calculus. I love math but I do know how it feels to not learn something then be expected to know it in later math courses. This tool will help guide students to better understand how the answers to their math problems derived from. This is also useful because if a student does not like the teaching style of a teacher, they will not get the material being taught to them. After the official release of the app, I anticipate of adding 'themes' to the app to make the user feel more connected with it. These themes will include different ways of showing how the answer is done by the user's style of learning (if the user is a hands on learner, a visual learner, or learns better from listening). This will also be taken a step further with the ability to choose 'interests'. These interests will make studying more relatable to the user. For example, if a user is interested in science, word problems that are linked to science or use some application of a math problem in a science topic will appear for the user so they can do problems they can relate to and interest them. Or maybe the user is interested in sports... word problems will be generated to suit that student. 

Another feature that will come soon is a forums feature that allows students to connect to each other and get help from other peers and discuss different topics in math and science. In addition to that, there will be AP and SAT style pre-tests to show the user what they should work on and develop a study plan of action for them to take. 

Challenges

I want this app to be completely free. No ads. No fees. Problem is, I cannot code all this alone. I need to hire developers and programmers to help me write code for this amazing app and other apps to come. 

I need to pay the developers and programmers and that will take 70% of the money I am raising. So far, I spent 300+ man hours on this app and I am still developing it. I am also having problems developing the camera application for I cannot develop a decent algorithm to convert the picture to text. However, I am friends with a computer scientist who would love to help... If they get paid. I also want to implement different versions of this app across different devices. I want EVERYONE to have access to this app, not just Apple users. 

I also need to develop a website and forums. 

Finally, I need to pay for legal fees such as Copyrights and agreements to other organizations and developers with similar ideas to make it even better. 


IF I WANT THE APP TO HAVE ALL FEATURES AND HAVE THE APP BE COMPLETELY FREE AND WITH NO ADS, THE FUNDING GOAL MUST BE MET!

Of course, the majority of the app will be free, but we may not be able to develop a lot of the features we want, put ads on the app for revenue and offer premium features. We don't want to do that!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share this Indiegogo account with your friends and family! 

https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/fd5b2026
