basic and easy to use.                                            app can do include Algebra,
                                                                                        Trig, and Calculus!




Perhaps the coolest and most innovative feature is the ability to take a picture of any equation and have it solve it. The program looks for keywords from an algorithm currently in progress which the user can use on any type of problem. It doesn't matter if it is typed or hand written, the program will still be able to understand it!!! 
   
About (me) the Developer
I am Joshua Baney. I am a Senior high school student who loves Science, Technology and Mathematics. I grew up with computers and I love to write code and build electronics. I got this idea for Math Tutor after a few peers I tutor from my school wanted me to help them, and for a project to submit in addition with my Massachusetts Institute of Technology  (MIT) application.  Because my busy schedule constantly caused me to have conflicting times with my peers I tutor, decided to come up with an app that will do the tutoring for me! It will show how to do math problems and give them a problem afterwards to see how they are advancing. In my opinion, Math Tutor can be another great resource, like Kahn Academy to let students have access to a resource that would typically cost an arm and a leg such as a tutor for absolutely no cost. Thats right, completely free! That is, if I can fund the development of this app. 
Here is a little bit of a background about me and my skills and interests:
-I was an intern with University of Maryland, Baltimore County as a software engineering intern to develop software to work with Beagle Bones and instruments I've built to help scientist and chemistry students collect data from experiments.
-I am fluent in C, C++, Java, Python, and MatLAB languages. 
-I like to develop software and programs that can help people's lives.
-I also enjoy filmmaking and producing YouTube channel's for people. 
-I am a huge music enthusiast. I love to play the Clarinet, and make Electronic Dance Music. I took AP Music Theory, and I love to compose music. My favorite bands, composers and artist include: Fall Out Boy, All Time Low, Skrillex, Flux Pavilion, Twenty One Pilots, Imagine Dragons, The Bleachers, John Williams and Beethoven. (my list can go on and on and on....)


       
Me looking all snazzy and stuff...                      Jimmy and I after our school's 
                                                                                   pep rally. Go class of 2016! 
 
- Because of my interest I am developing a program for the computer platforms that allows someone to sing or hum a melody and detects the key signature they are in and then converts it to musical notation on a music staff to help songwriters get their ideas out! 
-My favorite sport is lacrosse but I love to kayak and snowboard whenever possible. 
    - I want to study Electrical Engineering and Computer Science and minor in Mathematics. Hopefully I can study this at MIT (if I get in) but other school's I am looking at include Rice, Cornell, University of Maryland and Johns Hopkins. 

The Impact of how this will help students learn Math For a lot of people, math is challenging due to the material not being engaging. Also, coming from a school where I had a bad math teacher, I was not prepared as well for upper level math classes such as Pre-Calculus or AP Calculus. I love math but I do know how it feels to not learn something then be expected to know it in later math courses. This tool will help guide students to better understand how the answers to their math problems derived from. This is also useful because if a student does not like the teaching style of a teacher, they will not get the material being taught to them. After the official release of the app, I anticipate of adding 'themes' to the app to make the user feel more connected with it. These themes will include different ways of showing how the answer is done by the user's style of learning (if the user is a hands on learner, a visual learner, or learns better from listening). This will also be taken a step further with the ability to choose 'interests'. These interests will make studying more relatable to the user. For example, if a user is interested in science, word problems that are linked to science or use some application of a math problem in a science topic will appear for the user so they can do problems they can relate to and interest them. Or maybe the user is interested in sports... word problems will be generated to suit that student. 
Another feature that will come soon is a forums feature that allows students to connect to each other and get help from other peers and discuss different topics in math and science. In addition to that, there will be AP and SAT style pre-tests to show the user what they should work on and develop a study plan of action for them to take. 
    Challenges I want this app to be completely free. No ads. No fees. Problem is, I cannot code all this alone. I need to hire developers and programmers to help me write code for this amazing app and other apps to come. 
I need to pay the developers and programmers and that will take 70% of the money I am raising. So far, I spent 300+ man hours on this app and I am still developing it. I am also having problems developing the camera application for I cannot develop a decent algorithm to convert the picture to text. However, I am friends with a computer scientist who would love to help... If they get paid. I also want to implement different versions of this app across different devices. I want EVERYONE to have access to this app, not just Apple users. 
I also need to develop a website and forums. 
Finally, I need to pay for legal fees such as Copyrights and agreements to other organizations and developers with similar ideas to make it even better. 

IF I WANT THE APP TO HAVE ALL FEATURES AND HAVE THE APP BE COMPLETELY FREE AND WITH NO ADS, THE FUNDING GOAL MUST BE MET!
Of course, the majority of the app will be free, but we may not be able to develop a lot of the features we want, put ads on the app for revenue and offer premium features. We don't want to do that!!!
    Other Ways You Can Help Spread the word! Share this Indiegogo account with your friends and family! 


https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/fd5b2026

story:
About Fresh Films!

Through the lens of movie-making, Fresh Films connects with teens to build leadership, tech skills and confidence to allow teens to realize any dream is within their grasp!   

Watch the Movie Trailer here for the newest film starring Steve Guttenberg, featuring Harry Lennix and created with over 250 teens working on-set.  

The film will be released at the WHITE HOUSE SCIENCE FAIR this Spring!!  (And on DVD & theaters too!)

Fresh Films teens rotate through all film positions while being mentored by the pros.  Their Emmy quality family content (TV episodes, films, shorts) is released in theaters, on DVD, on TV, at schools and internationally with funds from distribution reinvested to support more youth programming.

Teens call Fresh Films “Awesome,” “Best Week Ever,” and “Life Changing,” but at its core, Fresh Films engages teens to become creative problem solvers, hard-workers, team players and technically-adept leaders all through the lens of film.  The experience connects with teens in a fun and unique way, which is especially relevant for those teens not transformed by traditional coursework.


Show Your Support with a Donation!

This is our annual fundraiser for Fresh Films. Our goal is to raise funds to continue to generate program opportunities that empower youth.  We never require teens to have previous experience to participate, and our programs – thanks to donations and grants – are always free. 

By pre-ordering a DVD ($29), or putting your name in the credit ($79) or making a donation of any amount ($1-$1,000), you can help us keep our programs free for teens and allow us to engage more and more teens each year! 


Current film created by teens:

Our newest Fresh film, Traveling Without Moving, is a science adventure film about three teens whose science project is the key to finding their missing parents in another world! 

Over 250 teens from New Jersey to Colorado worked on-set or in the editing bay for the project.  Teens came in from of a variety of schools and youth clubs including Chicago Public Schools, Aurora Public Schools, Boys & Girls Clubs, and local youth organizations like Triple Threat & Little Black Pearl. Filmed on campus at Aurora University with many teens staying on campus in the dorms, many teens also got their first look at college life.

The science in the film is based on the physics of wormholes and physics theory ‘Many Worlds.’  Scientists from NASA, University of Chicago, Adler Planetarium & SW Research Institute helped us with the science in the film.  

The film will premiere in 2016, showcase at the White House Science Fair, at schools and theaters with every dollar going back to support youth !  

Celebrities in the film:  

Steve Guttenberg (3 Men and a Baby, Cocoon, Police Academy, Diner): Just on The Today Show for his new SyFy channel film, Lavalantula, Steve has a star on the Hollywood walk of fame, and is a huge supporter of youth. He is the founder of Guttenhouse, an apartment complex in south Los Angeles which houses and mentors young people no longer in foster care status. In Traveling Without Moving, Steve is playing the lead role of the villain Verstag.  

Harry Lennix (The Blacklist, Chiraq, Batman vs. Superman): Harry Lennix, stars as FBI head Harold Cooper on The Blacklist, who is also acting in Spike Lee’s highly anticipated film Chi-raq and the upcoming Batman vs Superman, is an internationally renowned Shakespearean scholar, and has his own production company, Exponent Media. Harry, who worked as a music teacher in Chicago before his career as an actor, will be playing the role of a high school principal. When asked to comment on the Fresh Films program, he stated, "Your project sounds absolutely great! Especially to a former school teacher like me."

Bill Foster (US Congressman): Representing the 11th District of Illinois, which is home to Aurora University, where the movie was filmed, Bill Foster is the only physicist in Congress. Before his political career, Foster was a particle accelerator designer at Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory (Fermilab). There he was a member of the team that discovered the top quark, the heaviest known form of matter.  Congressman Foster has a cameo in the film and is featured in behind-the-scenes extras about the science in the film.


Film Release Spring 2016

The film will premiere in 2016, with a screening at the White House Science Fair!  You'll also see it at select theaters and on-tour at 50 middle and high-schools where we also engage teens in the technology and science behind the film as part of an interactive assembly. DVD, VOD, download and the international market will follow the screenings.  Proceeds from distribution are re-invested in the program, and charities that host their own screening keep 80% of proceeds!

How Teens Can Get Involved!

For Summer 2016, Fresh Films will travel to 8-cities to engage teens in the creative, collaborative and technical process of film. Then in Fall 2016, teens will once again work in the editing bay, while we also deliver technology grants (and DVDs) to teachers.   Teens can apply at www.fresh-films.com (no experience or fees required!)

IMPACT - every dollar you give transforms teens!

Fresh Films transforms teens, giving them relevant technical and career skills, and the ability to work together, make decisions, problem solve and lead a project through to completion. Communities gain a realization that teenagers can contribute effectively and positively to our community when given the right guidance, resources and mentorship.

A recent teen filmmaker was accepted to University of Rochester in March 2015. The acceptance letter called out her internship with Dreaming Tree (Fresh Films) as the reason the counselors accepted her for admission!  Letters from parents and teachers confirm the transformative experience teens receive and how they see a positive change in the teens' attitude, focus and enthusiasm towards school and college!  We thank you in advance for your support of teens through FRESH FILMS!

story:
What?

The Empathy Gap will be a digital learning platform packed with inspiring and practical educational materials with the power to change the world, person by person.


The digital platform will be global in nature and provide content characterized by being:

  • Easy-to-use
  • Inspiring
  • Practical/hands-on
  • Accessible


Who?

In short, we will deliver a leading-edge empathy academy for the many people.

More specifically, the materials can be used to teach empathy in:

  1. Schools - equipping teachers with invaluable tools to easily integrate empathy into the curriculum anywhere from kindergarten to high school and university
  2. Homes - equipping parents with the ability to proactively work with their children in developing and reinforcing one of the most essential life skills
  3. Workplaces - not only schools experience widespread bullying and aggression, but similar patterns can be found among adults in workplaces worldwide. HR departments and managers will be equipped with the means to ensure the creation of empathy-driven work environments. Furthermore, nurturing empathy for key stakeholders can be the road to success for marketing departments. 
  4. Prisons / jails - our objective is to also successfully penetrate the world of prison treatments to ensure prison caretakers and therapists apply progressive ways to evolve empathy in prison inmates. We seek to increase the level of success of persons reintegrating into society after having served a sentence.

Empathy is an absolutely fundamental life skill for any human being to be socially and emotionally competent in a blooming society. 

 

The Impact

We seek your support in making The Empathy Gap a reality. Our objectives are something that we take very seriously and we truly believe in strengthening people's empathy as a route to make society bloom.

Whatever financial support you are able and willing to provide, we will be immensely thankful and will let you know of how things progress up until the launch of the premiere empathy academy for the many people.

 

The Founder

My name is Magnus Kähler and I am the founder of The Empathy Gap. I am a Swedish native but have lived in different parts of the world - United States, England, Germany and Brazil. 

During the past 20 years, I have been working as a global brand strategist for a wide range of the world's leading brands. In my work, I have applied empathy as a way to gain an in-depth understanding of people from different cultures and all walks of life. 

I have seen close-hand the power of empathy and empathy as the driving force behind making a true change in people's lives. 

This is my passion and my objective is to make a lasting impact on the world via The Empathy Gap.

Please, join me and support me in my quest to make this a reality. I will be open and transparent about the progress I am making and make you feel a part of the journey.

story:
"Hasta ahora la educación ha ido dando "manotazos de ahogado" con respecto al estímulo que nuestro cerebro requiere para desarrollar plenamente su potencial.  Hoy ya tenemos conocimientos claves respecto a lo que estimula, estanca o empobrece nuestro potencial cerebral. Por lo tanto se necesita diseñar una vía planificada, expresa y lúcida para educar lo más importante que tiene todo ser humano, su cerebro.  Eso es el Proyecto Leo."   
"To date education has been "treading superficial waters" with regards to the stimulation our brain requires in order to fully develop its potential. And now, today, we already have key understanding regarding what stimulates, detains or impoverishes our cerebral capacity. Therefore, we need to design a laid out path, explicit and lucid, so as to educate the most important human asset: his brain. This is the LEO Project"
Juan Manuel Heredia. Coach Corporativo

"Durante mucho tiempo sabemos que lo único que puede hacer crecer nuestra sociedad es la educación. Todos lo dicen pero pocos hacen algo . Sin embargo, qué clase de educación puede garantizar un cambio positivo en la sociedad? Cómo hacer para que la educación desarrolle todo el potencial del cerebro? Cómo lograr que nuestro cerebro aumente nuestro nivel de conciencia ? El proyecto LEO apunta a dar respuestas a estas urgentes preguntas. Conozco a Ricardo hace más de 25 años y he visto cómo ha desarrollado esta propuesta educativa. Ya es momento que el mundo reciba este conocimiento."

"It has been a long time now, that we know that the only factor that can make our society grow is education. Everybody says this but few do something about it. Nevertheless, what kind of education can guarantee a positive change in society? How can we make education develop all of the potential in the brain? How can we have our brain increase our level of consciousness? Project LEO aims to answer these urgent questions. I know Ricardo more than 25 years and I have seen him develop this educational proposal. It is now time for the world to receive this knowledge."

Javier Echevarria. Coach Corporativo

For more information you can also visit / para más informacion tambien pueden visitar la pagina de NEURONOETICS

OUR CURRENT PROPOSAL FOR PROJECT LEO

This is a project designed to implement STATIONS OF ACTIVITY geared towards feeding neural wiring in a sample of 4 to 5 children between the ages of 3 to 7 years old. We are asking your support for this project so that we may implement these Stations of Activity throughout the following four months (between january and april). Your contribution will allow to complete particular tasks and if your support allows us to COMPLETE ALL TASKS then you will be furthering a brain-entered pedagogy and the development of 4 to 5 children during this period of time. 

Yet, everything we learn and accomplish with these children we will be able to replicate throughout the world later on. Why do I declare that? Well, because that is the nature of the theory behind these actions!  So if you want to read theory please go to THIS ADDRESS. Yet in the following section you will find a brief aspect of the theory regarding Stations of Activity.  

Este es un proyecto diseñado para implementar ESTACIONES DE ACTIVIDAD orientadas a alimentar el cableado neuronal en una muestra de 4 a 5 niños entre los 3 y 7 años de edad. PARA ESTE PROYECTO estamos pidiendo vuestro apoyo para implementar estas estaciones a lo largo de los siguientes 4 meses (entre Enero y Abril). Vuestra contribución nos permitirá completar tareas específicas y si vuestro aporte nos permite COMPLETAR TODAS LAS TAREAS entonces estarán promoviendo una pedagogía cerebro-centrada  y el desarrollo de 4 a 5 niños durante este periodo. 

Sin embargo, todo lo que aprendamos y logremos con estos niños podremos nosotros replicar a lo largo y ancho del mundo más adelante. Y por qué digo esto? Pues, porque esta es la naturaleza de la teoría detrás de estas acciones.  Si  alguno de ustedes desea leer la teoría por favor vayan AQUI.  En la siguiente seccion encontraran una breve síntesis del sustento teórico. 


ABOUT STATIONS OF ACTIVITY

Neural wiring depends on EXPERIENCE and experience depends on ACTIVITY. The right activity ensures right EXPERIENCE. The right experience ensures the correct neural wiring. But, what is "RIGHT"? The correct experience happens when the activity offered has the correct amounts of pressure,  novelty, demands, challenges and risks during a prudent time. 
Too much pressure and the brain gets overwhelmed. Not enough pressure and the brain gets bored. The brain tries to give the experience the right pressure according to its nature. The right pressure AWAKENS the brain and fosters the correct wiring to happen. But most importantly: the right pressure fosters the use of the PROPIOCEPTIVE sense. 
On this premise we have identified 61 Stations of activity, many Scenarios of Activity and many more Circuits of Activity. What you will contribute to is the implementation of  SOME stations of activity (limited to the small space and the short time we have available -4 months). 
During this time we will focus our efforts on feeding our children´s need to receive the adequate pressure from outside so that they can meet, get to know, harbor and harvest their own pressure from their own insides including their PROPIOCEPTION. This is akin to developing the wiring of CONTROL. 

EL CABLEADO NEURONAL depende de la EXPERIENCIA y la experiencia depende de la ACTIVIDAD. La correcta actividad asegura la correcta EXPERIENCIA. Y la correcta experiencia asegura el correcto cableado neuronal. Pero, qué es lo "CORRECTO?" La correcta experiencia ocurre cuando la actividad ofrecida brinda el monto correcto de presión, novedad, exigencia, retos y riesgos durante un tiempo prudencial. 

Demasiada presión y el cerebro se abruma. Insuficiente presión y el cerebro se aburre. El cerebro intenta darle a una experiencia la presión correcta de acuerdo a su naturaleza. La presión correcta DESPIERTA al cerebro y promueve el cableado correcto.  Pero más importantemente: la presión correcta obliga y permite el uso de la PROPIOCEPCION. 

Sobre esta premisa hemos identificado 61 estaciones de actividad, muchos otros escenarios de actividad y un número de circuitos de actividad. Lo que ustedes estarán haciendo es contribuir a la implementación de algunas estaciones de actividad (limitados por el espacio y la corta duracion de este proyecto -4 meses).

Durante este lapso enfocaremos nuestros esfuerzos para alimentar la necesidad de nuestros niños de recibir la adecuada presión desde afuera de modo que ellos puedan conocer, acoger y cultivar sus propias presiones provenientes de su interior y su propiocepción.  Esto equivale a ir desarrollando el cableado del CONTROL y su AUTONOMIA.


ABOUT OUR PERKS

In this campaign a perk is a task to which an amount of money has been assigned to be able to realize it in real time. And knowing you made that task possible -that your contribution allowed us to complete it- becomes your PERK. 

And I want to let you know my pledge to you: for every PERK you commit yourself to you will be acknowledged with a graphic documentation of what we did with your money during this 4 month period. Thank you!

En esta campaña un perk es una tarea a la cual se le ha asignado un monto de dinero para poder realizarla en tiempo real. Y el hecho de que sepas que tu contribución fue la que la hizo posible la convierte en un PERK para ti. 

Y quiero hacerles saber mi promesa para ustedes: para cada PERK con el que se comprometan recibirán nuestro reconocimiento mediante una documentación gráfica de lo que hicimos . Gracias!


LIST OF PERKS



PERK 3.  With this task we want to refurbish the sand box, put new sand in it and plant new grass in this garden; mend and  paint all the walls surrounding this garden.  And do you see those logs against the wall? They weigh a lot. We want to pay someone to cut them down to size and make them manageable. Your contribution will pay for this. Look for PERK3 in the pane to your right. 
Con esta tarea queremos remozar la caja de arena, ponerle nueva arena y plantar nuevo pasto en el jardin; remendar y pintar las paredes que rodean al jardin. Y ven esos troncos junto a la pared en el suelo? Pesan mucho. Queremos contratar a alguien para que los corte y disponer de ellos de la mejor manera. Vuestra contribucion pagará por esto. Si les interesa busquen el  PERK 3 a la derecha. 

PERK 4.  With this task we want to purchase a swimming pool along with a small motor. Your contribution will pay for this. Look for PERK 4 in the pane to your right. 
Con esta tarea queremos comprar una piscina junto con un motor. Vuestra contribucion pagará por esto. Si les interesa busquen el  PERK 4 a la derecha. 


PERK 5. With this task we want a metal carpenter to build this gadget and we want to purchase a couple of gymnastic rings; which we will in turn hang  from the central beam in the garden (a corner of which you can see in the picture below). Your contribution will pay for this. Look for PERK 5 in the pane to your right. 
Con esta tarea queremos que un carpintero metalico haga este pasamanos y tambien queremos comprar un par de anillos de gimnasia: los cuales colgaremos de la viga central que hay en el jardin (una esquina de la cual la pueden ver en la foto de abajo). Vuestra contribucion pagará por esto. Si les interesa busquen el  PERK 5 a la derecha. 

PERK 6. The weaved ropes you can see in the platform above to your right needs fixing. With this task we will have it fixed.  And we also want to finish the platform in the way you can see below. Your contribution will pay for this as well. Look for PERK 6 in the pane to your right. 
Las sogas trenzadas que pueden apreciar en la plataforma arriba a vuestra derecha requieren arreglo. Con esta tarea las arreglaremos. Y tambien queremos terminar dicha plataforma poniendole una palestra en uno de sus costados. Vuestra contribucion pagará por esto. Si les interesa busquen el  PERK 6 a la derecha. 

The picture BELOW corresponds to PERK 7. La foto de abajo corresponde al PERK 7. 

PERK 7 . In the picture above you can see the green mesh cloth surrounding the roof ripped and hanging. We want to change it and make a better installation. With this task we will have it fixed.  Your contribution will pay for this. Look for PERK 7 in the pane to your right. 
En la foto de arriba pueden ver la malla verde que rodea el perimetro del techo y que se encuentra desvencijada, rota y colgando. Queremos cambiarla y hacer una mejor instalacion. Vuestra contribucion pagará por esto. Si les interesa busquen el  PERK 7 a la derecha. 

PERK 8. And another task here is to install a HUAROC which our indigenous people use to cross over rivers. The closest thing I found to this is the picture below. Look for PERK 8 in the pane to your right. 

Y otra tarea es la de instalar un HUAROC -sogas colgantes que usan nuestros indios para cruzar rios. La foto más cercana que he encontrado es esta de abajo. Vuestra contribucion pagará por esto. Si les interesa busquen el  PERK 8 a la derecha. 

PERK 9 . In the picture below, see the basketball hoop hanging from the green wall? We have to change that and also put it somewhere else. That includes purchasing some basket balls. Your contribution will pay for this. Look for PERK 9 in the pane to your right. 
En la foto de abajo, alcanzan a ver el aro de basquet que cuelga de la pared verde? Bueno debemos cambiarlo por otro y ubicarlo en otro lugar. Eso incluye comprar un para de pelotas de basket. Vuestra contribucion pagará por esto. Si les interesa busquen el  PERK 9 a la derecha. 

PERK 10.  With this task we want to purchase bikes, tricycles, skateboards, roller skates and others for our children. Your contribution will pay for this. Look for PERK 10 in the pane to your right. 
Con esta tarea compraremos bicicletas, triciclos, skateboards, patines y otros para nuestros niños. Vuestra contribucion pagará por esto. Si les interesa busquen el  PERK 10 a la derecha. 

PERK 11. We will need a computer programmer to design and develop the Etarean Locator and the etarean Logbook. You will find a convenient explanation of what these tools are in a PDF document that I invite you to download and study. You can find the link in THE ETAREAN SOFTWARE. Your contribution will pay for this. Look for PERK 11 in the pane to your right. 
Queremos contratar un programador para que diseñe y desarrolle el Localizador Etareo y la Bitacora Etarea. Hemos confeccionado más información sobre este recurso y lo pueden encontrar en SOFTWARE ETAREO.  Vuestra contribucion pagará por esto. Si les interesa busquen el  PERK 11. a la derecha. 

PERK 12. We will purchase 3 wooden stilts and 2 jumping stilts for our children.  Your contribution will pay for this. Look for PERK 12 in the pane to your right. 
Les compraremos a los niños 3 zancos de madera y 2 zancos saltarines. Tu contribucion pagará esto. Si te interesa apoyar esto busquen el PERK 12.

PERK 13. We need to purchase 2 computers for our children. Look for PERK 13 in the pane to your right. 
Necesitamos comprar 2 computadoras para los niños. Si les interesa apoyar esto busquen el PERK 13.

PERK 14. We want to Purchase Play Station 4 and several PS games. Look for PERK 14  in the pane to your right.  
Tambien queremos comprar el Play Station 4 y varios de sus juegos.  Si les interesa apoyar esto busquen el PERK 14.

PERK 15. With your support we will purchase a 39 inch LCD monitor and blue ray for our children.  Your contribution will pay for this. Look for PERK 15  in the pane to your right. 
Con vuestro apoyo compraremos un monitor LCD de 39 pulgadas y un blue ray para que nuestros niños vean videos seleccionados. Si les interesa apoyar esto busquen el PERK 15.

PERK 16.  Our children need new furniture for the classroom. Your contribution will pay for this. Look for PERK 16 in the pane to your right. 
Nuestros niños necesitan unos cuantos muebles para el aula. Tu contribucion pagará por ellos. Si les interesa apoyar esto busquen el PERK 16.

PERK 17. We will need to hire an administrator for the duration of the project: a person who looks after the center on a day to day basis. Your contribution will also pay for the maintenance of the place. Look for PERK 17  in the pane to your right. 
Necesitaremos contratar un administrador para la duracion del proyecto: una persona que supervise la actividad diaria del centro. Vuestra contribucion tambien pagará el mantenimiento del lugar. Busquen el PERK 17 en la seccion a la derecha. 

PERK 18. But we also want to keep them indoors and our strategy for that is to furnish them with 2 microscopes. Children are so keen in seeing the "invisible"!!! Your contribution will pay for this. Look for PERK 18  in the pane to your right. 
Pero tambien mantendremos a nuestros niños en el aula y nuestra estrategia para esto es proveerles 2 microscopios. A los niños les encanta descubrir lo "invisible!". Tu contribucion pagará por estos artefactos. Si les interesa apoyar esto busquen el PERK 18.
This is my son / este es mi hijo Gabriel.

PERK 19. And one last task is to purchase them a telescope. My child Gabriel loves to talk about the galaxies and the quantum vaccum! And I want the other kids to get into that as well. Your contribution will pay for this. Look for PERK 19  in the pane to your right. 
Y una ultima tarea por hacer es la de comprarles un telescopio. A mi hijo Gabriel le encanta hablar sobre las galaxias y el vacio cuantico! Vuestra contribucion pagará por este artefacto. Si les interesa apoyar esto busquen el PERK 19.

BUDGET
So when summing up all the amounts assigned to the PERKS we get a grand total $9,400 dollars for the 4 months duration of the project. Which can be broken down to a monthly assignment of  $2,350 dollars. I am not including myself in this budget. 

Asi es que, sumando los montos asignados a cada PERK sale un total de $9,400 dolares para la duracion de 4 meses que tiene el proyecto actual. Este monto tambien puede desglosarse en 4 asignaciones mensuales de $2,350 dolares. Yo no estoy incluyendo mis honorarios en este presupuesto. 

BENEFITS

The Climber, the Huaroc, the Zipline, the Platform, the Fireman Pole and the Jumping Bed have all something in common: allow the child the correct scenarios in which to experience his own way of handling amounts of pressure,  novelty, demands, challenges and risks.  The brain tries to give the experience the right pressure according to its nature. The right pressure AWAKENS the brain and fosters the correct wiring to happen. Propioception is the key ingredient in this mix. These activities will not only wire his brain correctly but in the act of doing so they will also provide the opportunities to develop control and autonomy. 

El Trepador, el Huaroc, el Zipline, la plataforma, el tubo de bombero y la cama saltarina tienen todos algo en comun: le permiten al niño contar con los escenarios correctos en los cuales experimentar su propia manera de manejar presion, novedad, exigencias, retos y riesgos. El cerebro trata de darle a la experiencia la presion correcta de acuerdo a SU naturaleza. La presion correcta DESPIERTA al cerebro y promueve el cableado correcto. La propiocepcion es el ingrediente clave aqui. La experiencia en estas actividades no solamente cablearan el cerebro correctamente sino que tambien proveeran las oportunidades para que el niño desarrolle su control y su autonomia.
story_txt:
"Hasta ahora la educación ha ido dando "manotazos de ahogado" con respecto al estímulo que nuestro cerebro requiere para desarrollar plenamente su potencial.  Hoy ya tenemos conocimientos claves respecto a lo que estimula, estanca o empobrece nuestro potencial cerebral. Por lo tanto se necesita diseñar una vía planificada, expresa y lúcida para educar lo más importante que tiene todo ser humano, su cerebro.  Eso es el Proyecto Leo."   "To date education has been "treading superficial waters" with regards to the stimulation our brain requires in order to fully develop its potential. And now, today, we already have key understanding regarding what stimulates, detains or impoverishes our cerebral capacity. Therefore, we need to design a laid out path, explicit and lucid, so as to educate the most important human asset: his brain. This is the LEO Project"Juan Manuel Heredia. Coach Corporativo"Durante mucho tiempo sabemos que lo único que puede hacer crecer nuestra sociedad es la educación. Todos lo dicen pero pocos hacen algo . Sin embargo, qué clase de educación puede garantizar un cambio positivo en la sociedad? Cómo hacer para que la educación desarrolle todo el potencial del cerebro? Cómo lograr que nuestro cerebro aumente nuestro nivel de conciencia ? El proyecto LEO apunta a dar respuestas a estas urgentes preguntas. Conozco a Ricardo hace más de 25 años y he visto cómo ha desarrollado esta propuesta educativa. Ya es momento que el mundo reciba este conocimiento."
"It has been a long time now, that we know that the only factor that can make our society grow is education. Everybody says this but few do something about it. Nevertheless, what kind of education can guarantee a positive change in society? How can we make education develop all of the potential in the brain? How can we have our brain increase our level of consciousness? Project LEO aims to answer these urgent questions. I know Ricardo more than 25 years and I have seen him develop this educational proposal. It is now time for the world to receive this knowledge."
Javier Echevarria. Coach Corporativo
For more information you can also visit / para más informacion tambien pueden visitar la pagina de NEURONOETICS


OUR CURRENT PROPOSAL FOR PROJECT LEO
This is a project designed to implement STATIONS OF ACTIVITY geared towards feeding neural wiring in a sample of 4 to 5 children between the ages of 3 to 7 years old. We are asking your support for this project so that we may implement these Stations of Activity throughout the following four months (between january and april). Your contribution will allow to complete particular tasks and if your support allows us to COMPLETE ALL TASKS then you will be furthering a brain-entered pedagogy and the development of 4 to 5 children during this period of time. 

Yet, everything we learn and accomplish with these children we will be able to replicate throughout the world later on. Why do I declare that? Well, because that is the nature of the theory behind these actions!  So if you want to read theory please go to THIS ADDRESS. Yet in the following section you will find a brief aspect of the theory regarding Stations of Activity.  
Este es un proyecto diseñado para implementar ESTACIONES DE ACTIVIDAD orientadas a alimentar el cableado neuronal en una muestra de 4 a 5 niños entre los 3 y 7 años de edad. PARA ESTE PROYECTO estamos pidiendo vuestro apoyo para implementar estas estaciones a lo largo de los siguientes 4 meses (entre Enero y Abril). Vuestra contribución nos permitirá completar tareas específicas y si vuestro aporte nos permite COMPLETAR TODAS LAS TAREAS entonces estarán promoviendo una pedagogía cerebro-centrada  y el desarrollo de 4 a 5 niños durante este periodo. 
Sin embargo, todo lo que aprendamos y logremos con estos niños podremos nosotros replicar a lo largo y ancho del mundo más adelante. Y por qué digo esto? Pues, porque esta es la naturaleza de la teoría detrás de estas acciones.  Si  alguno de ustedes desea leer la teoría por favor vayan AQUI.  En la siguiente seccion encontraran una breve síntesis del sustento teórico. 


ABOUT STATIONS OF ACTIVITY
Neural wiring depends on EXPERIENCE and experience depends on ACTIVITY. The right activity ensures right EXPERIENCE. The right experience ensures the correct neural wiring. But, what is "RIGHT"? The correct experience happens when the activity offered has the correct amounts of pressure,  novelty, demands, challenges and risks during a prudent time. Too much pressure and the brain gets overwhelmed. Not enough pressure and the brain gets bored. The brain tries to give the experience the right pressure according to its nature. The right pressure AWAKENS the brain and fosters the correct wiring to happen. But most importantly: the right pressure fosters the use of the PROPIOCEPTIVE sense. On this premise we have identified 61 Stations of activity, many Scenarios of Activity and many more Circuits of Activity. What you will contribute to is the implementation of  SOME stations of activity (limited to the small space and the short time we have available -4 months). During this time we will focus our efforts on feeding our children´s need to receive the adequate pressure from outside so that they can meet, get to know, harbor and harvest their own pressure from their own insides including their PROPIOCEPTION. This is akin to developing the wiring of CONTROL. 
EL CABLEADO NEURONAL depende de la EXPERIENCIA y la experiencia depende de la ACTIVIDAD. La
correcta actividad asegura la correcta EXPERIENCIA. Y la correcta experiencia
asegura el correcto cableado neuronal. Pero, qué es lo "CORRECTO?" La
correcta experiencia ocurre cuando la actividad ofrecida brinda el monto
correcto de presión, novedad, exigencia, retos y riesgos durante un tiempo
prudencial. 
Demasiada presión y el cerebro se abruma. Insuficiente presión y el
cerebro se aburre. El cerebro intenta darle a una experiencia la presión correcta
de acuerdo a su naturaleza. La presión correcta DESPIERTA al cerebro y promueve
el cableado correcto.  Pero más importantemente: la presión correcta obliga y permite el uso de la PROPIOCEPCION. 
Sobre esta premisa hemos identificado 61 estaciones de
actividad, muchos otros escenarios de actividad y un número de circuitos de
actividad. Lo que ustedes estarán haciendo es contribuir a la implementación de
algunas estaciones de actividad (limitados por el espacio y la corta duracion
de este proyecto -4 meses).
Durante
este lapso enfocaremos nuestros esfuerzos para alimentar la necesidad de
nuestros niños de recibir la adecuada presión desde afuera de modo que ellos
puedan conocer, acoger y cultivar sus propias presiones provenientes de su
interior y su propiocepción.  Esto equivale a ir desarrollando el cableado del CONTROL y su
AUTONOMIA. 



ABOUT OUR PERKS
In this campaign a perk is a task to which an amount of money has been assigned to be able to realize it in real time. And knowing you made that task possible -that your contribution allowed us to complete it- becomes your PERK. 
And I want to let you know my pledge to you: for every PERK you commit yourself to you will be acknowledged with a graphic documentation of what we did with your money during this 4 month period. Thank you!

Y quiero hacerles saber mi promesa para ustedes: para cada PERK con el que se comprometan recibirán nuestro reconocimiento mediante una documentación gráfica de lo que hicimos . Gracias!

story:
Building Beats is working to provide innovative music production workshops for 485 youth in New York City over the course of the next 6 months.  This includes an unprecedented 8 session intensive program that fuses Building Beats' DJ and music production instruction with the state-of-the art facilities of Carnegie Hall's Weill Music Institute. These workshops will be 100% FREE for all participating youth.

Building Beats Remixes Carnegie Hall

Building Beats is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that develops and expands DJ and music education programs that teach entrepreneurial, leadership, and life skills. We recently secured a partnership with Carnegie Hall's Weill Music Institute to bring quality music education to underserved youth in New York City.  Through pop-up events that are already underway and will continue to run all over NYC throughout this spring, we hope to bring day-long music production workshops to hundreds of students in New York City.  The second phase of the project begins this spring, when we plan to hold an intensive program of 8 sessions in partnership with Carnegie Hall's Weill Music Institute.  We'll be working with a diverse group of students from schools, community centers, and probation offices around New York City.  The pop-ups and workshops will allow interested students to create, remix, curate, connect, and share content and learning experiences. Our organizations are partnering to bring free-to-attend educational programming that combines music, technology, and science to populations that typically lack access to this type of instruction. 

What We Need

This is a big step forward for Building Beats, and the partnership is an innovative mash-up of two very different organizations that share a passion for music.  We’ve secured half of the project budget thanks to a grant from The Mozilla Foundation’s HIVE Learning Network. However, to complete the project as budgeted, we still need to match the initial grant with our own fundraising efforts. 

To allow us to complete the project, we’re seeking to raise $10,000 through online contributions this holiday season. If you understand the transformative power of music and the need for quality arts education, we ask that you become a part of this project by donating $25.  Your contribution will be used to: pay our instructors, to help us with project management costs, and to help us document the workshops.  You'll be supporting the first iteration of an innovative music education curriculum - one that we plan to continue to grow over the next few years.  To keep you in the loop, we'll send you a monthly update on this project so you can see the impact your donation made.

Oh, and there are perks for donating, from a sticker to turntable slipmats, check out our list of donation perks.

Love music, but can't donate?  

We understand if money may be tight, but you can still help us complete this project! Please spread the word about our campaign by sharing our campaign video with 2 people that love music as much as you.

More About Us: Our Philosophy and History

Music is a universal language.  It connects people across cultures and age groups. This is why we see music as the perfect way to engage students and get them excited about learning.

For the past couple of years, Building Beats has been gathering funds to provide DJ and music education workshops for under-served NYC youth.  With these funds, we've run workshops where our instructors engage our students’ passion for music. They teach not only music theory, but also tech skills and larger life skills. Our students use iPads, recording equipment, and computers. They learn to collaborate and communicate with each other. From tapping out their first beat to bringing together an orchestra of sounds to produce a song, they develop a sense of accomplishment, the confidence to perform in front of their peers, and a more meaningful outlook on life.  

So by equipping our students with a quality arts education, we not only stimulate their creativity, we also empower them to become tomorrow’s successful professionals, entrepreneurs, and active community members.  

In the past year alone, we have impacted over 300 youth and connected over 30 DJ’s and producers to help them work with youth in the NYC community. The project in partnership with Carnegie Hall's Weill Music Institute will catalyze awareness for our mission and allow our workshops to grow throughout New York City.

Why The Status Quo Doesn't Work For Us:

The sad truth of today’s public education system is that schools in low-income neighborhoods frequently lack quality arts programming, because it is viewed as “non-essential.” According to a report the NYC Comptroller's Bureau of Policy and Research released this past April, there has been a 47 percent decline in spending on arts programs in NYC over the past 7 years. These reductions in arts education have fallen disproportionately on the City’s lower income neighborhoods.  Our schools are failing to provide artistic outlets for our youth.  

Why is this a problem?  Research has shown that high levels of arts engagement increases student performance and college enrollment rates among youth of low socioeconomic backgrounds. In fact, one 2012 analysis of longitudinal research, by the National Endowment for the Arts (NEA) found that high school students who had in-depth arts engagement:

  • Had higher GPAs than students with low levels of arts engagement
  • Enrolled at higher rates in competitive and four-year colleges than low-arts-engaged students
  • Were three times more likely than their arts-poor peers to earn a bachelor’s degree

This is why we're passionate about finding ways to improve access to music education, and why we're asking for your help.


THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
story_txt:
Building Beats is working to provide innovative music production workshops for 485 youth in New York City over the course of the next 6 months.  This includes an unprecedented 8 session intensive program that fuses Building Beats' DJ and music production instruction with the state-of-the art facilities of Carnegie Hall's Weill Music Institute. These workshops will be 100% FREE for all participating youth.
Building Beats Remixes Carnegie Hall
Building Beats is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that develops and expands DJ and music education programs that teach entrepreneurial, leadership, and life skills. We recently secured a partnership with Carnegie Hall's Weill Music Institute to bring quality music education to underserved youth in New York City.  Through pop-up events that are already underway and will continue to run all over NYC throughout this spring, we hope to bring day-long music production workshops to hundreds of students in New York City.  The second phase of the project begins this spring, when we plan to hold an intensive program of 8 sessions in partnership with Carnegie Hall's Weill Music Institute.  We'll be working with a diverse group of students from schools, community centers, and probation offices around New York City.  The pop-ups and workshops will allow interested students to create, remix, curate, connect, and share content and learning experiences. Our organizations are partnering to bring free-to-attend educational programming that combines music, technology, and science to populations that typically lack access to this type of instruction. What We NeedThis is a big step forward for Building Beats, and the partnership is an innovative mash-up of two very different organizations that share a passion for music.  We’ve secured half of the project budget thanks to a grant from The Mozilla Foundation’s HIVE Learning Network. However, to complete the project as budgeted, we still need to match the initial grant with our own fundraising efforts. To allow us to complete the project, we’re seeking to raise $10,000 through online contributions this holiday season. If you understand the transformative power of music and the need for quality arts education, we ask that you become a part of this project by donating $25.  Your contribution will be used to: pay our instructors, to help us with project management costs, and to help us document the workshops.  You'll be supporting the first iteration of an innovative music education curriculum - one that we plan to continue to grow over the next few years.  To keep you in the loop, we'll send you a monthly update on this project so you can see the impact your donation made.Oh, and there are perks for donating, from a sticker to turntable slipmats, check out our list of donation perks.Love music, but can't donate?  We understand if money may be tight, but you can still help us complete this project! story:
Short Summary:

The SHoP is a place where creative individuals in our community can come together and share the common desire to create, exchange ideas, and collaborate on projects, whether it is simply to practice their craft or turn it into a business. 

Who we are:

Dan: Born and raised in Grand Rapids, Michigan, Dan received his undergraduate and Master's degrees in architecture from Ball State University in Muncie, Indiana. It was during his summers between classes that he discovered a passion for reclaiming materials and furniture making as an alternative outlet for design and making. While helping a friend operate a small deconstruction business, they began turning the materials they saved into unique furniture pieces. Now back in Grand Rapids with his wife Katie and son Otto, while also working for a small local architecture firm, Dan started re.dwell to build upon his experiences. re.dwell draws upon the combination of his architectural education and relentless pursuit of new ways to utilize salvaged and reclaimed materials. Dan strives to create innovative designs for modern living, while also preserving the integrity of the reclaimed materials and letting each piece tell its own unique story. 

Logan: A native of West Michigan, Logan Zillmer arrived at the medium of conceptual photography after years of interest in documentary-style photography and after a few false starts attempting to get films made. A graduate of film school and passionate film enthusiast, Zillmer, with an abundance of creative energy that desperately needed an outlet, undertook a 365 day photo project that produced a published image every day for a year. The project is notable for producing Zillmer’s signature style of experimental, surrealist conceptual photography that has garnered international interest and recognition. Combing complex in-camera techniques with a self-taught mastery of Photoshop, Zillmer’s images recall the compositions of Magritte, as well as influences from Chaplin and Teun Hocks, reconstituted for the modern American experience. Zillmer lives with his wife Whitney and two children, Rowan and Charlie, in Grand Rapids, MI.

What we are asking:

We are seeking an initial goal of $10,000 of funding from this campaign to help us build out the space in our new location to better suit our needs and the needs of other creative entrepreneurs we hope will join us in the pursuit of turning the passion for their craft into a business.

  • Your donations will help us to create an affordable space for artists and makers of all mediums to come, create, collaborate, and display their work, who may not otherwise have the resources or space to do so. We want to create a space for others like us, that will help foster an entrepreneurial spirit. 
  • While there is only room for a limited number of anchor members, we want to work toward a membership system so a larger group can utilize the space and equipment on an as needed basis. 

Below is what your generous donations will help us do.

  • For re.dwell and Logan Zillmer Photography, it will help upgrade some of our outdated and undersized equipment.
    • Upgrading photography lighting and backdrops
    • Upgrading woodworking equipment, like a larger planer, sanders, and better dust collection system.
  • For the SHoP it will help update the space to make a comfortable and modern place to work.
    • Build shared photography sets.
    • Move and build new spaces for a gallery space and small artist studios.
    • Install windows in the currently windowless office/studio spaces.
    • Install windows in the warehouse for better daylight and ventilation.
    • Install skylights in the warehouse and office spaces to provide more daylight in the studio spaces.
    • Update, move and add electrical outlets to suit user needs.
    • Upgrade existing and install more lighting in the warehouse for those late nights and cloudy days.
    • Replace a broken heating unit in the warehouse (It gets cold in Michigan)
If we do not meet our goal we will accomplish as many of the essential items mentioned above as we can and complete what remains over time. 
Stretch goal
If you surpass our initial goal here are some additional things we would like to do to help reduce our footprint and makes the space better for others like us.
  • Upgrade the warehouse lighting to LED's 
  • Go solar! Help install a few photovoltaic panels to reduce our footprint
  • Purchase additional equipment to share with other members of the shop. 

The Impact

As two artists for whom the heart of what we do lies simply in the desire to create, ultimately, what we do, we do for you. Neither of us are the type of individual that would ever ask for anything from anyone unless we believed completely in our respective craft. What we desire more than anything is a place where our crafts can be realized to their full potential, where what we love to do can be done to the best of our ability, and a place where we can bring together other creative individuals from our community that share the same pure desire to create. This is us asking for your help so that we can take what we love to the next level, so that every day we can continue to create beautiful and unique work that everyone can enjoy. 
Risks & Challenges

As with starting any small business, there are many challenges including coming up with capitol to acquire needed equipment, securing a space to work, and marketing a growing business. Your donations will help other entrepreneurs by aiding in the creation of a space where a group of individuals pursuing a common goal can share ideas with and learn from each other. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you cannot contribute to our campaign, don't worry you can still be part of the action. Help us promote our work and spread the word of this fund raiser. Share this on facebook, twitter, tumblr, or tell the person sitting next to you at the bar about it, so it reaches as many people as possible. We will be forever grateful.

story:
Hujam family



My name is Yerevan Saeed, a journalist based in Washington DC. While advocacy is not the job of journalists, but when a force of darkness like ISIS threatens all of us, it makes all of us responsible for one another. 

On Jan 25th, Islamic State (ISIS) beheaded  Hujam Surchi, a defenseless Kurdish soldier known as Peshmerga. I personally believe those who fight ISIS 5000 miles away, they protect us here in America and we should be grateful for their heroic actions. Surchi was the father of 11 beautiful children in a village in Kurdistan Region-Iraq. According to Kurdish local media, his family live under poverty line and financially in a very bad situation.  I am hoping to raise $50000 for his family and children who desperately need any financial assistance. I do hope that we will all care for people who protect us and fight a savage force like ISIS.  Please google Hujam Surchi, or Peshmerga beheading by ISIS to learn more about him. 

I am certain that the family of this beheaded Peshmerga will highly appreciate every cent donated for them. If successful in raising the money, I will coordinate wit Kurdistan Regional Government Representation in Washington DC to deliver the money to the family.

I understand that the issue of trust is a big part of such fundraising campaigns, but I do hope that you all trust me and feel free to google me (Yerevan Saeed) to learn more about who I am and my background. Be absolutely certain that every cent will go to these 11 poor children whose father mercilessly beheaded by ISIS. 

Just think about them-- being in a village in a shabby house with no support and no father to return to them.! 

Thank you all and feel free to get in touch.

Kind regards,

Yerevan Saeed

story:
Not all names in language are based on evidence. Bias-embedded language sabotages your best efforts to make the world a better place. 

A talk in the Wren room in the Eaton Chelsea in Toronto, starting at 7.00 p.m. Wednesday, May 13, 2015, on Playing the Sex Card in Language.  The language misinforms.  Belief in the language was accepted as being "knowledge."  This belief  harms the mind, the bias is valued more than knowledge, 
Fortunately, the sex-card is not hard to eliminate. 

My name is Louise Goueffic, author of Breaking the Patriarchal Code.  10,000 names in language embed male bias. The bias keeps a small elite force of wealthy men in control. 

I would like to make people aware of the sexual bias in names so that their efforts to make a better world is more real and solid. By helping me give this talk you start reestablishing evidence-based information lost in patriarchy's language. This will help people succeed in making a better world. 

Contributors receive a copy of In the Name of the Profit Fyg, an allegory illustrating how easy it is to manipulate language to gain advantage, control, power and wealth. The funding is to pay for space, hotel room and postage.  I provide 'me' as speaker.  I need about $2000. 

I would also like you, my contributor, to talk-up an audience for me. Please tell as many of your friends about the talk and invite them to attend. 
Building society on bias is like building a factory on marshland.  We need evidence-based information to build a moral and caring society and world. 
Individuals need evidence-based information. But we believed the bias for 11,000 years.  Enough is enough!  Let's look at  "patriarchy's language" on May 13. There is evidence-based language on which to build a more harmonious, rational, inclusive and moral society. Let's eliminate the sex card in language.

story:
Cohen Syndrome is a rare disease with less then 1000 diagnosed cases

My daughter Morgan was diagnosed in 2008 with Cohen Syndrome and I was devastated with the unknown of what to expect for her future. Having a child with a rare disease is very difficult and a parent feels very alone.  As a result of this fate I decided to make a difference for other families that would be impacted by Cohen Syndrome.
With a few other families I founded the Cohen Syndrome Association, a non profit that is dedicated to educate parents and professionals about CS. We commit our time to make a positive impact to ensure Cohen Syndrome families are not alone with this rare disease.
Every two years the Cohen Syndrome Association provides a family conference at Highbrook Lodge in Chardon, Ohio. Highbrook Lodge is a summer camp operated by The Cleveland Sight Center that serves many populations and ages. Highbrook Lodge was the first camp built in the United States for the visually impaired and blind.  The campground has an air-conditioned hall, heated outdoor swimming pool, outdoor bowling alley, recreation field, marked hiking trails and playgrounds.  Activities include arts and crafts, campfires, chess, music and nature and outdoor education.
This venue provides education for parents and a camp opportunity for the kids that would not get this experience otherwise. Families meet with professionals while the children participate in a safe and fun environment with camp counselors. This event often is the only chance for a family to meet other parents and children of Cohen Syndrome. The Cohen Syndrome Association would like to make this conference more affordable for all families to ensure Cohen Syndrome children have the brightest future.

We are raising funds to help defer registration cost so more families can attend the Cohen Syndrome conference.

  • Our goal is to raise 10,000 with this campaign to defer the cost of registration fees for families.
  • Our Families will need to spend funds on travel expenses to get to the conference from all over the world and we need your help. 
  • If we do not meet our goal all funds raised for this project with be used to reduce  costs for registration fees for the conference.

The Impact

  • This experience is life changing for our families as often they have not met another Cohen Syndrome child.  
  • Our kids get to enjoy a fun camp experience in a safe environment and meet with peers that understand them.
  • We are committed to medical research to help our families and this conference has connected families with researchers that will make a difference for future families. 
  • We are currently involved with the International Neutropenia registry and the Face Base project as they both are following Cohen Syndrome cases.
Other Ways You Can Help

We know there are other Cohen Syndrome children that are not diagnosed and we need to raise awareness for this rare disease.

We are also looking for media exposure and hope a celebrity will take an interest that would promote awareness for Cohen Syndrome. 

 Visit our website to learn more http://cohen-syndrome.org/

Please help kids like my daughter Morgan, and share our story.

Warm Regards

Lisa McElhinney

President 

Cohen Syndrome Association

story:
Lucerna School is a growing education success established in 2003 in Brussels having 19 students and 8 teachers. Today we have 4 secondary and 2 primary schools in 4 different cities in Belgium with a capacity of 1500 students and 200 teachers.

Our students have collected various prizes  at both national and international projects and Olympics.

A list of our activities is as follows:

·  Organizing summer language courses in England and France,

·  Organizing cultural activities

·  Musicals

·  Sports teams at each branch

·  International excursions for our students

·  Robotics class

·  Language classes (English, French, German and Latin)

·  Chess club

·  Theater club

Our students are educated to be world citizens. In a globally changing world it is certain that international experience is crucial for college graduates. Therefore, we are interested to establish new relations with your college/university regarding the education career of  our graduate students.

For our new school we need 3.000.000 Euro. It's is a project of 10.000.000 Euro and the gouvernement will subsidize 7.000.000 Euro.

· 
Organizing
summer language courses in England and France, 
· 
Organizing
cultural activities
· 
Musicals
· 
Sports
teams at each branch
· 
International
excursions for our students 
· 
Robotics
class
· 
Language
classes (English, French, German and Latin)
· 
Chess
club
· 
Theater
club
Our
students are educated to be world citizens. In a globally changing world it is
certain that international experience is crucial for college graduates.
Therefore, we are interested to establish new relations with your college/university
regarding the education career of  our graduate students.For our new school we need 3.000.000 Euro. It's is a project of 10.000.000 Euro and the gouvernement will subsidize 7.000.000 Euro.

story:
Chi sono e qual è il progetto:

Mi chiamo Francesca Pascale e da tre anni mi dedico all'insegnamento dell'arte ai bambini dai 6 ai 12 anni.

Da questa esperienza sono nati i libri per bambini delle "Avventure di Sbuccia e Puntino" in cui in ogni puntata i due protagonisti vanno in visita a un museo ma quando si avvicinano a un'opera ne vengono risucchiati, per magia, e si ritrovano nel passato davanti all'artista che l'aveva dipinta.

I libri sono in vendita in Italia nelle librerie, su Amazon e IBS ma pochi mesi fa ho deciso di usare i miei risparmi per creare due cartoni animati animando i disegni che sono tutti fatti a mano ad acquerello. L'obiettivo era molto semplice: dar vita e Sbuccia e Puntino e coinvolgere più bambini possibile anche utilizzando i nuovi strumenti di comunicazione. Sono nate così le prime due puntate di questa webserie divertente che i genitori possono guardare con i propri figli e poi magari approfondire andando alle mostre o continuando la storia sui libri di Sbuccia e Puntino.

Le puntate su Leonardo e Botticelli sono già prodotte e visibili da tutti su Facebook e Youtube, ora chiedo il vostro contributo per produrre quelle su Renoir e Picasso.

Di cosa ho bisogno e cosa puoi avere in cambio:

  • Il costo della produzione di questi due cartoni è di circa 6.000 euro. Se supererò questa soglia li farò tradurre anche in inglese per allargare il numero di bambini che possono avvicinarsi all'arte, in tutto il mondo o li utilizzerò per allargare la collana anche ad altri artisti.
  • Ho previsto diverse soglie di supporto in funzione della disponibilità e del desiderio di diventare protagonisti dei cartoni. 
  • La partecipazione minima è di 25 euro.
  • Diamo la possibilità a 5 bambini di comparire (disegnati ovviamente) all'interno dei cartoni animati come ringraziamento per la formula di supporto più importante. 
  • Se non raggiungerò l'intera cifra userò il ricavato di questa campagna per coprire parzialmente i costi di almeno un cartone animato.

Il tuo contributo è importante.

Insegnare l'arte ai bambini così piccoli li aiuta ad apprendere nuovi linguaggi e a formare un proprio modo di interpretare quello che vedono. Ci sono tanti studi che dimostrano che a questa età, se ben stimolati, i ragazzi imparano molto facilmente sia le lingue sia questi strumenti di espressione che quando saranno grandi torneranno utili per esprimersi, comprendere gli altri e farsi capire. 

Questo è anche un periodo storico in cui l'insegnamento di queste materie nelle scuole sta scomparendo e io, nel mio piccolo, sto cercando di compensare questa carenza con i miei due piccoli eroi.

Se non puoi contribuire economicamente:

So che non tutti possono contribuire alla campagna. Se credi comunque nel progetto, ti sono piaciuti i cartoni o semplicemente credi che insegnare l'arte ai bambini sia importante per la loro educazione, puoi passare parola e fare in modo che la campagna coinvolga più persone possibile! Più siamo, più facciamo squadra.  Condividere la campagna da Indiegogo sui tuoi social network è molto facile.


Grazie di cuore! e... alla prossima arte-avventura!

Francesca, Sbuccia e Puntino

story:
A HUGE THANK YOU!!

With the help of additional supporters who donated outside of IndieGogo, we are excited to say that we have met our goal of $14,000. This was accomplished with your help and individual donations, and for that we are extremely grateful. Donations continue to come in, and these will go toward Phase II of our digitization project. You can visit our web site at: http://www.woodrowwilsonproject.org for more information. 

Thank you again for all of your support!!  

- Mary Margaret Link & Elizabeth Shortt

***************************************

HELP US DIGITIZE 100 YEARS OF THIS MAN'S HISTORY. (HINT: HE'S A UNITED STATES PRESIDENT)

Spread across the United States, spanning several states, libraries, living rooms and private homes, lie the documents and papers of one of the most influential presidents of the 1900’s, President Woodrow Wilson. Once considered one of America’s most accessible presidents thanks to the Papers of Woodrow Wilson originally published by Princeton University Press, the Woodrow Wilson Presidential Library needs your help to make this man’s papers available in digital form.

The Papers Of Woodrow Wilson, edited by Arthur S. Link and originally published by Princeton University Press, was compiled in the mid-1970’s and consists of about 10% of Wilson’s works, comprised of a total of 38,400 total documents contained on 39,936 pages.


The Journal of American History described 
the Papers of Woodrow Wilson as

"an unprecedented illumination of Wilson's activities and ideas."


Founded in 2004, the Woodrow Wilson Presidential Library Foundation seeks to preserve this president’s collections and materials by embarking on a digitization project, the Woodrow Wilson Digitization Project, which would gather these documents in one place, memorialize them and make them accessible to the public.

We need your help to do this!


Why We Need Your Donations 

Research can be expensive and time consuming.


Right now, unless you:

  • know that the document exists
  • know where it is
  • and can get to it
you have limited access to these vital pieces of American history.
But we can change that.


What We Can Do With Your Help

Your contribution will make a huge difference. We will use the funds you donate to do the following:

  • GIVE EVERYONE EASIER ACCESS

    The public does not have easy access to the majority of Woodrow Wilson’s work. DIGITIZING AND PUTTING ON THE INTERNET WOULD GIVE EASIER ACCESS TO HIS PAPERS.

  • PUT IT ALL IN ONE PLACE

    Woodrow Wilson’s documents are scattered across the continent.  ALL DOCUMENTS IN ONE PLACE WOULD MAKE IT EASY TO DO ONE STOP SHOPPING.

  • PRESERVE THEM FOREVER

    Losing the documents would lose the only piece of that history recorded. DIGITIZING THE DOCUMENTS WOULD SUPPORT THE LONG TERM PRESERVATION OF THESE PIECES FOREVER.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word!

If you know others who are interested in President Woodrow Wilson, preserving his history and making a contribution, please share this link with them, by either posting the link to this campaign to your social media pages or forwarding it to friends. We'd love your help in getting the word out! Thank you!

Help make Woodrow Wilson one of the most accessible presidents in American history.

story:
You are being invited to donate and help fund the African Nursing Education Project (ANEP), a Charity founded in 2004 by Dr. Samson Omotosho, a professor of Nursing with the University of Phoenix. Dr. Omotosho has been a nurse educator for over 30 years - both in Africa and here in the US. 

(Samson Omotosho, PhD, RN)

The purpose of this particular campaign is to raise funds to be used in sending nursing textbooks, computers, and other educational materials to nursing schools in Africa. Currently, many of the nursing school libraries in those countries can benefit considerably from this campaign. Today, the situation is very dire for many of the schools. Yet, in many African countries, nurses greatly help to ameliorate the impact of the low doctor-patient ratio. Therefore, fostering quality of nursing education and producing high quality nurses becomes a necessity and an ideal goal. One way of achieving that goal is making books and other educational materials readily available to the nursing students, through your help with funding.

(Students of a nursing school attending ANEP's book donation in 2014)


That was what led to the creation of ANEP in 2004. Through the project, we have collected thousands of used, and hundreds of new, nursing textbooks from the universities here in the US where Dr. Omotosho had previously taught, and shipped the books to various nursing schools in Nigeria as free donations. We have personally borne the costs of collecting and shipping the books. Each round of collecting, packing, shipping, and delivery has cost between $800 and $2,000. There are many more schools in Africa with similar needs than we can financially service. Also, there are many more nursing schools here in the US that have offered to donate books than we can financially afford to ship to Africa. So, we need your help! Your funding will help us accept more book donations for shipping and help us stock many more nursing school libraries, not only in Nigeria but across all the other countries in Africa. 


(ANEP's Representative, Mr. Demola Kolade talking with the Osun State Commissioner for Health, Dr. Tope Ilori, during a book donation ceremony) 


Funds Needed

The specific goal of this campaign is to reach 300 to 350 nursing schools across Africa. At an average of $1,500 per shipping, we will need up to $500,000 for the project. A little fraction of the funds will be used to produce a very nice “ANEP” T-shirt to give to each of you our donors, as a token of our appreciation for being an important part of this campaign. However, not reaching our goal of $500,000 will not stop the project; we might only not be able to reach our target of as many as 300 nursing schools. Nonetheless, we will still proceed to reach and service as many schools as the funds can cover. (Note: If you are unable to donate through this website and you would prefer to donate in Naira, use the following Naira account: Bank: UBA, Account Number: 1007269681).

The Impact

You are being invited to take part in a laudable project indeed. Imagine how many lives we will be touching together when our efforts have helped thousands of people to become nurses. Not ordinary nurses, but nurses who have experienced a sound quality of education simply because you have partnered with us to provide the necessary learning materials for that purpose. Those kinds of nurses deliver effective programs of health promotion, disease prevention, and nursing care to their various clients, be it individuals, families or even communities.

Also, remember that it is now a global world. It is a small world that keeps getting smaller and smaller because of the unprecedented geometric advancements in technology, communication, and travel. That globalization includes and affects healthcare also. Whatever happens to healthcare and its providers in one part of the world rapidly impacts other parts of the world, either for good or for bad, irrespective of physical distance. The current global fight on Ebola is an exemplary case in point. And the point is, any investment we make to foster health care abroad is partly an investment into healthcare in the homeland, ultimately.   

ANEP has done this project successfully for over ten years! We have received letters of appreciation from commissioners of health and principals of nursing schools. One principal disclosed that the State had just built his school a new library and the books we shipped to them were the first and only books on their shelves! A commissioner for health of a State, on the instruction of the governor, formally received ANEP’s book donation in a video-recorded ceremony and instructed that a copy of the video and an album of pictures be couriered to us in the US! So folks, you will indeed be partaking in a project of high significance and one that has lots of benefits for its beneficiaries– one that will be very appreciated eternally both by us and by the recipients.
