story:
UPDATE:

This is the last day of our campaign and we want to end with a nice round number.  Help us make it to $5, 050,000 be the end of the day!  

Class of 2015 Urged by Warnock to Fight Societal Ills by ‘Building and Burying’

Listen to the full speech here: 


Listen to President John Silvanus Wilson Jr. '79 and the Reverend Dr. Raphael G. Warnock '91, senior pastor of Ebenezer Baptist Church, speak to radio station Kiss 104.1FM in Atlanta about why YOU should give to the MLK restoration.  Click the link here: Kiss 104.1 FM Interview


Nelson Mandela received 37 honorary degrees here. F.W. de Klerk apologized for apartheid from this stage. Spike Lee premiered “When the Levees Broke.”  And Stevie Wonder came to be inspired.

There’s a price to pay for a building of this magnitude.

Now, the Chapel is cracking, peeling and leaking from age and use. We need to make major fixes now—before more damage is done.

King Chapel on the campus of Morehouse College is the only one of its kind in the world.
Everyone—from educators to entertainers, heads of states to social activists —is honored to speak in the only religious building named for Dr. King, Morehouse’s most distinguished graduate.



These leaders are humbled to visit the nation’s only college for African American men because of the rare opportunity to talk to an audience of 2,000 men whose intellect, ambition and social consciousness earned them the privilege of becoming Morehouse Men.

Urgent Repairs.  Immediate Need.

The fixes needed to restore the Chapel are major, with a new roof, new seating and new HVAC system the most important among them.

You know how delayed maintenance goes. It simply doesn’t work, and damages pile up like dominoes.

Your donation, regardless of size, will help us get started today with getting this national treasure to the condition on par with its importance to the community.

Why King Chapel?

Making Morehouse Men.  Every Morehouse student attends Crown Forum, an assembly that dates back decades.  Our students are inspired to become servant leaders with a passion for social justice.

It is the same tradition that nurtured King when he was a student here.  And he was not alone. Others include:

  • Samuel L. Jackson '72, Academy Award-nominated actor
  • Spike Lee '79, filmmaker and director
  • Jeh Johnson '79, U.S. Secretary of Homeland Security
  • David Satcher '63, former U.S. Surgeon General 
  • Louis Sullivan '54, former U.S. Secretary of Health and Human Services
  • Edwin Moses '78, Olympic Gold Medalist
  • Geoffrey Golden '15, 2014 BET Sunday’s Best Winner
  • PJ Morton '03, keyboardist for Maroon 5
Three million and counting. That’s the number of events that have occurred in King Chapel.

The first stop in General Motor’s four-city tour of the Table of Brotherhood Project, moderated by Roland Martin, was here.

When ESPN wanted to talk about race and sports, they brought that discussion here!

And the announcement that the College had acquired the highly coveted 10,000-piece Martin Luther King Jr. Collection was—of course—made here.

Celebrating All Faiths.  From Al Sharpton to Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, the Chapel offers its audiences wisdom and observations from a wide range of teachings and belief systems.

The Hall is Alive With Music. From arias from the acclaimed Atlanta Symphony Orchestra to the anthems of our very own world-renowned Morehouse College Glee Club, to the ballads of R&B sensation Fantasia, the Chapel has hosted guests from across the musical gamut.

WHAT WE CAN DO WITH YOUR HELP

We hope that you will have the chance to visit the Chapel—as literally millions have—to experience this national treasure for yourself.

But for now, we’re asking that you join us in restoring King Chapel. Every donation, regardless of size, is needed and will be put to good use.

The King Chapel Restoration Project is an $8-million campaign. So far, we’ve raised $5 million toward the goal, leaving us with $3 million to raise before the end of this campaign on May 5, 2015.

We need YOU to help us close the gap. 

Everyone who donates $25 or more will be listed in a souvenir rededication program when the Chapel reopens in all its renewed glory!

Here’s the work that needs to be done:

  • Replace major building systems (HVAC, electrical, plumbing, fire protection and code compliance improvements, including ADA)
  • Replace the roof
  • Replace auditorium seating
  • Install state-of-the-art audio/visual equipment and lighting
  • Install new acoustical shell and stage equipment
  • Improve ceiling grid, painting, flooring and signage

Your Tax-Deductible Donation

All donations to the King Chapel Restoration Project are fully tax-deductible. When you make a donation, you will immediately receive a charitable receipt. Morehouse College is a registered 501c3. Our EIN/Tax ID # is: 58-0566205.

Here's How To Get More Information

  • To learn more about Morehouse College, visit our website at www.morehouse.edu
  • To learn more about the Martin Luther King Jr. International Chapel, visit the King Chapel website  at www.morehouse.edu/mlkchapel
  • To see 73 of the 193 commissioned oil portraits in the Chapel's International Hall of Honor, visit the website at https://mlkchapel.culturalspot.org/home

Lee '79, filmmaker and director


Jeh
Johnson '79, U.S. Secretary of Homeland Security


David
Satcher '63, former U.S. Surgeon General 


Louis
Sullivan '54, former U.S. Secretary of Health and Human Services


Edwin
Moses '78, Olympic Gold Medalist


Geoffrey
Golden '15, 2014 BET Sunday’s Best Winner


PJ
Morton '03, keyboardist for Maroon 5


Three
million and counting. That’s the number of events that have occurred in King
Chapel. 
The first stop in General Motor’s four-city tour of the
Table of Brotherhood Project, moderated by Roland Martin, was here. 


When ESPN wanted to talk about race and sports, they
brought that discussion here! 


And the announcement that the College had acquired the highly
coveted 10,000-piece Martin Luther King Jr. Collection was—of course—made here.



Celebrating
All Faiths.  From Al Sharpton to Sri Sri Ravi
Shankar, the Chapel offers its audiences wisdom and observations from a wide
range of teachings and belief systems. 




The
Hall is Alive With Music. From arias from the acclaimed
Atlanta Symphony Orchestra to the anthems of our very own world-renowned
Morehouse College Glee Club, to the ballads of R&B sensation Fantasia,
the Chapel has hosted guests from across the musical gamut.



WHAT
WE CAN DO WITH YOUR HELP


We hope that you will have the chance to visit the
Chapel—as literally millions have—to experience this national treasure for
yourself. 
But for now, we’re asking that you join us in restoring
King Chapel. Every donation, regardless of size, is needed and will be put to
good use. 
The King Chapel Restoration Project is an $8-million
campaign. So far, we’ve raised $5 million toward the goal, leaving us with $3
million to raise before the end of this campaign on May 5, 2015. 
We need YOU to help us close the gap. 



Everyone who donates $25 or more will be listed in a souvenir rededication
program when the Chapel reopens in all its
renewed glory!



Here’s
the work that needs to be done:


Replace major building systems (HVAC, electrical, plumbing, fire
protection and code compliance improvements, including ADA)
Replace the roof
Replace auditorium seating
Install state-of-the-art audio/visual equipment and lighting
Install new acoustical shell and stage equipment
Improve ceiling grid, painting, flooring and signage


Your Tax-Deductible
Donation
All donations to the King Chapel Restoration Project are fully tax-deductible. When you make a donation, you will immediately receive a charitable receipt. Morehouse College is a registered 501c3. Our EIN/Tax ID # is: 58-0566205.
Here's How To Get More Information



To learn more about Morehouse College, visit our website at www.morehouse.edu


To learn more about the Martin Luther King Jr. International Chapel, visit the King Chapel website  at www.morehouse.edu/mlkchapel

To see 73 of the 193 commissioned oil portraits in the Chapel's International Hall of Honor, visit the website at https://mlkchapel.culturalspot.org/home

story:
Adinkra was selected at the Hult Prize's Dubai Regional Final as one of the six best ideas to transform early childhood education in urban slums around the world. 

The annual Hult Prize Challenge, supported by the Clinton Global Initiative and the Hult International Business School, is the planet’s largest student competition that gives the winner a US$ 1 million prize in seed capital.


Easy, affordable and fun. A game-changing solution to early childhood education.

Adinkra is an informal portable school that uses pedagogical magic tricks to develop children's multiple intelligences. With less than one dollar, parents and care takers from urban slums around the world will be able to give boys and girls the same stimulation they would have if they attended expensive formal schools.

No bigger than a matchbox


Divided into 4 different boxes, separated by age groups, the Adinkra Magic Box contains a wide range of fun activities that use pedagogical magic tricks to spark the curiosity that children need for learning.

The custom boxes stimulate specific multiple intelligences in different age groups (0 to 2; 2 to 4; 4 to 5; and 5 to 6 year olds).

Adinkra is an informal portable school



Children love magic!


The benefits of using magic pedagogically are noticed in different studies, for example magic develops communication, sequencing, critical thinking, problem solving and increases attention span of children.

Each Adinkra Box has 10 magic tricks that will enhance the learning process in a very interactive way. A visual and colorful user guide will make it easy for anyone to learn how to perform the tricks and amaze children!

The boxes are aimed at fathers, mothers and care takers, who will be empowered to play with their kids and, at the same time, be their informal teachers.

 Ten million children impacted by 2020

Adinkra can easily reach millions of people, transforming the learning process into a tangible and visual educational experience.
The company's business model relies on local micro-franchises that will receive and distribute the Adinkra Magic Boxes to shops and grocery stores in vulnerable areas. 

Operating at full potential, Adinkra will sell each box for US$ 0.95 and will be able to impact more than 10 million children in urban slums in Latin America, Africa and Asia.

You can help us meet this goal

We count on your support to bring Adinkra to the whole world. 

We are Adinkra


Guilherme is an Economist and Professional Magician. João is an Internationalist and Social Policy Advisor. Thaís is a PhD candidate with over 5 years of experience working in Brazilian favelas. Together, we are ready to take this challenge!

story:
Update 5/21/2015 

We can get our $10,000 doubled if we reach our goal!!! If you haven't donated to support Nepal yet, help us reach out goal and your funds will be doubled by a donor at Music for Relief they are working to get to $75,000 to get funds doubled and we can help majorly if we hit $10,000!  We have updates from the Music for Relief team 

according to the latest reports,  the second earthquake on May 12 caused massive landslides and many additional buildings collapsed killing over 80 people and injuring thousands. Together with the casualty numbers from the first earthquake, over 8,000 people have lost their lives and over 17,000 are injured.  In remote areas, entire villages are reported to have been destroyed. More than 2.8 million people have been displaced, and many of their homes have been damaged beyond repair. Massive make-shift camps have been constructed, but even before the second earthquake the situation was dire. Heavy rains have already drenched the camps, and diseases thrive in these wet, crowded conditions. Worse yet, torrential monsoon rains are expected to begin in June. 

We are sending updates to our fundraisers with progress and information about how your funds are being used. Please join us and help us make this contribution double!  We thank you all for you support in helping LHS and LFR support Nepal.

UPDATE 5/1/2015

Love Hope Strength Foundation (LHS) has decided to partner with Music for Relief (MFR), a non-profit disaster relief organization founded by Linkin Park, in a campaign uniting the music industry in support of Nepal. Although LHS is a cancer foundation, since launching this campaign it is clear we feel strongly about raising funds to support beautiful Nepal, where our journey of “Saving Lives One Concert At a Time” began. 

Why Music For Relief?

Music for Relief has implemented successful fundraising and awareness programs following more than 25 disasters on four continents. With established relationships in humanitarian aid, disaster response and other artist and entertainment foundations we feel strongly together we can elevate support. Music for Relief is committed to helping affected communities immediately with food water and medical aid and rebuilding efforts in the long term.  LHS will continue to communicate and advise on how the funds can make the most direct impact with our partners on the ground in Nepal. 

Use of Donations

All the donations raised with our campaign by the LHS family and outside contributors will go to Music for Relief where 100% of donations will be allocated to partners on the ground with Oxfam and International Medical Corps. Oxfam will be providing food, water, and sanitation solutions, while International Medical Corps deploys mobile medical units to dispense medicine and provide urgent treatment. 


Summary 4/25

Make direct/impactful no waste relief for Nepal. The Love Hope Strength Foundation started our journey of saving lives one concert at a time with a wild idea to hike and perform the highest concert ever on land at Mt Everest. At the beginning of LHS is Everest Rocks.  The event where we took a team of international musicians and supporters to climb the mountain and raise money to help support the Bhaktapur Cancer Hospital and their amazing people and country. The many events following are because of the love hope and strength we felt in Nepal as hikers conquered fears and we accomplished our goals of building this charity. Nepal has a special place in our foundation and we are determined to help raise funds and act as support and connectors to giving entities and other relief partners looking to help the desperate needs of the beautiful Nepalese people and amazing country of Nepal. 

  • LHS has previously supported projects in Nepal. We intend to act as a trusted conduit and connector to support the disaster relief efforts in Nepal, helping to make the most direct impact possible for your funds with no waste.
  • We want to ignite the passion of our large network and connections in the music and entertainment industry to support LHS and the partners we collaborate with in awareness/fundraising for Nepal. Our foundation started there and we feel we have the tools and network to help.
  • We know by working with our partners (nationally and internationally) your money will be  utilized wisely, our networks can direct us the best routes to utilize your disaster funds more efficiently and quickly, without bureaucracy to slow us down.
  • While we are in communication with partners we have not yet determined exactly where the funds are going but insure it will be with trusted relief teams who can update and inform all supporters on how our fundraising is allocated.

Risks & Challenges facing Nepal

This is just the beginning, by the time this is over there will be thousands dead,  thousands homeless and many of the beautiful temples and monuments that make this country so amazing, destroyed.  We've gotten word that the Bhaktapur area of Kathmandu,  the area where our support cancer center is located was hit hard.  The infrastructure of hospitals in Nepal are almost non-existent on a good day; they keep hand sanitizer under lock and key much less having access to enough antibiotics or other basic necessities.  This is all going to be magnified plus the loss of their own income as travel slows down and rebuild begins. We want to help get awareness out acting as a conduit to get Nepal the support they need in the trying times ahead.
Other Ways You Can Help


Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
Please share our campaign and ask others to support Nepal with the LHS family.
We truly appreciate your support.  Whether we are saving lives through cancer initiatives or through efforts like this, we are passionate about helping save lives. We intend to use our connections in the entertainment and non-profit industry to do all we can to efficiently help those hurting and suffering in Nepal.  
You can also go directly to http://musicforrelief.org to support Nepal 
OR 

Text MFR to 41444 and make your donation to support Nepal @Musicforrelief

story:
My team and I are working very hard each day to bring in new students, spread the word, and promote, market and build this harmonica instructional workshop. PLEASE DONATE AND HELP SPREAD THE WORD TODAY...

  • I am in danger of having to cancel this year's Second Annual Midwest Harmonica Workshop in St Paul Minnesota, where I was born.
  • I am a life long harmonica student, and in fact, learning harmonica changed my life. I am working very hard to continue to offer an inexpensive, yet very extensive workshop open to all levels and types of harmonica players and .fans
  • I am in my second year of putting my life into this work, as it is my dream and passion, with no regrets.  I will not be able to continue offering this incredible program in St Paul, Hawaii or elsewhere.
  • In 2012 I followed my dream and I began working to build these workshops locally and nationally gaining quite a bit of notice since then in the harmonica and music community worldwide.
  •  I look to bring more workshops to Hawaii and Texas as well as other locations, allowing for more people to learn... but really need your support.
  • Last year was a great experience, and completely in line with our mission statement. Several 2014 students have expressed interest in the workshop again, but have not yet "bit the bullet" and registered yet, so we need funding to bridge the gap.
  • My staff and team of instructors are working very hard in our marketing, promotion- spreading the word. For whatever reason, we are still  having  a hard time pulling in students for 2015. I do not want all of our hard work to go to waste.
  •  All of our collected funds are to help guarantee that we can make this happen this year and in future years.

The Impact

My Passion and Mission statement confirm my intentions and ability to make this happen. I intend to further the preservation of the Harmonica in as many ways possible, one workshop at a time and through our website atwww.midwestharmonica.com become a great resource for harmonica players everywhere. My mission statement : 

“I will bring the highest quality training and most valuable harmonica experience to everyone at an affordable cost, with an unmatchable value. I will make it easy to get to, for people all around the globe. I will use this as a way to network and improve on my own skills as I strive to become the best harmonica player I can. This is to be done in the most organized and professional manner, as to preserve and to continue the ever expanding interest in the Tin Sandwich”. 

Mahalo, I am grateful for your prompt participation in this fundraising event 

– Sean Wailin’ O’Phelan

Please SHARE with everyone you possibly can!! I want people that want to learn from scratch as well as professional harmonica players in attendance. I also want people from all over the world, this workshop weekend is not limited to people in MN or the Midwest in any way and was made affordable enough that anyone can make it happen. Please SHARE the Webpage, the Youtube Videos, The Facebook Page and also Twitter and Instagram. We have had several articles and ads in magazines and  in newspaper and on the radio in MN and internationally. Tell a friend. If you have a dream, make it a reality, then tell people, inspire!! Aloha and Mahalo!! Contact me to ask how you can help, via phone or email!

Risks & Challenges

RISK 

*I may lose the opportunity to make a difference in the area in which I have become so experienced and knowledgeable in.

* I have had so much help and support from friends and family alike, it would be sad to see all of this energy go to waste.

*It will be much harder next year to come back if we lose momentum this year

*Not having the money to make everything happen

CHALLENGES

*I am going to be in MN promoting on foot, much earlier this year than last, and my brother and family are already helping out locally.

*My team and I are working every day to ensure that the whole world hears about this workshop, and enough people come to them, through social media, radio, tv, newspaper, magazine articles, emails, telephone calls,coupons, groupons, and so on, in order to continue teaching harmonica.

What we need and What you get: 

We have several levels of funding, as we know, there will be folks here that will just be interested in merchandise ( which is really cool and a great way to help us out), others are motivated by the idea and the dream of building something, and still others want to attend the workshop. With that in mind we hope we've put together a number of great options for you to get involved. Contributions of $50 or more get your name or company logo on the website!!

NOTE : If you cannot support financially at the level you would like yet you have an idea for promotion( say your cousin works in television and can get us some free press), PLEASE REACH OUT TO ME. We will gladly accept help in all forms!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute at the level they would like to but that doesn't mean they can't help:

-START a sponsorship event, or fundraiser for a friend or yourself to attend the workshop or make a donation

- ASK a friend or family to also contribute to your donation

-SHARE, through Indiegogo, Facebook, Youtube, Twitter, Instagram, Vine or Email

- PRINT the FLYER and share or post it in important places around the globe ( Music stores, schools, venues, etc.)

- EMAIL me with your suggestions and comments and how you can help, find a resource, volunteer some time, or maybe you have a small tip that could end up changing the game? Any tips, advice or resources are very much appreciated and as valuable as any donation. Mahalo -  Sean Wailin O'Phelan

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Ashley and in 2012 I traveled to Nepal for over a month.  I immediately fell in love with the beautiful people and culture of Nepal.  While in Pokhara, I met and began working with the Women's Skill Development Organization.  Over the past two years I have been working with the women directly by bringing their beautiful handwoven goods to America.
  • My personal connection to Nepal makes me feel compelled to help now more than ever.
  • Pokhara, and the surrounding villages were impacted the most severely by the earthquake.  And because of the mountainous terrain, many of the small villages are hard, if not impossible, to reach. My goal is to raise funds that will go directly the women of the Women's Skill Development Organization who are assisting those suffering in these villages. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am aiming to raise $2,500 to go directly to the Women's Skill Development Organization in Pokhara, Nepal.
  • The funding will be put towards food, water, medical supplies, blankets, tents.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Get the word out! Tell your friends, family and coworkers about my campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What is StopMRSA?

StopMRSA is a new foundation that aims to increase public awareness about MRSA and stimulate action within the community to slow the growth and spread of MRSA. Find out more at our website


Antibiotic resistance is one of the biggest threats to our world today. And perhaps no superbug out there is scarier than MRSA. Your contributions are a part of a larger and continual effort by StopMRSA to protect the global community from a future in which MRSA is an unstoppable killer.

Currently, we are aiming to raise $600. 100% of the funds raised will go to the MRSA Survivors Network (even if we don't reach our goal), which works to help those affected by MRSA and educate the public about this issue. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that's okay. All we ask is that you tell someone you know about this fundraiser. Help us get the word out there!

story:
Marko Djordjevic is the first Serbian to receive a full scholarship at Bentley University in Boston, for the MBA program of Leadership and Innovation. Bentley University is ranked among the top business universities in the USA.

TO:
March 6, 2015
Mr. Marko Djordjevic
Kralja Petra I, 28/d
Novi Sad, 21000 Serbia

"Dear Mr. Djordjevic, Congratulations! You have been selected to receive an Academic Scholarship from The Graduate School of Business at Bentley University. This award will come in the form of tuition remission that will assume the value of 100% of your total tuition during the first two years of enrollment in The Bentley MBA program at Bentley. We will credit your student account in equal installments each semester that you are enrolled:

Base Tuition Cost: $ 67620
Discount Rate: 100%
Discount Value: $ 67620
Total Tuition Cost: $ 0"

This is great! However, in order to accomplish this, in further I need to cover additional International Student Expenses for 2015–2016 Bentley MBA Program:

Room: $13,596
Board/Meals: $ 2,706
Books and supplies: $ 1,738
Personal expenditures: $ 1,892
Computer/technology fee: $ 225
Mandatory insurance: $1,703
_______________________
Estimated total $21.860


WHY YOU SHOULD INVEST IN ME ?

Marko has earned his academic leadership skills at the International University, European Center for Peace, University of the United Nations, Lomonosov University in Russia, European Institution in Brussels and The European Parliament in Strasbourg. He organized international projects in the student organization of AIESEC. He also completed an internship program at BOSCH in Germany.

European Youth Movement in Brussels

The session of the European Youth Movement in Brussels

Representatives of the European Youth Movement of Romania and Serbia in the EP, Brussels

ECPD University UNITED NATIONS

Gaining practical experience in BOSCH, Stuttgart Germany

European Parliament in Strasbourg

With AIESEC International team in Russia

UNESCO PARIS

Cooperation on humanitarian projects with the Ambassador of Japan


Marko is very accomplished for his young age and has overcome many obstacles as did many of his generation in Serbia. Some of his accomplishments include: working on and organizing many projects, working with influential partners, use of second languages in international settings.

Now, after much hard work and offer of a full scholarship from Bentley University, Marko is collecting funds for costs of everyday living in Boston during the time of his MBA studies.

Marko says, Bentley University has offered me a scholarship in the amount of $67,620, as acknowledgement of my professional experience and previous studies, but it does not cover the cost of living for the MBA study period of 13 months. I AM CONFIDENT THAT I CAN ONLY SUCCEED WITH YOUR HELP!


Why MBA?

I believe that the MBA is the future of my education and logical path for the future of my career. I believe that Bentley's program can offer to me the best opportunity to learn from the best and give me the opportunity to take my professional skills in leadership to the next level, and enhance my current skills in international economics and strategic management. The MBA prepares me for the workforce that I am ready to enter in 13 months. I truly believe that I am a good representative of my country.

I believe that I can bring a better future, and encourage young adults to take the initiative and believe in themselves as this is the only way that they will succeed. It is because of this belief that my MBA studies are such an important step in my career bath. It is because of this belief that I am asking for your help. Without you, I can not move forward to accomplish my goal.

Your donation is the key to my MBA studies and therefore would like to offer my skills to you. I can assist in preparing CVs, translating documents in foreign languages, give a lecture, help with organizational planning and it would be a pleasure for me to do so.


WHAT YOU CAN DO?

1) Donate some means with Your credit card and select one of the perks on the right.

For USD transfers:

Account With Institution
OTP BANKA SRBIJA A.D. NOVI SAD, Serbia
SWIFT CODE: OTPVRS22

Beneficiary Customer
/RS35325934270151563485
MARKO ĐORĐEVIĆ
KRALJA ALEKSANDRA 010
21000 NOVI SAD

________________

For EUR transfers:

Account With Institution
OTP BANKA SRBIJA A.D. NOVI SAD, Serbia
SWIFT CODE: OTPVRS22

Beneficiary Customer
/RS35325934170151561162
MARKO ĐORĐEVIĆ
KRALJA ALEKSANDRA 010
21000 NOVI SAD

________________

For RSD transfers:

Beneficiary
325-9300701514650-46


2) Invite Your friends to DONATE FUNDS and SHARE via Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/marko.djordjevic.9883739 or Youtube https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FsaRslONOuo

Because success is achieving in teamwork ...


THANK YOU for your effort and contribution!

Marko Djordjevic

story:
STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) is hot. On the Internet, in the classroom and in society.

Employment: STEM jobs are growing and we don't have enough bodies to fill them.

Global Solutions: Global warming — Hunger — Pollution — Super storms. We need more scientific experts to solve these challenges.

Social Media: I F*cking Love Science, celebrating all things science, launched in May 2012. It now has more than 9 million likes on Facebook and an upcoming Discovery Channel program. STEM sites have millions of visitors a month.

We need to better educate people, make STEM engaging and fun, reach out to untouched minds and get people thinking.

Studies show that almost 65% of people are visual learners. Visual learners:

  • Learn best when a lesson or concept is demonstrated
  • Pick up cues from watching the teacher
  • Need clear visual images in order to store and process information

This is why communicating complex science concepts is a challenge in the 2-D world of the Internet.  Online learning lacks a robust set of visualization tools to support teacher-student and student-to-student interaction and collaboration.

Aristotl is a 3-D virtual classroom, content-creation tool, marketplace and community.

Aristotle allows for interactive online learning, collaboration and sale of content across a dynamic, multi-dimensional landscape.

Potential Aristotlians include Teachers, Students, STEM professionals, Schools and the occasional nerd. 

We let people Educate, Create, Collaborate

Aristotl. A tool – A community – A social network

Virtual Labs in 3-D:

Aristotl provides the most interactive learning environment available for engaging lab participants. Scientific concepts can be explained and demonstrated in vivid 3-D detail. Experiments can be run in virtual labs and students can collaborate in study groups.

Resources and Content:

Aristotl will include libraries of images related to chemistry, astronomy, anatomy and physics. It also will have an easy-to-use content authoring tool that will allow users to draw objects from existing libraries or create their own unique content.

E-Commerce:

Classes and content can be sold through the online marketplace.

And More:

Aristotl will include an HTML 5 whiteboard, ability to upload and annotate content, and real-time chat and video conferencing. Also in the works: gesture controls for the classroom and content creation tools. We are currently examining the Leap controller and see future possibilities with MS Kinect and other gesture-control environments.

story:
Pathways Addresses the Big What Ifs

 

What if our young people had the skills, tools, and confidence to overcome their greatest challenges and the ability and desire to take 100% responsibility for their lives and their future? 

What if they learned to:

  • reframe limiting beliefs about what's possible in their lives
  • create a vision for their future
  • overcome lack of motivation
  • enhance self esteem
  • increase academic engagement
  • set goals and implement action plans to reach them
  • make healthy choices around risky behavior that may lead to substance abuse, unintended pregnancy, court involvement (the things that cost society lots of money!)

What if our young people had the skills, tools and strategies to choose and engage in work that supports the vision they hold for their future?

What if  businesses, families and communities could benefit from a generation of work-ready, service oriented youth with the skills, tools and drive to live their full potential?

What if our young people could support their own kids in doing the same?

And what if you took advantage of one of our perks that provides a sample of our work and a tool that could help you make a shift in your life TODAY!

That's what Pathways to Success for Youth is all about ... tapping into human potential and transforming our collective future.

Our Long Term Need

We've already covered our training and travel expenses. The next phase is producing a teen friendly video series and further developing curriculum materials for live and online classroom materials and teacher training guides.

The experts tell me this phase will cost $100,000 to complete.

We're scheduled to implement this coming year and it's time to turn up the volume on fundraising and get this done!

A Glimpse into the Pathways to Success for Youth Project

Did you know that only 20% of the US adult population are passionate about what they do for work? According to Gallup surveys, fewer that 1 in 3 American workers are committed to the success of their organizations and a shocking 52% of American workers are disengaged and not willing to do any more than necessary to keep their jobs.

In a outdated educational system that is having a hard time keeping up with our changing work culture, with fewer jobs and higher demand for creativity and an entrepreneurial mindset, our young people are caught in the middle and often become disenfranchised, disengaged and disconnected.

The Pathways to Success for Youth Curriculum helps to improve school culture, increase academic engagement and motivation and supports healthy decision making by raising self esteem and connection and teaching students to connect with their passions, unique purpose and personal vision of success while providing the tools and strategies to break through limiting beliefs and overcome obstacles so that they can reach their fullest potential. 

This work teaches the tools and techniques to identify, reframe, and clear subconscious blocks and barriers and allows them to connect with their inner selves and others from a heart centered place guided by love, compassion, and joy all while learning how to take 100% responsibility for their thoughts, words and actions. Setting goals, developing action plans, creating support systems and  accountability and masterminding networks put students on the path to success, however they choose to define it.

This content has the potential to transform youth, adults, families, workplaces, communities and the world! Adults are learning it through Jack's Breakthrough to Success events and going back to clear lots of old patterns and beliefs in the process. Now it's time to give young people the tools they need to fully access their brain, their heart and their connection with others on their personal path to success.

Pathways to Success: From the Start

Jack Canfield, former high school history teacher, co-author of the Chicken Soup for the Soul series and America's success coach, has been teaching the principles outlined in his book, Success Principles: How to Get From Where You Are to Where You Want to Be, to adults interested in personal development, leadership development and business success. 

This work is a compilation of over 30 years of research, experience and powerful content including activities, strategies, exercises, tools and techniques designed to build self esteem, manage stress, overcome limiting beliefs, expand creativity and harness the power of the brain and the heart to create a life of passion, purpose and success, however we choose to define it. In addition, this powerful work provides participants with the foundation necessary to successfully pursue entrepreneurial businesses and collaborations and increase joy and happiness in all aspects of their personal and professional lives.

Recently he announced his commitment to train 1,000,000 trainers around the world with this work. Trish and the Pathways Youth Team fully support this vision.

Trish was first introduced to Jack Canfield's Success Principles work at a live event in August 2010 when she attended as part of her plan to leave youth service work and get back on a career path where she could increase her income. But after the very first day of the training, she found herself going back to her hotel room and incorporating The Success Principles into the health curriculum and peer education programs she was already teaching to local youth through the White Mountain Community Health Center's community outreach education program. This continued every day for the 7 day event. Each day in the training room she kept asking herself, "Why aren't we teaching this to our kids?"and each night she went back to her room and incorporated what she had learned into her lesson plans.  Before long, Trish realized that she was a long way off from her original intent to explore a new career path for herself, but rather she was fully committed to bringing this work to young people.

The more she learned about how powerful subconscious limiting beliefs are in blocking us from what we want to accomplish in life, she began to see how the young people she worked with could benefit from mastering the power of beliefs to create the life of their dreams. Trish knew in her heart and soul that she was onto something and the passion for this work has not subsided.

  • In September of 2010 she began incorporating a few activities into her health classes and peer education classes.
  • In October, 2011 Trisha continued her training with Jack Canfield in his Advanced Breakthrough to Success and year-long Train the Trainer programs and obtained Jack's permission to use his entire success principles body of work and adapt it for use with young people. Thus the Pathways to Success for Youth program was born.
  • In the summer of 2012 Trisha trained a group of Teen Clinic peer educators using the Pathways to Success for Youth model.
  • In the Spring of 2013, she piloted a full two week curriculum in middle school health classes. The response from students was positive and feedback about several activities were described as "life-changing".
  • In the August of 2014, after a very successful fundraising campaign grossing a total of $9800 in donations for the Pathways to Success Youth Project, Trish brought a team of young people ages 15-24 to an intense success principles training with Jack Canfield so she could begin to expand her work in the schools as well as begin to train teachers, youth service providers and youth leaders in the model. 
  • In the Fall of 2014, Trish, along with her youth team, piloted a full two week curriculum in high school health classes. The feedback from her students was overwhelming and Trish had no doubt that she needed to pursue her vision for expansion.

Trish is currently working with key local, state, regional and national stakeholders to develop a funding plan to fully develop the curriculum and a teacher training program to prepare for further expansion. The goal is to create both live and online curriculum materials that will be easy to replicate in schools and communities across the country.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal of $100,000 will aid us in developing curriculum materials and a teacher training program that can be modified for live classroom and online platforms on a national scale. Within the curriculum will be a professionally produced teen friendly video series that will serve as the basis for the lessons, a student work book and teacher guide. The curriculum has been piloted by Trish with the help of teachers and local youth who have dedicated their time and energy to see this project come to life. 

A portion of funds will also be used to help defray training costs for Pathways to Success for Youth team members as we continue to expand our capacity bring this project to fruition.

Along with each perk listed, you will also receive our sincerest gratitude for your belief in this project and the ultimate success of our youth. 

The Impact

Over the years of working with young people in the Mount Washington Valley, Trish has noticed that lack of connection, limiting beliefs about what's possible and lack of a vision for the future seem to be connected to a lack of motivation, low self esteem, decreased academic engagement and increased risk behavior, including substance use and unintended pregnancy. 

In addition to providing proven success principles, this curriculum teaches the tools and techniques to identify, reframe and clear the subconscious blocks and barriers that hold us back from reaching our full potential while communicating from a heart centered place where we easily connect to ourselves and others, thus enhancing connection and collaboration.

This work helps to improve academic engagement, increase motivation, support healthy decision making and helps students connect with their unique purpose and personal vision of success and so they can reach their fullest potential. 

Students participate in exercises, experiential activities and projects that help them develop personal assets and self esteem while they learn effective stress management and communication skills as well as success principles that will ultimately serve the workforce, employers and entrepreneurial endeavors.

This curriculum can support our young people by reducing unintended pregnancy, enhancing academic success, and reducing substance use in teens by giving them the tools to clear subconscious blocks to success and connect with themselves and others from a heart centered place guided by love, compassion and joy while also learning how to take 100% responsibility for their thoughts, words and actions, set goals and develop action plans.

The Success Principles teach practical tools, skills and the mindset necessary to be creative employees or successful entrepreneurs in today's changing workforce. At the same time, more connected and engaged youth means less substance use, less unintended pregnancy, less court involvement, less bullying, less violence ... and ultimately less money spent on society's problems and a more solid investment in our future. This content has the potential to transform youth, adults, families, workplaces, communities and the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends about us! Share our project on Facebook! Twitter! LinkedIn!

We are pleased to be fundraising partners with the White Mountain Community Health Center in Conway, NH, a 501c3 nonprofit which makes your donations tax deductible.

Within the curriculum will be a professionally produced teen friendly video series that will serve as the basis for the lessons, a student work book and teacher guide. The curriculum has been piloted by Trish with the help of teachers and local youth who have dedicated their time and energy to see this project come to life. 
A portion of funds will also be used to help defray training costs for Pathways to Success for Youth team members as we continue to expand our capacity bring this project to fruition.
Along with each perk listed, you will also receive our sincerest gratitude for your belief in this project and the ultimate success of our youth. 
The Impact
Over the years of working with young people in the Mount Washington Valley, Trish has noticed that lack of connection, limiting beliefs about what's possible and lack of a vision for the future seem to be connected to a lack of motivation, low self esteem, decreased academic engagement and increased risk behavior, including substance use and unintended pregnancy. 
In addition to providing proven success principles, this curriculum teaches the tools and techniques to identify, reframe and clear the subconscious blocks and barriers that hold us back from reaching our full potential while communicating from a heart centered place where we easily connect to ourselves and others, thus enhancing connection and collaboration.
This work helps to improve academic engagement, increase motivation, support healthy decision making and helps students connect with their unique purpose and personal vision of success and so they can reach their fullest potential. 
Students participate in exercises, experiential activities and projects that help them develop personal assets and self esteem while they learn effective stress management and communication skills as well as success principles that will ultimately serve the workforce, employers and entrepreneurial endeavors.
This curriculum can support our young people by reducing unintended pregnancy, enhancing academic success, and reducing substance use in teens by giving them the tools to clear subconscious blocks to success and connect with themselves and others from a heart centered place guided by love, compassion and joy while also learning how to take 100% responsibility for their thoughts, words and actions, set goals and develop action plans.
The Success Principles teach practical tools, skills and the mindset necessary to be creative employees or successful entrepreneurs in today's changing workforce. At the same time, more connected and engaged youth means less substance use, less unintended pregnancy, less court involvement, less bullying, less violence ... and ultimately less money spent on society's problems and a more solid investment in our future. This content has the potential to transform youth, adults, families, workplaces, communities and the world!
Other Ways You Can Help
Tell your friends about us! Share our project on Facebook! Twitter! LinkedIn!
We are pleased to be fundraising partners with the White Mountain Community Health Center in Conway, NH, a 501c3 nonprofit which makes your donations tax deductible.

story:
An innovative non-profit, Commit Youth began its partnership  with Cristo Rey Jesuit High School for 8 weeks to inspire students to achievement through a seminar built on their dreams.

Each of our 95 students have commited to learn how to achieve their dreams of becoming Surgeon's &  Supreme Court Justices, Artist & Broadcasters,  Entertainment Lawyers & Entrepenuers (just to name a few).  

 Before we help map their own goals, we have challenged students to begin researching  what it takes to achieve their dream. As they complete research projects, our mission is to empower them with knowledge and hope.


This is where we need your help!

 Any donation helps us towards our $1100 goal by Friday. Your gift provides a biography for a student to inspire them towards their dream!

Thanks for all your support.



"Life is a race that begins with knowledge, is run with ambition, and is finished with Commitment."

- Austin Hollimon,

story:
What is the "Needles & Scratch" show?



"Needles & Scratch"- a web based puppet musical show for preschoolers. The hip hop duo interact with young viewers to help them learn about counting, literacy, shapes and patterns through a played based curriculum. 

Needles & Scratch explore a single topic in each episode, e.g. "Boogie Books," "Alphabet Blues," and "Dancing Bananas," through songs and short storylines.               The show also encourages viewers to move along with and dance with the characters in the program. 

Character's of the Show

Needles - (Lead Mc) a fun loving puppet who enjoys play games, reading books and singing songs. Dancing is one of the favorite things that Needles love to do when Scratch plays a beat.


Scratch - (DJ) Scratch loves to play music on his turntables. He's the younger brother of Needles and he loves to have fun. Scratch is a huge ball of energy and loves to learn new things.


Needles Needs Your HELP!

How can You help Needles?

We need your help to get Scratch and to continue production on the series. We've already invested over five thousand dollars into the art/design of the show creating  what we feel is a great learning tool for teachers and parents for their young one's.

Music is the universal language for all cultures of different back grounds and with your help the Needles & Scratch series will help to educate young viewers through a play based musical curriculum.


Check out the Perks! They're geared for both kids & Adults

Reaching the entire goal would be wonderful but if we don't we'll still produce a few episodes with what was raised. 

Where does the funds go?


Why Play-Based Learning?

The Needles & Scratch web-series will guide young viewers through their adventures with a play-based curriculum. Research shows that play-based learning leads to greater social, emotional, and academic success. 

  • Play helps to shape the structural design of the brain.
  • Play provides active exploration.
  • Allows children to identify, negotiate, take risks and create meaning. 
  • Developed memory skills
  • Engages both Child and adult interactions in active play
  • Problem solving
  • Enhancing his or her innate curiosity and creativity. 


"Children can build relationships, learn to resolve conflicts, negotiate and regulate their behaviours. In play, children usually have increased feelings of success and optimism as they act as their own agents and make their own choices. Playing is a known stress release; it is often linked to child wellbeing." 
                                                                                      - Early Childhood Australia

"Play lies at the core of innovation and creativity. It provides opportunities for learning in a context in which children are at their most receptive. Play and academic work are not distinct categories for young children, and learning and doing are also inextricably linked for them."

                                     -Ontario Full Day Early Learning Kindergarten Program, 2010


"In play, children represent and transform the world around them, providing other children and adults with a window into their thoughts and perceptions, and often helping adults to see the world in new ways."
                                                                                     -BC Early Learning Framework, 2008


"Play expands intelligence, stimulates the imagination, encourages creative problem solving, and helps develop confidence, self-esteem, and a positive attitude toward learning."

                                                                                  -Dr. Fraser Mustard 


Programming For The Whole Family 

We understand the challenges that parents have when choosing quality programming for their youngsters and that is why we want to make this show.

  • With over 15 years in broad cast video production we are more then qualified in producing a fun tool for educating young viewers.
  • Collaborating with teachers and parents on creative concepts. 
  •  Involving kids in the brainstorming phases. 
  • And above all, always having fun because learning should be fun!


Other Ways You Can Help Needles & Scratch

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  •  Use the Indiegogo share tools & share, share, SHARE!!!!!

story:
Hi Friends,

Last year I got admitted to an acting conservatory and spent training in New York. I had to unfortunately cut my time there short because of financial reasons (a.k.a the school is muy muy muy expensive).

I learned so much in that year, but missed out on the final year where we are trained more vigourously in acting for camera classes/stage combat/dialects and accents: things that could serve me very well as a starting actor in a business with no time for people who don't know what they're doing. Not to mention that there is the chance to invite agents/casting directors at your final show, and obviously you graduate and receive a diploma.

I'm trying to fund my way back to New York to finish this degree. The school has generously given me a merit scholarship for my work in the first year and has kept my place on reserve. I want to take advantage of that opportunity, obviously, but need a bit of extra help.

I am still applying to some other scholarships and I'm not expecting to raise all the money on this platform, I just thought why not try and see what comes from it.

As the Lego Movie taught us:

Hope everything is awesome,

Much Love,

Limo

story:
WATCH THE VIDEO!! - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gCYS_Qlesfs


(or read this :D)  

This financial goal represents my life goal. I've been wanting to go to this school ever since I was 15. And 8 years later I've applied, flew to London just for the purpose of the audition and ended up being one of those 15% that got in.

And now I came across an obstacle called TUITION. Coming from a family where I've been financially supporting myself since I was 16, but still tried to save up just to go to this school someday, this is currently based on "Alice in Wonderland".


However I got my foot in the door. And I'm trying not to let this stop me. I want to get a good education in this field. Be better at what I do, make people laugh and give back something to the world. And with this school - I can make that happen. 


Here are just some calculations: 


Tuition: $29.900 (per year)

Rent: $10.000 (per year - food NOT included)


I think that says it. 


Everything I raise will be spent for tuition. (student loan is still unavoidable). I will post regular videos, updates to keep in touch with you.


And I would be grateful for the rest of my life if this becomes a walking/talking realization. Because I WILL take the best out of it and use it for my future. 

I will continue with my wall of "THANK YOU" notes and each and everyone that donates gets one pined up to my wall. I have also added a lot of cool perks.


My wall of thank you notes so far (I will post updates of this wall as frequently as I can) :




My acceptance video: 



About the school: 

Founded in 1884, the American Academy of Dramatic Arts is the first conservatory for actors in the English-speaking world. Since then, its purpose has remained constant: To provide students with the tools needed to make acting their profession. 

We select our students from varied backgrounds and from all around the globe. Diversity, which gives our students exposure to many cultures, enriches the depth of the actor's work. Selectivity, which continues throughout our program, yields a pool of students who nourish each other's growth. 


And those of you who already contributed -  contact me to claim the prize if it matches the value of perk. And you only need to donate what's left of the value to get one of the perks :) 


Special thanks to M. Š. for being my rock & M.G. for not letting me quit on this.

Also many thanks to: N.H., K.F., K.P. for being my family :) 

And thanks to all of you that believed in me and/or helped me out with this campaign.  


I'm Barbara and this is my story. Thank you for reading. 


For more info check out my social media:

☛ YOUTUBE: https://www.youtube.com/user/Barbara4u2c

☛ FACEBOOK PAGE: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Barbara4u2/244389012255825?ref=hl

☛ TWITTER: https://twitter.com/Barbara4u2

☛ INSTAGRAM: http://instagram.com/barbara4u2c

story:
Please note that the event itself runs from June 6-8, 2015 but all early contributions will be donated. 


What are we doing?

Queer-YA Scrabble is an event hosted by blogs and on twitters to support Stonewall-UK and increase awareness of LGBTQ positive YA books.

Stonewall Education |   Stonewall Youth 

Participants will hunt for letters concealed in blog posts featuring Queer YA books and then solve anagrams allowing them to compete for a chance to win a box full of great titles. Following the promotional game, another set of book-boxes will be up for bid with 100% of proceeds donated to Stonewall.


I am an author, agent or publisher - how do I help?

Please take a look at the Author Registration located at the blog. The event can't succeed without author/publisher  participation! 

Which authors are already participating?

Currently the following authors have pledged their books to us (note, this list is evolving until the 25th of May)

Becky Albertalli 
Steve Berman 
Kristin Elizabeth Clark
Cat Clarke
Kirstin Cronn-Mills
Suki Fleet
Sara Gaines
Rachel Gold
 I.W. Gregorio
 Jay Jordan Hawke
Chris Hawthorne
Shaun Hutchinson
Alaya Dawn Johnson
Saruuh Kelsey
Laura Lam
Chase Night
Will Parkinson
Astor Penn
Nina Rossing
Abbie Rushton
Tom Ryan
Alex Sanchez
Robin Talley 
Lisa Williamson. 

While I wait for the Giveaway/Auction to kick off, how can I help?

We've set up this indiegogo page so that readers can show their support by making a donation that will go towards the total we plan to raise for stonewall. Consider donating to towards this amazing organisation. 

Additionally, the keys to success for this event are promotion and author engagement. As a reader, feel free to tweet or blog about the contest, and encourage your favourite authors to sign up! <3


When does this run?

The event will run from June 6th-8th, 2015. Author registration will close on May 25th, and we must receive all books by then!

You will not be able to buy the team books, which will be listed as 'Perks' on this indiegogo page until the giveaway begins on the 6th and all teams have been finalised. 


Which Blogs are Hosts?

GayYa.org | YA Highway | Writability | Afterwritten | YA Interrobang 

The Librarian Who Doesn't Say Shhh | queerya.org


I have questions, oh so many questions ...

I am so very happy to answer any questions you might have! (please do ask, I refresh my phone  about 200 times a day, and it's nice for the little icon to blink)

Blog specific questions can be addressed to the blog hosts listed above! They are the sexy faces of this operation, while I am the spreadsheet monkey.

Feel free to email me at any time on julia_ember@yahoo.com -- I am also very happy to put you in touch with our direct contact at Stonewall UK.

story:
The Story and Vision

Hi! My name is Rachel Stark. I am a full time college student with a passion for humanitarianism and global change, and I am looking for your support to take the next step.

Presently, I am double majoring in Communications with an emphasis on Practical and Professional Ethics as well as Collaborative and Community Health. When I am not in class, I am working full time as an ambassador at my college, supporting students in claiming their education and achieving their academic goals.

The next step in my education is The Art of Leadership Mastery Program offered through The Institute for Embodied Wisdom. ALM is a seven month intensive study lead by Scott Coady - expert in leadership, collaboration, team dynamics and developer of a leadership training program for NASA.

The ALM program is an ideal catalyst for me to share my vision with confidence and fortitude. My vision for the future is a world that systemically operates from the fundamental unifying principles of humanity, that wellness finds legitimacy in society, and that the public has more representation in democracy than private interest. I see a world of peace and security, grounded in the transformative potential of the human heart. I am dedicating my life to becoming a champion of this vision in the most grounded, applicable, and effective ways.


What is The Art of Leadership Mastery?

ALM offers education in self awareness and group orientation. These are key for current leadership and creating the space, presence, and culture to build leadership and authenticity as fundamental principles that navigate our lives, both personally and professionally.

The Elements of Curriculum for this program include:

  • Setting and achieving goals that are aligned with one's vision
  • Developing an authentic and engaging leadership presence
  • Inspiring collective actions despite perceived limitations
  • Somatic fundamentals for a strong, confident body
  • Engaging and mobilizing others to accomplish great things
  • Making difficult decisions with certainty while upholding values
  • Self accountability and collective responsibility
  • Creating effective and capable teams
  • Generating higher levels of trust and relationship with others
I believe this curriculum is imperative to my evolution. It will further my understanding of what is required in the cultivation of a clear, confident and heart-centered presence necessary to become a leader for positive global change while mobilizing others in the process.


Why Crowdfunding?

As of right now, these types of specialized leadership skills and awareness training  programs are not offered at the college I am attending. Because of my dedication and commitment, Scott and his team have already awarded me $7,500 in scholarships! With your help, I can raise the additional $5,000 needed for tuition. The additional $500 listed is to compensate for the fees withdrawn by Indiegogo.

My devotion is to work with organizations, corporations and governments to develop and implement solution-based systems for the world. I would eventually like to work with the UN and other global reaching organizations to connect people with what matters most - providing tools and wisdom necessary to move people forward, both individually and collectively, in a powerful, positive direction.


Giving & Receiving

Everybody wins! I have put together multiple donation perks and rewards so that you may receive as you give.

With your support, I can take a massive leap forward in my journey. Thank you for your consideration.

Share, Share, Share!

Don't forget, the easiest way you can support me is to simply share this campaign.

Click Here to Share on Facebook.
CLick Here to Tweet It.
Click Here to Email.


Contact Me

I am fully available to answer any questions or provide further information that may serve you in feeling more aligned with me and my mission.

Email Me: RachelStark.co@gmail.com

Thank You! May we all step into roles as leaders in our lives and take this world into its greatest future.

The Elements of Curriculum for this program include:  Setting and achieving goals that are aligned with one's vision Developing an authentic and engaging leadership presence Inspiring collective actions despite perceived limitations

Somatic fundamentals for a strong, confident body
Engaging and mobilizing others to accomplish great things
Making difficult decisions with certainty while upholding values
Self accountability and collective responsibility
Creating effective and capable teams
Generating higher levels of trust and relationship with others


I believe this curriculum is imperative to my evolution. It will further my understanding of what is required in the cultivation of a clear, confident and heart-centered presence necessary to become a leader for positive global change while mobilizing others in the process.


    
Why Crowdfunding? As of right now, these types of specialized leadership skills and awareness training  programs are not offered at the college I am attending. Because of my dedication and commitment, Scott and his team have already awarded me $7,500 in scholarships! With your help, I can raise the additional $5,000 needed for tuition. The additional $500 listed is to compensate for the fees withdrawn by Indiegogo.

My devotion is to work with organizations, corporations and governments to develop and implement solution-based systems for the world. I would eventually like to work with the UN and other global reaching organizations to connect people with what matters most - providing tools and wisdom necessary to move people forward, both individually and collectively, in a powerful, positive direction.


Giving & Receiving
Everybody wins! I have put together multiple donation perks and rewards so that you may receive as you give.With your support, I can take a massive leap forward in my journey. Thank you for your consideration.   Share, Share, Share!  Don't forget, the easiest way you can support me is to simply share this campaign.

Click Here to Share on Facebook.CLick Here to Tweet It.
Click Here to Email.   
Contact Me I am fully available to answer any questions or provide further information that may serve you in feeling more aligned with me and my mission.
Email Me: RachelStark.co@gmail.com  Thank You! May we all step into roles as leaders in our lives and take this world into its greatest future.

story:
Empowering Youth

The Zimbabwe Starz Volleyball Academy seeks financial, technical and logistical support to roll out the Volleyball 4 Life (V4L) programme to 1,440 girls and boys in 40 primary schools from underprivileged communities of Zimbabwe. The Volleyball 4 Life programme aims to involve adolescent children in easily accessible, age and gender specific volleyball activities as a platform to nurture their talents and also deliver life skills mentorship.

  • This year's goal is to host a 4-day training camp in October for youth players and coaches, plus evening and weekend training for adult players
  • The programme was pioneered by sports administrator and long-time volleyball coach Martin Dururu
  • Master Coach, Vic Lindal from Canada has volunteered to attend and help lead the programme

What We Need & What You Get

We need $6071 to run a four-day training camp in October 2015. Please consider donating to help give these young people a chance for a better life:

If you donate ___, in appreciation you will receive -> ___

  • $10 -> Endpoint Vision self-coaching worksheet
  • $25 -> Endpoint Vision e-book
  • $50 -> Zimbabwe Starz merchandise 
  • $100 -> Volleyball training manual
  • $500 or $1000 -> Endpoint Vision consultation (achieve your vision)

How your donation makes a difference, e.g.:

  • $10 - Dress up 1 player in their team colours
  • $25 - Tuition for 1 player or coach for 1 day
  • $50 - Tuition for 2 family members for 1 day
  • $80 - A new volleyball
  • $100 - Tuition for 1 player or coach for the 4-day camp
  • $150 - Tuition for a team of 6 for 1 day
  • $200 - Tuition for 2 family members for the 4-day camp
  • $400 - Sponsor registration materials and awards
  • $600 - Tuition for 1 team of 6 for the 4-day camp
  • $1200 - Subsidize the guest coach's expenses
  • $3000 - Sponsor half the volleyball camp
  • $6000 - Sponsor the entire volleyball camp

The Impact

In the targeted communities, Zimbabwe Starz Volleyball Academy will collaborate with school authorities to

  • form volleyball teams, 
  • convene tournaments and festivals,
  • level outdoor volleyball courts,
  • provide volleyballs and other accessories, and
  • train school teachers to deliver structured volleyball coaching and mentorship.

The aim is to strengthen the capacity of school volleyball teams to conduct regular volleyball sessions, to participate in sports tournaments and galas intended to not only improve young people’s quality of life but also to teach them values such as teamwork, friendship and tolerance.

    Risks & Challenges

    The Volleyball 4 Life programme promotes equality for all. We need young boys and girls to participate, to learn self-sufficiency, personal autonomy and leadership skills, and to work together as equals.

    • These children face great hurdles, so they need a chance to feel empowered.
    • This program gives them a key step in making a difference in their lives.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Feel free to invite your friends to view and support our campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word. Thanks!

story:
Digital Challenges in Primary Schools 

Digitalization has changed our social lives and the way our children learn. Gaming and social media has a big impact on how children work together and have fun. So what do we do to accommodate a learning experience where our children explore digital and social media, play with new STEAM innovations and experiment with social media in a safe environment. 

sCool teaches children in primary schools digital social responsibility from an early age and provides an online environment exclusively for young people that actively promotes understanding, safety and a culture free from bullying. 

You can be the real Boost  

sCool officially launched April 24th in Amsterdam. The LearnScape built a social learning platform for children and was selected as one of the finalists at the Boost program from The Next Web conference . We were overwhelmed with reactions and we made the promise that we would promote sCool to as many primary schools as possible. 

All press releases and progress that we make is on our Facebook page however selling the platform as the answer to digital challenges in primary schools is not enough. We want to make a FREE and OPEN community where everyone can share ideas or best practices used at their school. Games, videos or cool STEAM-related information that can help stimulate our children to learn in a digital world. 

We have thought of some perks to thank you for sharing information and help us grow but we are open for any other contribution whether it is money or advice!

The Beta version of the community is online, you can already join the community or send us tips on how to improve. Check it out ! Share our link and like us!

The story behind building sCool and why we need you

In my pitch at TNW2015, I already told that all credits go to my own girls who begged me to get a Facebook account at age 8 and 10, you can imagine that I refused. Intelligent as children are these days they challenged me:

"Mum if you can build a better Facebook, you should build             one for schools ! 

We had just founded The LearnScape, social learning platforms for higher education and corporate use. We could give it a try and address at the same time some digital challenges primary schools are facing. 

Some weeks after launching the test platform we knew we did something good. An interview with ATV and an invitation to LeWeb proved we had to continue exploring how to make a safe social learning platform for this kids.


We had a soft launch at a primary school and even made some videos to help our kids become #DSR based on scripts by Child Focus. Everything was privately funded but we need a little help to finish sCool before the new school year in September.  

What exactly needs to be done; 

  • The platform is multilingual; French, English, German, Spanish .... but not Dutch. If we get enough funding we can launch the Dutch version before the new school year starts.
  • The videos we made are only available in Dutch (my own girls and their friends made them :-).
  • The sCool Community needs a conversation manager and although this can be done by volunteers we still  have some costs to it
  • More videos, games, tips ..

How your contribution will help us to the next stage

sCool is a social learning platform and methodology for primary schools. At the same time it teaches digital social responsibility and provides answers to challenges in education by providing an umbrella bringing together all initiatives taken in this field. 
We will start implementing the first sCools in both Belgium and The Netherlands as from September and we have contacts with schools in UK and France. For this we need funding, extra people, project management and most of all our message to be spread to more schools. 
Help us to finish this Cool platform and help our children to have fun in a new way of social learning.
"Imagine a world where our kids can educate us on appropriate social online behavior


Thank you very much! If you think I have missed something or you need more info you can contact me in person 

Warm Regards

Katja 

Katja.schipperheijn@thelearnscape.com

story:
The Garden

The Rothenberg Rooftop School Garden Program helps narrow the achievement gap for participating inner city students. The Garden Teaching  program uses experiential learning opportunities that help students deepen their education while also providing a service to the community.  Service Learning and the Integrated Garden Curriculum set the Rothenberg Rooftop School Garden apart from other garden teaching and other rooftop gardens.

Programming is conducted by Bryna Bass, an educator with 18 years of experience, who develops lesson plans and calendars, pairing activities and lesson guides that are relevant to each of the grades at Rothenberg.  She's also responsible for overall garden maintenance and updating the lessons yearly as standards are revised at the state level.

The Rooftop Garden is an innovative model in which academic standards required at each grade level are integrated thoroughly with garden-based lessons. The Rothenberg Rooftop School Garden serves as a community gathering place and a point of pride in this historic inner city neighborhood.  Lessons in sustainability and container gardening will be taught across the generations and help advance the community as a whole toward better nutrition, more healthy ways of eating, and close-to-the source food production.

Over the projected 30 year lifetime of the garden we estimate 16,500 or more inner city children and their families will be educated and served. The Rothenberg Rooftop School Garden will educate and influence 550 Rothenberg School children annually and into the future, as well as their families, teachers, school administrators, and OTR community members.

The Rooftop School Garden addresses the need for inner city children to engage with the natural environment first-hand to realize the importance of preservation and conservation, as well as issues of nutrition, healthy eating, and sustainability. We take garden-based education further, by integrating weekly garden lesson plans in math, science, and language arts that correlate with state academic standards. This is the unduplicated impact our Rooftop School Garden Program offers Rothenberg children and their community.

Additionally, through Service Learning activities associated with the Rothenberg Rooftop School Garden, we can facilitate better learning for students; provide free resources to engage students and improve their educational outcomes; and create a culture of care where all citizens are active members of their community.

Over-the-Rhine Foundation

Since 1992, Over-the-Rhine Foundation has focused on preserving and promoting OTR's livability. Board members led the effort to save the Rothenberg School building from demolition.  Since 2008 we have been spreading the word, telling the Rooftop Garden Story, and inspiring donors as we raised funds to build the Rooftop Garden. Cincinnati Public Schools renovated the historic school building, and re-opened to students beginning with the 2013-2014 academic year. The neighborhood is growing, and Rothenberg School, at the corner of Main Street and East McMillan Street, anchors the activity.

The Need

The Rooftop School Garden operate operates at Rothenberg as guests of the Cincinnati Public Schools (CPS). While CPS supports the Garden and programming,  they are not responsible for the Rooftop Garden’s funding of construction nor operations. Through generous donations and the collaborative work of many community members, the Over-the-Rhine Foundation has  helped raise over $300,000 for the Rothenberg Rooftop School Garden.  Over 25 raised garden beds were built in the 2014-2015 school year, home to an array of vegetables —  planted and harvested by the nearly 450 Rothenberg students. 

But need for the Garden continues.  

Items needed that can help in educational programs include dwarf fruit trees, potting benches/work stations, rain barrel, plastic greenhouse, amaryllis bulbs, potting soil, butterfly larvae and a shade pavilion.  

The Rothenberg School Garden could use your help.

story:
Hello!

We are a group of Occupational Therapy students working to spend a week traveling to Zacapa, Guatemala with an organization called Hearts in Motion (HIM). HIM is an independent non-profit organization that provides quality medical care and aids in the creation and development of social programming to promote health, education, and welfare in Guatemala. Hearts in Motion works directly with communities and organizations already in place and respects the culture and ideals of those they serve. We will spend a week volunteering, working with and learning from individuals of all ages in various settings including schools, clinics, nutrition centers, villages and hospitals. We will be utilizing the Occupational Therapy knowledge and skills that we've learned in the classroom to work with those we encounter in Guatemala. 
Our team has many goals, and we have been working hard all year in preparation for the week long trip. While in Guatemala, we will assist in providing therapy to those individuals we will see under OT faculty that travels with us, and we will strive to learn as much as we can about OT, healthcare, and culture in the beautiful country of Guatemala. 
You, our family and friends, are here because we would greatly appreciate your financial and emotional support. The Washington University in St. Louis service trip is an investment in our personal development that will promote opportunities for people with disabilities.
 It will cost $24,000 for all 12 students to volunteer in Guatemala; that amount includes flights, accommodations, and materials that we will be bringing with us to Guatemala. The students on this year’s international service learning trip and I have successfully planned and executed several fundraising events raising over $17,000 thus far!

The service trip to Guatemala is in just ONE MONTH!  We would be extremely grateful for any amount of support you can provide. Thank you for your time and generosity!
