story:
Who we are

We are the Congregation Rodef Sholom Temple Youth group or CRuSTY--the best youth group ever!   

Why our youth group is so important to us

Being a part of a Jewish youth group gives us a sense of community, a place to belong, and memories that will last a lifetime.  

From 1st grade through high school, our youth group gives kids the time and place to be ourselves, develop our Jewish identities, participate in fantastic programs, and so much more. 

This video we made is just one example of how CRuSTY allows us to express ourselves:



Our GOAL 
We believe that the way to build community is to make sure that everyone can participate.  It cost over $52,000 to offer our youth activities this year, not everyone could participate, and we weren't able to do everything we wanted to do.

We want to raise $15,000 that will go to:

1. Scholarships for fabulous (but sometimes expensive) events so that everyone can participate, like the LIFE-CHANGING 8th grade LA trip and other AWESOME Bay Area activities (like Bowling, Exploratorium, Warriors game, Laser Tag, House of Air, Petaluma Pumpkin Patch, GG Park, Six Flags etc.) 

2. New events for all ages (CRuSTY Social Justice-SF, ski trip, HIGH-ENERGY activities for 1st-6th graders) . . . we have a list of dreams . . . it all depends on how much we can raise!

And CRuSTY is growing!  This year more than 250 kids came to over 35 events including our FAMOUS Chocolate Seder, MENCHY Mitzvah Day, ACTION-PACKED PJ parties, LAUGHING late night hangouts and more.  The impact on kids in the youth group has been amazing, and it is just the beginning.  

We want everyone to be a part this incredible community.  


Other ways you can help

  • Spread the word by sharing this page with everyone.
  • Come participate in one of our awesome events!  All kids are welcome to come to a CRuSTY event and try it out... just let us know.  

Thank you!

story:
Thank you for taking the time to look at my project. As a retired special education high school teacher, and current mobile application and website developer, I would like to conduct technology training classes to help young adults with disabilities learn to develop mobile applications and websites at NO COST to them. In addition, at the completion of the class they will receive a laptop loaded with all the training and development software they will need, freelance accounts with services such as Odesk & Elance, and registered developer accounts with Apple, Google and Microsoft. My target students are those who were very high functioning in high school, but due to lack of ability to access the curriculum, or their social skills, their school was not able to give them a proper preparation for their post-secondary education, they were not able to get into college to continue their education. 

When I retired from teaching, I created a storefront technology training center where I conduct classes for adults on how to use mobile devices such as iPads, iPhones, Android and Windows 8 devices. Our Technology Lounge also provides website development and Home Cyber Defense Services. My hope is to be able to provide classes  for teaching these special young people technology skills for a productive and successful career in the development field. The classes will meet at least twice a week and last the length of a typical semester. I would keep the classes small, no more then 3 to students at a time, so the students would get receive an abundance of individual assistance. The goal of the program if fully funded would be to have a minimum of 12 students successfully complete the program in 2015. After successful completion of the course each student would be awarded with their own laptop, Apple, Google & Microsoft developer accounts, and Odesk & Elance accounts if they have the desire to Freelance instead of make their own products. (All my students will have to be out of high school and over 18.) I will ask any young adults interested in these classes to submit an application, and they will be interviewed and selected based on their ability to successfully complete the training program. Since the classes will be offered to them for free, I will be looking for students who truly have to drive to learn the material and the interest in computer programming to make it their lifelong career. 

My timeline is to have everything in place so I may begin my first class in May. I anticipate the cost of providing each student their own laptop, training & development software, accounts with freelance services, and registering them as developers to be $2,000 per student. (The students completing my program would basically be able to to start their own development business with no out of pocket expenses.) The program will start in May regardless of how much is raised, we simply will adjust the numbers of students who will be able to participate to the success of the fundraising. 

Once again, thanks for your time, and I hope you can see fit to help me make this dream become a reality for these young adults.

Biography:

To give you a brief background on myself, after spending 16 years as a special education teacher on a high school campus, my first experience with an iPad in 2010 led me on a journey of discovery and professional reinvention as a mobile app developer. At present I have 20 apps in the App Store for iPhones and iPads, 6 apps in Google Play for Android Devices, and 5 Apps in the Windows Store for Windows 8 devices. Retiring from teaching at the end of school year in 2014, my wife and I decided to open the Technology Lounge in Dickinson, Texas, a technology training center, teaching classes on how to use mobile devices. Although I left teaching, I didn’t want to leave my students behind; and by staying in touch with them I have experienced of all the difficulties many of them face with their careers. This discovery inspired me to pursue this latest dream; being able to provide my former students the skills, and equipment to have careers as web application developers.
story_txt: Thank you for taking the time to look at my project. As a retired special education high school teacher, and current mobile application and website developer, I would like to conduct technology training classes to help young adults with disabilities learn to develop mobile applications and websites at NO COST to them. In addition, at the completion of the class they will receive a laptop loaded with all the training and development software they will need, freelance accounts with services such as Odesk & Elance, and registered developer accounts with Apple, Google and Microsoft. My target students are those who were very high functioning in high school, but due to lack of ability to access the curriculum, or their social skills, their school was not able to give them a proper preparation for their post-secondary education, they were not able to get into college to continue their education. When I retired from teaching, I created a storefront technology training center where I conduct classes for adults on how to use mobile devices such as iPads, iPhones, Android and Windows 8 devices. Our Technology Lounge also provides website development and Home Cyber Defense Services. My hope is to be able to provide classes  for teaching these special young people technology skills for a productive and successful career in the development field. The classes will meet at least twice a week and last the length of a typical semester. I would keep the classes small, no more then 3 to students at a time, so the students would get receive an abundance of individual assistance. The goal of the program if fully funded would be to have a minimum of 12 students successfully complete the program in 2015. After successful completion of the course each student would be awarded with their own laptop, Apple, Google & Microsoft developer accounts, and Odesk & Elance accounts if they have the desire to Freelance instead of make their own products. (All my students will have to be out of high school and over 18.) I will ask any young adults interested in these classes to submit an application, and they will be interviewed and selected based on their ability to successfully complete the training program. Since the classes will be offered to them for free, I will be looking for students who truly have to drive to learn the material and the interest in computer programming to make it their lifelong career. My timeline is to have everything in place so I may begin my first class in May. I anticipate the cost of providing each student their own laptop, training & development software, accounts with freelance services, and registering them as developers to be $2,000 per student. (The students completing my program would basically be able to to start their own development business with no out of pocket expenses.) The program will start in May regardless of how much is raised, we simply will adjust the numbers of students who will be able to participate to the success of the fundraising. Once again, thanks for your time, and I hope you can see fit to help me make this dream become a reality for these young adults.Biography:To give you a brief background on myself, after spending 16 years as a special education teacher on a high school campus, my first experience with an iPad in 2010 led me on a journey of discovery and professional reinvention as a mobile app developer. At present I have 20 apps in the App Store for iPhones and iPads, 6 apps in Google Play for Android Devices, and 5 Apps in the Windows Store for Windows 8 devices. Retiring from teaching at the end of school year in 2014, my wife and I decided to open the Technology Lounge in Dickinson, Texas, a technology training center, teaching classes on how to use mobile devices. Although I left teaching, I didn’t want to leave my students behind; and by staying in touch with them I have experienced of all the difficulties many of them face with their careers. This discovery inspired me to pursue this latest dream; being able to provide my former students the skills, and equipment to have careers as web application developers.

story:
Egyptian Streets has told more than 600 stories to more than 5 million people on its website since launching!


What Is Egyptian Streets ?

Egyptian Streets is an independent, young, and grassroots media organization aimed at providing fast-paced and free coverage of events that occur on streets in Egypt and across the region.

Our Goal

By establishing an engaging social platform for readers to not only gain knowledge but to also discuss and interact with the content, Egyptian Streets’ goal is to drive social change, educate and form a media outlet that is independent during a time when press freedom in the Middle East is restricted.
Achievements 
The achievement came just one year after Egyptian Streets was officially founded.

  • As of February 2015, Egyptian Streets is the number one Independent English media outlet in Egypt by reach.

     

  • In one year, 150,000+ comments on social media


  • More than 1.5 million people reached on Facebook per month


  • More than 800,000 visitors by February 2015.

How We Are Different 

Today, most large news media organizations are old, traditionally served, and bloated platforms that fail to engage with readers and to touch on the issues which have the deepest impacts. By engaging with a wide spectrum of the community – from bloggers, activists, academics and more – and offering solutions to various socio-political, economic and cultural issues, Egyptian Streets manages to provide a much more unique and diverse perspective on the region by ensuring the conversation continues offline as well as online.


As of January 2015, Egyptian Streets has partnered with a variety of causes and organisations, including Egypt’s first exhibition for the corporate travel sector, AIESEC, UNDP and others.

Egyptian Streets has also collaborated with numerous non-governmental organizations and activist groups to promote a variety of social issues, including poverty, women’s issues, racism, environmental issues, animal rights, education and more. These collaborations, which have often included the featuring of these organizations’ causes, are aimed at driving social change through the promotion of grassroots movements.


Among the groups which Egyptian Streets has supported or collaborated with are, Earth Hour, Dignity Without Borders, Heya, the Goethe Institut, the World Food Programme, Animal Care in Egypt, Creative Industry 2014, Sinai Reef and more.

Why Your Contribution Matters?

Design (1) one of the t-shirts you can get from the $150 contribution towards our WOMEN'S section! 

Design (2) one of the t-shirts you can get from the $150 contribution towards our WOMEN'S section! 

Email info@egyptianstreets.com or leave a comment once you contribute towards 'Supporting Women in Egypt' to let us know which design you would like and what your size is!

Egyptian Streets attracts an average of 600,000 viewers per month from across the globe! Since launching, Egyptian Streets has published the writings of more than 40 journalists, academics, university students, artists and more on its website.

Your contributions will help keep Egyptian Streets running. At the moment, the website is self-funded by its founders who ensure that database and servers are running and that content continues to be produced!

From your contribution, Egyptian Streets hopes to hire a team of four permanent writers and editors that will publish between 5-10 articles per day on a variety of topics. Egyptian Streets will also expand its current sections (particularly Arts & Culture, Travel, Feature and Technology) and introduce new sections, including:

  1. A women’s section that will cover women’s affairs, issues and how women are perceived in society
  2. A video section that will include videos from across Egypt and the Middle East. These videos will range from interviews with and coverage of the arts, to highlighting social and economic affairs.
  3. A business and economy section.
  4. An investigative reporting section.

Along with expansion of content, Egyptian Streets aims to develop a mobile application that will enable readers to access information wherever they’re. 



Stories That Made Difference. 

Hidden Camera Shows Haunting Stares Women Face on Egypt's Streets:

This interview and video piece highlighted the sexual harassment epidemic women face in #Egypt. 24 hours after its publication, the article went viral and was cited in multiple prominent media outlets, including Der Spiegel, Huffington Post, CNN, France 24, BuzzFeed and more. The success of the article helped kick-start an anti-harassment documentary, The People's Girls, which is currently being produced.

Graffiti Exhibition Breaks Taboos About Sex In Egypt:

Covering an exhibition, this article basically got people talking about something that is taboo in Egypt: sex.

Dog Brutally Stabbed Before Being Crushed By A Metal Pole In Egypt

Being the first English media outlet to cover this horrific case of animal abuse, Egyptian Streets made sure that the incident, caught on camera, was not simply forgotten about. A day later, Egypt's police arrested three men responsible for the killing.

Five Foreign Journalists Reveal What Life Is Like In Egypt

What is it like to be a foreign journalist in Egypt? With journalists behind bars, sexual harassment on the rise, and violence often breaking out at demonstrations, it has often been said that Egypt is no longer the safe haven it once was for foreign journalists. 
How true are these claims? Egyptian Streets asked five foreign journalists, from The Guardian, France 24, Financial Times and more, to share their experiences on being a journalist in Egypt since the January 25 revolution in 2011.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Recognition 


Meet The Team


Other Ways You  Can Support

You can also help support Egyptian Streets and independent media in Egypt by spreading the word online and offline! Let your friends and family know of Egyptian Streets' campaign by sharing it on social media.

story:
Short Summary

Alabama STEM Education(ASE)  has introduced more than 60 students to science, technology, engineering and Math. With the help of local universities they are bridging the gap of STEM Education among under-represented, under-served low income middle & high school students. Preparing this type of students early in life would give our country the cutting-edge for 21st century workforce.

What We Need & What You Get

We need LAB equipment for students:

  • Robotic components (Arduino board, servo and DC Motors)
  • STEM Educational tools
  • Good used minivan for students
  • 20 Laptop, 2 projectors, projector screen
  • Oscilloscope, microscope, digital multimeter, 
  • Lab tools (bench, chair etc.)

The Impact

With your help ASE would be able to reach more than 100 students a year  which in turn increases ACT/SAT score and prepare them for college. It is documented that STEM education plays a vital role in increasing the awareness among our community and our country therefore provide more skilled people for the 21st century workforce!

Other Ways You Can Help

Other than financially helping us, we would be glad to receive:

  • Transportation for kids
  • Office supplies (i.e. copiers, paper, printers)
  • Volunteer(Engineering instructor)

story:
Introduction


Company Summary

Certified Skateboards L.L.C was established in 2008 by Jon Lodge, a then 17-year-old innovator. Since then we have successfully sold thousands of skateboards and built relationships with 50 different retailers throughout the tri-state area and have three overseas distributors. But most of all, we pride ourselves on the amount of dedication we have shown to the youth in Newark, NJ.  In the past we have created multiple recreational skateboarding contest. These noteworthy events along with other investments into the sport have caused Certified Skateboards to become an everlasting support system for the skateboarding community.


Investment

Certified is looking to raise $4,000 for the following to purchase new equipment that will allow us to eliminate production & manufacturing costs and create jobs within our youth program

The Impact

Your investment will not only impact Certified but will create a manufacturing hub in Newark that employs local youth:

  • We will be able to manufacture our own goods for the Certified brand
  • We will also be able to provide production services for other companies (we have agreements with stores and brands that want to commit to our services)
  • We will match this investment with our own in order to build our youth team and purchase the new manufacturing equipment

Risks & Challenges

We are committed to building our brand and our community at the same time.  Acquiring this new equipment for the business will help us ensure success and enhance the level of talent and innovation of our internally trained staff.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you feel you can assist us or would like to see our business plan and business model. Please check us out at : www.certifiedlifestyle.com or email us at certifiedskateboards@gmail.com

    LET'S CHANGE HISTORY!

    Any donation helps!!!

    Supporting links:
    http://www.nj.com/newark/community/index.ssf/20...
    http://www.inflexwetrust.com/2010/12/13/video-2...
    http://www.nj.com/news/index.ssf/2010/12/newark_holiday_giveaway_benefi.html

story:
Solar Panels can help to ease the Powercuts in Gazastrip

As we all know the electricity cuts for at least 10 hours a day here in the Gazastrip,

Solar Panel Systems will help People to provide their homes with power even when the Official electricity is cut!

You donate I buy the Solar Panel Systems here in Khan Younis (Gazastrip)

This is Kanaan Shaat iam 34 years old and i live in Khan Younis, the Green Energy Store in Khan Younis Jalal Street told me that a Solar Panel System to provide a average Flat cost 1300 Dollars!

Our first Goal is to get 1300 Dollars and to buy the Solar Panels for my flat, when we reach the 1300 Dollar Goal i will make a Video Clip while they instal the  Solar Panel, i will also make Pictures!

Pictures and the Video will first be send to the donators and supporters and then i  will share them at Facebook so other People can see how amazing it is to be part of the Solar Panel Project Gazastrip!

HELP to HELP

If you help this Project i will be able to help others here in Khan Younis, to help People in Need is something noble and a sign of a great charcter!

I dont have to tell anyone of you about the Problems here in the Gazastrip and how we all suffer because of the  blockade of the Gazastrip, you all know about it!



Be part of it help how ever you can, if you cant afford to donate then share the indiegogo link, tell yor Friends about this Project!

May it be succesfull, with your help it will!

story:
ChampionShips After School Program

ChampionShips' purpose is to integrate and elevate the student athlete’s educational and professional dreams, through educational assistance for elementary school, middle school and high school students. Students will learn to prioritize their education and work to improve their academic success. In addition, they will have cultivated essential skills and relationships, which will help lead them towards their future goals.

ChampionShips, Inc. is focused on incorporating athletics and education into an after school program. Students will enjoy fun, fully-supervised programming after school with activities focused on sports fitness, nutrition and wellness. Students will receive homework assistance and tutoring during the school year. In addition to academic assistance, ChampionShips Sports Academy will provide athletic sports trainers to improve the student’s sports performance.

ChampionShips Sports Academy Program includes:

• Providing a fun and safe place for students during after school hours

• Providing athletic sport interaction with caring adult role models

• Encourage and develop life skills, respect for others, and positive social interaction

• Introduce and engage youth in positive, potential life-long recreational pursuits

• Providing tools to academic success i.e. time to complete homework, read, and

  receive assistance/tutoring.

• Effectively increase health, wellness and fitness for youth

story:
OSATS

We run osats.net. The home of algorithmic trading and investing systems. Our goal is to equip you with world class trading robots via your smartphone.  

Well, now.. we have designed an app to meet the needs of every one who would like to perform like a top level trader without opening a single trade.

                                                               

                      How It Works?


                                              Step 1. Fund up your account.

                                             

 

                                        Step 2. Let the robots do the work!

      

                                                      

                         

                                     Step 3. Withdraw money you made.

                                      

                                        


                             It’s that simple!


Key features of the app:

  • User friendly using osats is as easy as scrolling through your social media wall.
  • Diversified portfolio your investments will be diversified across different algorithms as well as more traditional financial assets.
  • Easy accessible our platform will be accessible from all of your devices
  • The performance tab lets you track your capital gains
  • Safety your investments will be managed by professionals
  • Offline mode allows you to access your account information at any time everywhere.
  • Synchronized share content across different social platforms


                                 

Social media platform lets interact with other users. Share your thoughts regarding investing with other people across the world. Our frontend team is working hard to ensure the best user experience possible, while our backend engineers makes sure that our algorithms are synchronized with the social platform. 


                 

                           

We focus on high grade performance, however keeping you and your money safe is our highest priority. We’re working hard to bring you solid returns in ANY economic environment. In order to achieve that, your capital will be spread across different financial instruments that work both in deflationary and inflationary market conditions. All this will be amped up by our proprietary algorithms designed to trade in highly liquid currency markets. 

       



      ... our set up allows you to generate profit using cutting edge trading robots ...



                                        .. while maintaining safety and longevity.

  

                                        

                     

        

                                  

                               

                                  Access your account from all your devices.

        

               

    

                         

                                                      Track your progress as you go.


               

                 

Your account will be maintained by people who have their own money invested in osats.net algorithms and are dedicated to making safe and steady returns.

                                                      

 

       

   

                                  

       

        

                                         

Access your account without internet connection.


                                                 More than an app!

As soon as our campaign goal is met our development of the app takes next level. Improvement requests and ideas are waiting to get implemented. We can’t wait to complete all of them.


           Let’s collaborate to make the best algorithmic investing app ever!

       


In order to accomplish our goal, we need your support, thoughts and suggestions. Select a perk and order a subscription of the app in advance. The subscription will allow you to:

  1. Enjoy decreased fees
  2. Upgrade to a Premium Account with a discount
More advantage to early birds: If you order a subscription before our first campaign goal is met you’ll get your subscription months in double.

Together we can create an investing app that we all love using and can rely on!


             ADVANCED ACCOUNTS

Bellow you can see different account types we offer. Each one of them has different features and investment tactics.


We offer 4 different accounts for investors with different needs. For a custom account design please contact contact@osats.net.

                                            Where will your money go?

  • 5% will go to Indiegogo
  • 5% will go to PayPal
  • 90% will go to the development of the app
    •  
                                         When will the app be available?


                                

Development will start according to schedule if our goals are met. First public release may not contain all the features mentioned above but those will be delivered before the end of year 2015.

Our campaign goals

1. $20,000 will allow us to create an app for iPhone/android (autumn) as well as fully functioning desktop version.
2. $30,000 will significantly speed up our development process.

With your help we can guarantee the continuous development of osats.net.
Other ways to help us:
•  Tell your friends about us
•  Share this campaign on Facebook or Twitter

The higher goal we archieve, the greater possibilities we have to get funding from other sources and investors

                                                           F.A.Q

How can I add funds to my account?
- In order to add more funds just click on the Add Funds tab on our platform. We’re also considering other, more flexible options like taking a percentage of your daily purchases and investing it automatically for you.
What is Algorithmic Trading?
- Algorithmic trading has been around since the early 80’s. By definition algorithmic trading is process in which trader lets computer programs and algorithms implement various strategies automatically. These strategies can vary from conventional technical analysis to complex machine-learning applications that are able to analyse decades of price activity in a fraction of a second. Though algorithmic trading can easily outperform market and leveraged traders, it requires professional supervision.
Will I have to pay for the app after the first 6 months are up?
- No. Most of the app features are included in the free membership. However, advanced features will be available for Premium Accounts only.
What are the advanced features?
- Some of the advanced features are:
     •  Increased maximum account balance
     •  Flexible withdrawal
     •  Decreased fees.
What is flexible withdrawal?
- After every deposit and/or withdrawal our algorithms have to be recalibrated.  This takes time and resources and because of that, we support only monthly account rebalance on free account types.However, our premium account users will be able to deposit and withdraw funds whenever they want.
Will all osats.net content eventually become subject to charge?
 - No. Everything that has been free of charge will always remain free.Will a free version of the application be available?If the campaign goal is met, a free version with most of the features will be available.
Will there be an app available for the Windows Phone?
- We'll first create apps for the Android and iPhone phones and then for the Windows Phone.
Will there be a desktop version of the app?
- Yes. Creating a desktop version is high on our priority list.

Do you have more questions?
- Don't hesitate to email us at contact@osats.net. We'll get in touch with you as soon as possible.

                 
                                                                     © osats.net, 2015

working hard to ensure the best user experience possible, while our backend
engineers makes sure that our algorithms are synchronized with the social
platform.

on high grade performance, however keeping you and your money safe is our highest
priority. We’re working hard to bring you solid returns in ANY economic environment.

financial instruments that work both in deflationary and inflationary market
conditions. All this will be amped up by our proprietary algorithms designed to
trade in highly liquid currency markets.

your account from all your devices.

your progress as you go.

account will be maintained by people who have their own money invested in

your account without internet connection.

as our campaign goal is met our development of the app takes next level. Improvement

all of them.

order a subscription of the app in advance. The subscription will allow you
to:

Enjoy decreased fees
Upgrade to a Premium Account

More advantage
to early birds: If you
order a subscription before our first campaign goal is met you’ll get your

we can create an investing app that we all love using and can rely on!

By definition algorithmic trading is process in which trader lets computer programs and algorithms implement various strategies automatically. These strategies can vary from conventional technical analysis to complex machine-learning applications that are able to analyse decades of price activity in a fraction of a second. story:
Short Summary

Our newly founded NGO believes that learning is the key to personal development, social cohesion and the progress of society, and as such, we want to provide lifelong learning opportunities that encourage intercultural exchange, collaboration and innovative processes.

As lifelong learners ourselves (volunteering, teaching, studying, working in over 10 countries), we want to share our knowledge, experience and skills while designing a vision in which learning is the catalyst for individual empowerment and societal progress.

Our social media following (almost 20.000 likes), being a testimony of our concepts and dedication, as the idea of this NGO has started from a small, volunteer made, blog and Facebook page, called eu-intern, that aimed to help anyone interested in fulfilling their goals, by offering them free information on scholarships, internships, traineeships, conferences, workshops, and much more, as well as valuable advice on how to get selected for these opportunities ( don't forget to follow our social media pages as well, in the links below, sharing with us any opportunities that you would like published is much appreciated as well). 

What We Need & What You Get

  • To design, host and maintain the website for the coming years we would need about 600€ (less but indiegogo charges specific fees of about 20%). The funds will mainly go towards providing a quality hosting service (for at least 3 years) for our website, towards designing it (or buying and adapting existing HTML5 or Wordpress template) and towards maintaining it (making the little changes that it needs: other plugins, widgets, features, sections, optimizations, security, SEO, etc.).
  • For your support we offer you unique perks, like: a big personalized THANK YOU via Email or our Social Media pages, your name on our website (Funded by me), a postcard from our headquarters in Vienna or a 1year membership in our organization (which includes participation in our events for free or fee reductions).
  • The campaign will run with "flexible funding", which means that if we don´t reach our goal we can still get your contribution and use it towards our project. But we may not be able to maintain the website for a long time...

The Impact

The impact is potentially huge, as we are rapidly heading towards a lifelong learning, circular economy, in which the possibilities are endless, but the challenges are daunting. Both the rewards, as well as the dangers, can only be fully grasped with the open eyes, heart and thinking, that true 21st century learning can bring.

Our new organization, being just the natural evolution of our previous experiences: studying education and European public administration, having a master degree in lifelong learning - policy and management (we are only 2 founders, but we have studied in: Austria, Romania, Spain, Denmark and Australia), working in (Austria, Egypt, Germany, France, Spain, Turkey, Belgium, Denmark, Bulgaria, Romania) while always creating and presenting projects, such as: Fraternite 2020 (the first European Citizens' Initiative that aimed to increase European Union scholarships so that everyone could benefit from them); Scientix (bringing the advantages of science to schools); The Cultural Innovators Network (cultural project from Europe, the Middle East and Africa) and many, many others!

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge in not reaching our goal, is that we cannot benefit from the quality services that we would like. The website will be made voluntarily by one of the founders, but the hosting, design, maintenance, adding of features, are all aspects that can have a huge impact on the user experience, but that can only be done by paying for them. Even now, we had to take down our long lasting eu-intern.com website, just so we could host oezlll.org (and the hosting could be much better).

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any help you can offer. Apart from financial support, we are also grateful if you:

  • Share this campaign, our Youtube video, Facebook page or Twitter account with your friends and network!
  • Let us know if you or someone you know has skills, experience or knowledge that can help is with this project or the upcoming ones.
  • Send a personal email to people in your network about our campaign.
  • Give frequent flyer airline miles to assist travel.
  • Propose projects for us after we make the website and suggest other ways of funding them except crowdfunding. 
  • Do you have any other ideas? Please tell us! We would love to hear from you at: contact@oezlll.org

story:
Short Summary

Help SAVE the Historic Hanging Flume! Protect the Places and Stories it Tells for Future Generations.

What is the Hanging Flume?In western Colorado, an engineering marvel of a bygone era clings to sheer canyon walls along seven miles of the Dolores River. The Hanging Flume was built in the 1880s to divert water for gold mining, but the exact method of its construction remains a mystery. How was this immense engineering work completed in such a remote location in just a few years? No written accounts or photographs of its construction exist and time is running out to document the remaining pieces of this fascinating and unique structure. We want to answer the question, “how did they do that?” before valuable clues to the flume’s construction are lost forever. Your contribution will help the Interpretive Association of Western Colorado (IAWC) send a team of engineers, historians, wood scientists and rope access experts to explore and document remaining portions of the flume.

The Hanging Flume is the most intact structure of its kind in the United States, and it is the only hanging flume in a condition suitable for preservation, education and interpretation. It illustrates the ingenuity and fortitude of the engineers and miners intent on extracting gold from the land. The Hanging Flume is a historically significant cultural resource recognized by:

  •   The World Monuments Fund - 2006 Most Endangered Sites list
  •   Colorado Preservation, Inc. - Most Endangered Places of 1999
  •   National Register of Historic Places
  •   Colorado State Register of Historic Properties

Time is Running Out to Document the Flume

The Hanging Flume is deteriorating as a result of the ongoing effects of exposure to the elements, falling debris and rock slides, and scavenging. The threat of losing key segments of the flume means the time is now to investigate and document remaining sections before the evidence is gone forever. Previous expeditions have documented approximately 10 percent of the remaining sections of the Hanging Flume. At each location, different construction configurations were discovered. The urgency for conducting this project now is that undocumented segments may contain key information on the construction of the Flume that will be lost as the 130-year-old structure continues to deteriorate.


What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will help send a team of experts to document additional remaining sections of the flume. The original project team that has made expeditions to the flume and produced technical reports over the past decade is ready to conduct the next phase of investigative work. To get the team to the flume, we only need to raise $20,000 more in order to match over $140,000 already raised!

If we exceed our goal, we will be able to conduct additional historical research on the flume in order to produce a book about its engineering, construction, and preservation.

Contributions at any level are greatly appreciated. Contributors at the $50 level will receive a copy of the 60-minute DVD film about the Hanging Flume, “The Best Kept Secret of the Wild West.” Please share our campaign with your network to make an even greater impact!

The Impact

The ultimate goal is to preserve the Hanging Flume as an interpretive and educational resource for the benefit of present and future generations. Sections of the flume can be seen from overlooks along the Unaweep Tabeguache Scenic Byway and are a popular attraction for tourists visiting Montrose County. Previous expeditions have documented about 10 percent of the flume, and a 48-foot segment of the flume has been reconstructed to demonstrate what the flume would have looked like in the 1880s. Documenting additional sections of the flume will lead to a better understanding of the techniques and technology utilized in its construction. In turn, this documentation will help historians and engineers to better understand and preserve other historic mining, logging and ranching structures.  The history of the Hanging Flume is fascinating from many perspectives, and it should ultimately be documented and shared with all.  This project is the next step in telling that story.

Public Benefit:

1. Helping to document a vital piece of Colorado's gold rush history.

2. Making information about this unique engineering feat available to the      public.

3. Contributing to the overall understanding of the construction techniques and technology of historic mining, logging and ranching structures.


Risks & Challenges

For more than decade the IAWC has been dedicated to preserving and telling the story of the Historic Hanging Flume...the longest historic structure in the State of Colorado. This site is believed to be the only remaining site used for gold placer mining in the U.S. with relatively intact segments of the hanging flume and is located on Public Land managed by the Bureau of Land Management.  If it were to be lost, we would lose not only the visible example of a hanging flume, but would also lose the opportunity to understand the innovative techniques used in its construction over a century ago.

Other Ways You Can Help

For more information about this project please go to hangingflume.org

story:
¡Haz click aquí para Español!

INTRODUCTION

How privilege we are, and we may sometimes forget it. For me a way to give back is to volunteer hands-on, the offering of my skills and energy to the best of my abilities for the highest good and the development of others, by having in return the genuine satisfaction of doing so. Besides, I always have the intention to go the extra mile.

Therefore, I have decided from August 2015 and for 12 weeks that I will volunteer in ‘Rocinha’ one of the largest and poorest ‘favela’ or ‘barrio’ communities of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. According to official state numbers, 22% of the people in Rocinha lives under the poverty line (1.25$ a day as The World Bank established).

The 3 million plus inhabitants of Rio de Janeiro's favelas face overwhelming challenges every day; as fierce unemployment, unsanitary living conditions, lack of health care / pre-natal care, malnutrition, poor drinking water, educational shortfalls, drugs, domestic abuse, homelessness, and the list goes on and on.

During 12 weeks, I will join the Project Favela’s team as a facilitator for learning; I hope to contribute with enthusiasm, excellence and loving. This NGO is a small Rio based initiative and after communicating with Scott Miles (the founder and president), I am incredibly excited by what lays ahead. Project Favela will place me together with a team of 15 volunteers to challenge myself and put me to my best use for the community I am immersed in, activities range from project coordination, training volunteers, English-Spanish classes, sports, culture and arts. No two days will be the same and I will really have to "roll up my sleeves" to make sure I do the best I can.

WHAT WE ARE FUNDING FOR:

The crowdfunding target is 1600 USD, of the funds you raised:
* $1100 = 3450 BRL = 990 EUR = 7400 DKK donation + anything over the target will go to Project Favela initiative and the volunteer home that houses the volunteers.
* $500 = 1560 BRL = 445 EUR = 3330 DKK travel expenses from Santiago (SCL), Chile to Rio Janeiro Intl (GIG), Brazil.

OTHER WAY YOU CAN HELP: Please spread the word!!! Thank you.

All of it towards to create a positive impact and for the highest good of the Rocinha community.

THE IMPACT:

Project Favela is an organization 7 years old, that collaborates with about 15 local NGOs and provides individual placement for international volunteers. The presence of the volunteers creates a general positive influence in the community. School is small but teach over 25 classes to almost 100 kids each week.

Thank you so much for your generous support! God Bless You! I will keep you post it and if you donate 20$ please leave your postal address, as we will send you a postcard made by the kids from Rocinha!

Again, anything above this target will go to Project Favela.

Many Kind Regards,
Angel Grimalt (Arthur)
Volunteer / AFSer / IESA alumni / Insight Seminars graduate / AIESEC allied

You can check out on Internet:
https://www.facebook.com/projectfavela?fref=ts
http://www.projectfavela.org/
http://projectfavelablog.weebly.com/

“Extraordinary people, doing extraordinary things”

Español

INTRODUCCIÓN

Para mí el Voluntariado es una manera de Dar, ofrecer mis habilidades y energía al máximo de mis capacidades para el Bien Mayor y el desarrollo de otros, y recibir así en retorno la satisfacción genuina de haberlo hecho con excelencia. Además, siempre tengo la intención de ir más allá.

Por ello, decidí a partir de Agosto de 2015 y durante 12 semanas ser voluntario en Rocinha, una de las favelas o barrios más grandes y más pobres de Río de Janeiro, Brasil. De acuerdo con cifras oficiales el 22% de la población en Rocinha vive bajo la línea de pobreza (1,25 dólares por día según el Banco Mundial).

Los más de 3 millones de habitantes de las favelas de Río de Janeiro se enfrentan a desafíos abrumadores cada día, como el desempleo masivo, condiciones de vida insalubres, la falta de servicios de Salud, la desnutrición, el agua potable deficiente, deficiencias educativas, las drogas, el abuso doméstico, la falta de vivienda, y la lista sigue.

Durante 3 meses voy a formar parte del equipo de ‘Favela Project’ como facilitador para el aprendizaje, espero apoyar al equipo con entusiasmo, mística y pasión. Esta ONG es una pequeña iniciativa basada en Rio, y después de conversar con Scott Miles (fundador y presidente) estoy emocionado por lo que está por venir. El Proyecto me colocará junto con un equipo de 15 voluntarios para retarme a mí mismo y ponerme en el mejor uso para la comunidad en la que estaré inmerso. Los días no serán iguales uno de otro, las actividades van desde clases de español-inglés, deporte, matemáticas y ciencia, y realmente tendré que "aplicarme" para asegurarme de que hago lo mejor que puedo.

PARA QUE ESTAMOS RECAUDANDO:

La meta de la financiación colectiva es 1600 USD, de los fondos que se recauden:

* $1100 = 3450 BRL = 990 EUR = 7400 DKK donación + cualquier monto sobre la meta irá a ‘Favela Project’ y a la casa hogar que alberga a los voluntarios.

* $500 = 1560 BRL = 445 EUR = 3330 DKK costos de viaje (ida y vuelta) desde Santiago (SCL), Chile a Rio Janeiro International (GIG), Brasil.

OTRA FORMA QUE PUEDES APOYAR: corre la voz!!! muchas gracias.

Todo para crear un impacto positivo y para el Bien Mayor de la comunidad de Rocinha.

EL IMPACTO: 

Proyecto Favela es una organización con 7 años de vida que colabora con cerca de 15 ONG locales, y proporciona ubicación para voluntarios extranjeros. La presencia de los voluntarios crea una influencia positiva en todos los sentidos en la comunidad. La escuela es pequeña, pero enseña más de 25 clases a casi 100 niños cada semana.

¡Muchas gracias por tu generoso apoyo! ¡Dios te bendiga! ¡Te mantendré al tanto y si donas $20, deja tu dirección postal ¡te enviaremos una postal hecha por los niños de Rocinha! 

Una vez más, las donaciones por encima de esta meta se destinarán al Proyecto Favela.

Angel Grimalt (Arthur)

Voluntario / AFSer / Egresado IESA  / Aliado AIESEC / Graduado Seminarios Insight

Puedes revisar en Internet:

story_txt:
¡Haz click aquí para Español!
INTRODUCTIONHow privilege we are, and we may sometimes forget it. For me a way to give back is to volunteer hands-on, the offering of my skills and energy to the best of my abilities for the highest good and the development of others, by having in return the genuine satisfaction of doing so. Besides, I always have the intention to go the extra mile.Therefore, I have decided from August 2015 and for 12 weeks that I will volunteer in ‘Rocinha’ one of the largest and poorest ‘favela’ or ‘barrio’ communities of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. According to official state numbers, 22% of the people in Rocinha lives under the poverty line (1.25$ a day as The World Bank established). The 3 million plus inhabitants of Rio de Janeiro's favelas face overwhelming challenges every day; as fierce unemployment, unsanitary living conditions, lack of health care / pre-natal care, malnutrition, poor drinking water, educational shortfalls, drugs, domestic abuse, homelessness, and the list goes on and on. During 12 weeks, I will join the Project Favela’s team as a facilitator for learning; I hope to contribute with enthusiasm, excellence and loving. This NGO is a small Rio based initiative and after communicating with Scott Miles (the founder and president), I am incredibly excited by what lays ahead. Project Favela will place me together with a team of 15 volunteers to challenge myself and put me to my best use for the community I am immersed in, activities range from project coordination, training volunteers, English-Spanish classes, sports, culture and arts. No two days will be the same and I will really have to "roll up my sleeves" to make sure I do the best I can.WHAT WE ARE FUNDING FOR:The crowdfunding target is 1600 USD, of the funds you raised: * $1100 = 3450 BRL = 990 EUR = 7400 DKK donation + anything over the target will go to Project Favela initiative and the volunteer home that houses the volunteers.* $500 = 1560 BRL = 445 EUR = 3330 DKK travel expenses from Santiago (SCL), Chile to Rio Janeiro Intl (GIG), Brazil.OTHER WAY YOU CAN HELP: Please spread the word!!! Thank you.All of it towards to create a positive impact and for the highest good of the Rocinha community.THE IMPACT: Project Favela is an organization 7 years old, that collaborates with about 15 local NGOs and provides individual placement for international volunteers. The presence of the volunteers creates a general positive influence in the community. School is small but teach over 25 classes to almost 100 kids each week.Thank you so much for your generous support! God Bless You! I will keep you post it and if you donate 20$ please leave your postal address, as we will send you a postcard made by the kids from Rocinha!Again, anything above this target will go to Project Favela.Many Kind Regards, Angel Grimalt (Arthur)Volunteer / AFSer / IESA alumni / Insight Seminars graduate / AIESEC alliedYou can check out on Internet: https://www.facebook.com/projectfavela?fref=tshttp://www.projectfavela.org/http://projectfavelablog.weebly.com/“Extraordinary people, doing extraordinary things”

Español

INTRODUCCIÓN

Para mí el Voluntariado
es una manera de Dar, ofrecer mis habilidades y energía al máximo de mis
capacidades para el Bien Mayor y el desarrollo de otros, y recibir así en
retorno la satisfacción genuina de haberlo hecho con excelencia. Además,
siempre tengo la intención de ir más allá.
Por ello, decidí a
partir de Agosto de 2015 y durante 12 semanas ser voluntario en Rocinha, una de
las favelas o barrios más grandes y más pobres de Río de Janeiro, Brasil. De
acuerdo con cifras oficiales el 22% de la población en Rocinha vive bajo la
línea de pobreza (1,25 dólares por día según el Banco Mundial). 
Los más de 3 millones
de habitantes de las favelas de Río de Janeiro se enfrentan a desafíos
abrumadores cada día, como el desempleo masivo, condiciones de vida insalubres, la
falta de servicios de Salud, la desnutrición, el agua potable deficiente,
deficiencias educativas, las drogas, el abuso doméstico, la falta de vivienda,
y la lista sigue.
Durante 3 meses voy a formar parte del equipo de ‘Favela Project’ como facilitador para el aprendizaje, espero apoyar al equipo
con entusiasmo, mística y pasión. Esta ONG es una pequeña iniciativa basada en
Rio, y después de conversar con Scott Miles (fundador y presidente) estoy emocionado
por lo que está por venir. El Proyecto me colocará junto con un equipo de 15
voluntarios para retarme a mí mismo y ponerme en el mejor uso para la comunidad
en la que estaré inmerso. Los días no serán iguales uno de otro, las actividades van desde clases de español-inglés, deporte, matemáticas y ciencia, y realmente tendré
que "aplicarme" para asegurarme de que hago lo mejor que puedo.

PARA QUE ESTAMOS
RECAUDANDO:
La meta de la
financiación colectiva es 1600 USD, de los fondos que se recauden:
* $1100 = 3450 BRL =
990 EUR = 7400 DKK donación + cualquier monto sobre la meta irá a ‘Favela
Project’ y a la casa hogar que alberga a los voluntarios.
* $500 = 1560 BRL =
445 EUR = 3330 DKK costos de viaje (ida y vuelta) desde Santiago (SCL), Chile a
Rio Janeiro International (GIG), Brasil.
OTRA FORMA QUE PUEDES APOYAR: corre la voz!!! muchas gracias.

Todo para crear un impacto positivo y para el Bien Mayor de la comunidad de Rocinha.
EL IMPACTO: 
Proyecto Favela es una organización con 7 años de vida que colabora con cerca de 15 ONG locales, y proporciona ubicación para voluntarios extranjeros. La presencia de los voluntarios crea una influencia positiva en todos los sentidos en la comunidad. La escuela es pequeña, pero enseña más de 25 clases a casi 100 niños cada semana.

¡Muchas gracias por tu
generoso apoyo! ¡Dios te bendiga! ¡Te mantendré al tanto y si donas $20, deja tu dirección postal ¡te enviaremos una postal hecha por los
niños de Rocinha! 
Una vez más, las donaciones por encima de esta meta se
destinarán al Proyecto Favela.
Angel Grimalt (Arthur)
Voluntario / AFSer / Egresado IESA  / Aliado AIESEC / Graduado Seminarios Insight
Puedes revisar en Internet:
https://www.facebook.com/projectfavela?fref=ts
http://www.projectfavela.org/
http://projectfavelablog.weebly.com/

extraordinaria, haciendo cosas extraordinarias."

story:
Community Culture Change, Inc.

Hello!

My name is Bryan Marquez and I'm one of the founding members of Community Culture Change, Inc., or C3 for short. We're a nonprofit that engages the community through project-based works. The goal of our projects is to get members of the local community involved and connected with one another.

Our first project, Accelerate Tutoring, was created to address LAUSD's budget cuts to tutoring programs. As a free tutoring center for the local community, we brought passionate tutors to students who were in need of one-on-one tutoring. We started off our first week with two students registered, and we ended the 2015 school year with 30 students enrolled in our program!

Currently, we're looking to raise funds for tech equipment that will allow us to incorporate new curriculum and keep better metrics of student progress. With these upgrades, we'll be able to open up our program to additional elementary schools and have a greater impact on the East LA community. 


What are our tech upgrades?

In total, we'll need a minimum of $2,500 for the upgrades we'd like to incorporate into our program. Below is a breakdown of the equipment we'll be purchasing:

  • 6 iPads x $250 each = $1500
  • 2 Laptops x $200 each = $400
  • Bluetooth Mice x 6 = $90
  • Ticket to Read x 20 accounts = $400
  • Marketing Costs to Promote Upgrades = $140
  • Total Amount of Upgrade = $2500
These are estimated prices based off the requirements we need to run our curriculum. Of course, if we're able to find a cheaper deal that meets the requirements, we'll go with that deal. We'll use any money that exceeds our goal to either buy more equipment (enabling higher enrollment) or provide a better one-on-one experience for our students. If we are not able to reach our goal, any funds that we're able to acquire will be combined with our own money to purchase said equipment.

What is the curriculum that will utilize the new tech?

Ticket to Read: Designed to help with reading skills and reading comprehension, we believe this new curriculum will effectively improve students' reading skills and promote an increased interest in reading outside of school. To properly utilize the potential of the program, we need a number of iPads. Your support will help us take advantage of the optimized touch screen and online material.

Additionally, each student enrollment costs $20 for the year. It is our goal to provide any family who can't afford the costs a free scholarship for the program as a gesture of love and care for our community.

Khan Academy: A Web-based math program that provides a personalized curriculum for each student based on his or her need. It also includes video tutorials to help students understand the underlying concepts. We piloted this program last year and found it to be an excellent way to provide personalized learning for each student.

We have a few older laptops that can run Khan Academy, but our computer lab is often filled. With additional laptops, we can better meet student demand and help more students to improve their math skills.

Metrics

Our biggest challenge has been keeping quantifiable metrics that would allow us to truly see how well our students are doing in school. Currently, we are only able to measure by the information that parents give us. We feel that with the above curriculum, we'll be able to better keep track of students' progress in their areas of studies.



Gratitude

We will always be grateful to all those that spend time and money in making the C3 dream a reality, so we will be offering the following signs of gratitude to those who give money to our campaign. 

All backers will be receive a receipt of your contribution to our nonprofit, which you can then use as tax deduction.

  • Anyone making a contribution can be be placed on our "Community Wall," by writing into info@c3center.org. Just let us know that you contributed to our IndieGoGo Campaign. Community Wall is  a page on our site with all the people, groups, and organizations that have supported C3's vision.
  • $25 - You will be placed on our "Community Wall" at c3center.org. We will get in contact via email if you would like to leave a personal message to the students or would like to dedicate your contribution.
  • $50 - Previous show of gratitude plus a brief personalized video message from the staff, tutors, community members, and students.
  • $100 - All previous shows of gratitude plus an invitation to come to the tutoring center and check out the impact that your contribution is creating, (Must be able to provide your own means of transportation to the Accelerate Tutoring Center in East Los Angeles. Address and date of trip with be discussed via email.)


Helping us make a difference

Your donation would be vital in fulfilling a short-term need and making a tangible difference in the quality of services Accelerate Tutoring can provide to students.

Accelerate's success has come from not only making sure that students are doing well in school, but from nurturing their well-being and cultivating a positive environment where tutors and students are a family. We had a great year of tutoring and saw many students succeed in their studies, become more self-confident, and develop new skills such as typing. We would like you to be part of our success and inspire others to create their own change!


Other Ways You Can Help

There are plenty of ways that you can help C3 be a success! Here are some ways of helping:

  • Spreading the word of this campaign through your own networks and social media.
  • Volunteer as a tutor at Accelerate Tutoring, we operate Tues-Thurs, from 3 pm-6 pm. For more info, check out our website!
  • Using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Sharing your ideas with us by writing an email to: info@c3center.org.

For More lnformation

For more information about Accelerate Tutoring:

acceleratetutoring.com

story:
In short 

We are driving from London to Mongolia in a 1999 Renault Clio, to raise money for SOS Childrens' Villages Disaster Fund (supporting children's well being in disaster struck areas) and CoolEarth (rain forest preservation).

All the money raised here will go straight to charity.



An adventure of the heart

We are supporting a good cause by doing something that many people would label 'insane'. And it is (both a good cause and slightly insane). We’re going to take a small under-powered car, like the one our grannies used to drive, and drive it 14000 kilometers to the other side of the world - to raise money for charity and increase awareness of the importance of supporting child welfare in remote places.

The Rally, The car and the Master Plan

Organized by the Adventurists, the Mongol Rally launches teams of adventurous people crammed into tiny cars, and sends them on their way from London to Mongolia. Teams and cars have very different age, background and pedigree – but one thing they all have in common is that every single car is designed for a very very different purpose. It's not a race and it doesn't have a prize, the outcome is purely the money raised, and the adventure.

In the words of the organizers: "There’s no backup, no support and no set route; just you, your fellow adventurists and a tiny car you bought from a scrapyard for £11.50". 

The rules of the Rally are gloriously simple:

1. You can only take a farcically small vehicle.
2. You’re completely on your own.
3. You've got to raise a £1000 for charity 

Our car

This is Mats and our car, a '99 Renault Clio. It was designed to be an affordable city car with a minimum of extras. What we intend to do with this lovely piece of (French) equipment is the exact opposite of why it was conceived in the first place – driving it a very long distance and taking it way way way out of its' city comfort zone. 

The Plan

The Rally starts in London, but we will commence our journey in Stockholm, Sweden. From there we will drive to London, and onwards through France, Belgium, Germany, Austria, Croatia, Serbia, Bulgaria, Turkey, Iran, Turkmenistan, Uzbeikstan, Kyrgyzstan, Kazakhstan, Russia (again) and into Mongolia and Ulan Bator. From there we will do the final push up to Ulan Ude (Russia yet again). If all goes as planned (haha) we will make the journey in roughly 30 days.

Fundraising

Raising money for charity is central to us, ensuring that this adventure will be a positive force that does as much good along the way as humanly possible. Because we are both parents we have selected SOS Children's Villages as our charity of choice. As part of the Mongol Rally charity we will also donate £500 to CoolEarth, a charity that works alongside indigenous villages to halt rainforest destruction

Raising money for charity is part of the race, and we are setting our fundraiser bar high. But for that, we need your help.

SOS Children's Villages is an established global charity that engages and supports children in many of the countries on our planned route. They are active in 134 countries and territories around the world, working with a single mission: to ensure that every child grows with love, security and respect.

The Team

Team members are Mats; a techie martial arts guy who lives for DIY home improvements, and Fredrik; an EBM (Electronic Body Music) fanatic who enjoys riding motorcycles, and fishing.


We chose name Team Red Adder, as a combined tribute to the main character of the book 'The Long Ships', a great story about the viking Röde Orm (Red Snake) traveling the world, and the greatest anti-hero of all times; Edmund Blackadder. 

We will provide continuous updates from the Rally in social media (make sure to check out https://www.facebook.com/TeamRedAdder). In these updates we will make sure to highlight the support we get from our Friends, Sponsors and Supporters. We will be generous with stories (ups and downs) and pictures (good ones and bad ones) and share the adventure with you all.

story:
A Little Bit of Background

In 1958, the Chinese government instituted the hukou system, in order to control the influx of people from rural areas into the cities.  Today, the system continues to discriminate against rural residents in favor of urban residents, and whether they stay in rural areas of move with their parents to the cities for better work opportunities, China’s rural children do not have the same access to a quality education as their urban peers. 

What Is Stepping Stones? 

Stepping Stones is a not-for-profit organization founded in 2006 with a mission to help narrow the educational gap by providing English lessons to rural children in Shanghai’s migrant schools, as well as in rural China. 

English is one of the three core subjects in China’s school curriculum, and the one that poses the greatest challenge to rural Chinese teachers. 

English level therefore is the biggest differentiator between urban and rural Chinese children, and this perpetuates the gap in educational and employment opportunities.

Shanghai benefits from a large expatriate and local English-speaking community, many of whom are eager for high-impact volunteering opportunities. Stepping Stones was founded to match this rich resource to a real need in the community.

The Impact 

Stepping Stones has around 300 volunteers teaching close to 5000 children in Shanghai every week during the school term in 31 different schools and communities in Shanghai. 

Our programs have proven to be effective. Students in a migrant school in Minhang District taught by a volunteer teacher through our program improved their test scores in English by an average of 9%.

The percentage of students considering English as their favorite subject increased by 43.6%, from 32.72% to 47%, in the span of three months. 

Why We Need Your Help

The profits of this fundraiser will go directly to help Stepping Stones expand our program.

Only US$30 (200rmb) could support one migrant student’s English classes for one year, which covers volunteers’ transportation cost, training cost, teaching materials, etc.  

It is our belief that everyone deserves an equal opportunity in education.  We want to expand our program to reach as many children as possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There's more than one way to help. Spread the word on behalf of Stepping Stones and invite people to volunteer, donate to our campaign and visit our website.

story:
Meet the Photographer

Thank you for your interest in The India Photography Project! My name is Emily Rose Weinstein, and I am a professional freelance photographer from New York City hoping to empower youth in the slums of India through photography.

Back home in the USA, I work with an events company servicing clients such as Google, Facebook, Barclays Capital and Apple. I also have 5+ years of nonprofit experience working at the United Nations, as well as in countries such as India, Ghana and the USA. I am educated in international development and photography. As a graduate of Fordham University, I majored in Anthropology with a dual minor in International Humanitarian Affairs and Visual Arts.


From February-March of 2015, I served as an AJJDC Multi-Week Fellow with Gabriel Project Mumbai. I taught English and world geography in Kalva, creating and facilitating a successful curriculum. Students learned and retained information about the countries of the world, while practicing and improving their spoken and written English. 

Upon completing my fellowship, I became the first GPM volunteer to be invited back to work with the organization assisting with promotion and marketing, as well as to spearhead the implementation of a photography teaching project in the Kalva slums. While I am thrilled to accept this incredible opportunity, the assignment is largely pro bono work to assist the promotion of GPM and local nonprofits in Mumbai. To make my journey across the world feasible, I am hoping to raise money to cover base travel and living expenses.


The Impact

Supporting my work brings funding to children in need. Ever heard the phrase, "a picture is worth a thousand words"? Photographic evidence of social programs in action guarantees larger donations for an organization. That means the more images produced, the more images are circulated to spread awareness of a great initiative, increasing funds for that same program.
But these high quality, professional level images have to come from somewhere...I have experience working in these communities already, as well as access to a security team to accompany me into more dangerous areas where other photographers might not want to risk bringing expensive equipment.

I want to do more than take photographs; I want to teach children how to tell their own stories, through their eyes. Photography is empowering, and I want to give students the ability to tell the world about the way they live and the things that are important to them. That's why I will be putting my knowledge of international development, marketing and photography to work with GPM to start a photography education program for the students of Kalva. The children will produce their own images using disposable and digital cameras, while learning important lessons on how to convey meaning through imagery. Sharing their work will promote global awareness of poverty and its effect on youth.





This is the start of a much bigger initiative... This isn't a short-term project. Over the course of the summer, I have been meeting with potential funders and supporters in preparation for my return trip to India. If all funding goals for the India Photography Project are met and the learning segment of the project is completed, the next step will be to compile the children's photographs into a book which will be published and sold internationally. All proceeds will benefit the educational programs operating in Kalva.

...the India Photography Project is the first stage of a nonprofit. The next 6 months are crucial in determining the feasibility and sustainability of The Photography Project. My goal is to reduce the risk of unforeseen obstacles by testing the curriculum in a challenging, yet familiar environment. Once the project is proven successful, I will begin the process of establishing a registered nonprofit to spearhead the implementation of similar endeavors in impoverished communities all over the world.


How Your Donation Helps


$1,150 USD         Airfare and visa

$1,050 USD        Photo equipment [Breakdown: $6 USD/1 waterproof disposable                                      camera (125 needed); $60 USD/1 digital camera (5 needed)]

$4,800 USD       Food, transportation and accommodation costs while in India

Other Ways You Can Help

Your donation is greatly appreciated. If you want to do more to help me reach my goal and begin my journey, please use the Indiegogo sharing tools to tell your friends and family about this opportunity to support the nonprofits of India. Don't forget to use the hashtag "#OnAssignment" to spread the message to working photographers all over the world!
story_txt:
Meet the Photographer

Thank you for your interest in The India Photography Project! My name is Emily Rose Weinstein, and I am a professional freelance photographer from New York City hoping to empower youth in the slums of India through photography.Back home in the USA, I work with an events company servicing clients such as Google, Facebook, Barclays Capital and Apple. I also have 5+ years of nonprofit experience working at the United Nations, as well as in countries such as India, Ghana and the USA. I am educated in international development and photography. As a graduate of Fordham University, I majored in Anthropology with a dual minor in International Humanitarian Affairs and Visual Arts.


From February-March of 2015, I served as an AJJDC Multi-Week Fellow with Gabriel Project Mumbai. I taught English and world geography in Kalva, creating and facilitating a successful curriculum. Students learned and retained information about the countries of the world, while practicing and improving their spoken and written English. Upon completing my fellowship, I became the first GPM volunteer to be invited back to work with the organization assisting with promotion and marketing, as well as to spearhead the implementation of a photography teaching project in the Kalva slums. While I am thrilled to accept this incredible opportunity, the assignment is largely pro bono work to assist the promotion of GPM and local nonprofits in Mumbai. To make my journey across the world feasible, I am hoping to raise money to cover base travel and living expenses.


The Impact

Supporting my work brings funding to children in need. Ever heard the phrase, "a picture is worth a thousand words"? Photographic evidence of social programs in action guarantees larger donations for an organization. That means the more images produced, the more images are circulated to spread awareness of a great initiative, increasing funds for that same program.

That's why I will be putting my knowledge of international development, marketing and photography to work with GPM to start a photography education program for the students of Kalva. The children will produce their own images using disposable and digital cameras, while learning important lessons on how to convey meaning through imagery. Sharing their work will promote global awareness of poverty and its effect on youth.
This is the start of a much bigger initiative... This isn't a short-term project. Over the course of the summer, I have been meeting with potential funders and supporters in preparation for my return trip to India. If all funding goals for the India Photography Project are met and the learning segment of the project is completed, the next step will be to compile the children's photographs into a book which will be published and sold internationally. All proceeds will benefit the educational programs operating in Kalva....the India Photography Project is the first stage of a nonprofit. The next 6 months are crucial in determining the feasibility and sustainability of The Photography Project. My goal is to reduce the risk of unforeseen obstacles by testing the curriculum in a challenging, yet familiar environment. Once the project is proven successful, I will begin the process of establishing a registered nonprofit to spearhead the implementation of similar endeavors in impoverished communities all over the world.








How Your Donation Helps

$1,150 USD         Airfare and visa
$1,050 USD        Photo equipment [Breakdown: $6 USD/1 waterproof disposable                                      camera (125 needed); $60 USD/1 digital camera (5 needed)]

If you want to do more to help me reach my goal and begin my journey, please use the Indiegogo sharing tools to tell your friends and family about this opportunity to support the nonprofits of India. Don't forget to use the hashtag "#OnAssignment" to spread the message to working photographers all over the world!
