story:
Why the Rebel High Movement

When I was a teenager, I dealt with depression, drugs, alcohol, peer pressure, bullying and self-inflicted abuse. It was a flipping nightmare.

I was chronically spending my time in the principal's office at school or the shrink's office after school. I was told I had a "melancholy personality" by my sophomore year in high school, and the only remedy for my misbehavior, poor performance in school and emotional problems was long-term medication. I refused.

Today, I'm a 31 year old published author, professional speaker, multiple 6-figure business owner and award-winning entrepreneur. I don't tell you that to brag. I couldn't care less what anyone thinks about my accomplishments because they don't define who I am as a person. I tell you this because through many years of struggling, hard work and discovering why God has kept me alive all these years, I realized my worth, value and purpose for my life.

And that's to teach young girls, those between the ages of 10 and 18, the truth about who they are and what they're capable of, if they would simply develop a positive mindset, believe in themselves and take consistent action towards their goals and dreams.

When a girl has someone mentoring her, rooting for her and giving her the tools she needs to make good choices, stand up to peer pressure and pursue the life she wants, ANYTHING is possible. She performs better in school, excels in sports and extracurricular activities, she's interested in new things, feels more confident, treats others better, pays attention to what's important to her, and she makes a difference in the lives of others.

With just a little direction, our female youth can do WONDERS with their lives. They can impact other students at school, empower their families and become who they're meant to be. 

It's clear that young girls need a positive message regarding body image, confidence, feeling purposeful and creating a healthy lifestyle despite their background, current environment, schooling or looks. They CAN make good choices, powerfully shape their future and feel convicted in who they are... and it starts HERE and NOW with your help. 

That's why I've created the Rebel High movement and ask for you to be a part of it. So this powerful mission can become a reality and influence, dare I say, change, the lives of many.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding AND support. If you're able to give, awesome. We appreciate it. If you can't, that's okay. We just ask that you share this movement continuously so those who can give will support this endeavor. Either way, you're part of this now, and you matter to our mission.

In case you're wondering, we have plans for how we're going to reach tween and teen girls around the globe. This is where we're starting and how your contribution will help:

  • The "Rebel High Live" event will feature a full day of education and entertainment for 100 girls and one of their guardians. The experience will change lives, and admission will be free. We have several events planned for 2015. 
  • The livestreamed webcast of the Rebel High Live event will allow thousands of girls around the world to be part of the experience without having to travel to the live destination.
  • Copies of Elizabeth Hazel and The Day of Desires (Aperature Press) will be distributed to girls around the world who cannot afford the book (see below for a description of the book).
  • Speaking and book tours are in the works where I will venture into elementary, middle and high schools around the United States (international tours aren't out of the question either!).

Join me in this movement and let's do something amazing together.

Oh, and by the way, when you help financially support our Rebel High Movement, we do more than thank you... Here are some of the "Perks" available to you:

  • Your own personal copy of Elizabeth Hazel and The Day of Desires (Aperature Press). Once the book is released, we'll mail it straight to your home! (See below for a description of the book.)
  • The COOL Rebel High t-shirt so you can show off your generosity!
  • Access to our "QuickStart" 30-day online program for weight loss and energy (a $97 value). It comes with video tutorials, action sheets and community access for accountability and support.
  • Access to our signature "Rebel University" 90-day lifestyle system to create your own healthy mindset, energized and toned body and positivity in your life ($497 value). Program comes with online tutorials, action sheets, community support, live coaching calls and lots of bonuses for rapid results.
  • Private coaching calls with a Rebel Coach to map out your own weight loss plan so you look and feel the way you want as quickly as possible ($750 value). Perk includes (2) 30 minute coaching calls, email support and community access for accountability.
  • Spend the day with Katie Humphrey in Jacksonville, Florida, and map out your health and lifestyle goals for the year ($5,000 value). Day involves 4 hours of high-level private coaching, lunch and a massage at the end of the day! 

*Please note: Any and all Perks can be donated or transferred to someone you love.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Can't financially contribute? We totally get it. Here's how you can still help...

    • Use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the word about our movement.
    • Ask your friends and family to spread the word, too!

    Description of the Book

    Elizabeth Hazel and The Day of Desires (Aperature Press) is a fiction-based story in which a young girl discovers her true potential by facing her biggest fears and overcoming extraordinary adversity in the fantastical world of Ellon.

    The book teaches young girls how to take control of their lives by developing a healthy, positive mindset and choosing to believe in themselves.

story:
L’Association des juristes progressistes (AJP) est une association qui regroupe des avocats-es, des professeurs-es de droit, des étudiants-es en droit et des domaines connexes et d’autres gens œuvrant dans la défense de droits. L’AJP soumet que les juristes ont un rôle à jouer dans l’avancement de la société vers un modèle plus juste et égalitaire. Pour ce faire, il est important que la population ait les moyens pour se mobiliser et revendiquer collectivement des changements. 

Un des aspects les plus importants de cette lutte est l’accessibilité à la justice.  Nous vivons dans une société de plus en plus judiciarisée alors que la population n’est pas très éduquée sur ses droits. Certaines études vont jusqu'à démontrer que c'est près de 50% des gens qui admettent ne pas connaître la loi. Que ce soit au travail, dans notre logement ou dans la rue, nous ne connaissons pas nos droits et encore moins comment exercer les recours nécessaires pour les défendre.

L’AJP pense que le meilleur outil pour tenter de corriger cette situation demeure l’éducation.  Voici pourquoi nous désirons donner des formations dans les cégeps à travers la province pour éduquer les jeunes (et moins jeunes) sur leurs droits dans le cas de situations communes ainsi les recours qui s’ouvrent à eux. 

L’AJP prévoit donner dans un premier temps 4 formations de 3 heures chacune sur les sujets suivants :

-  Droit du travail : normes et pratiques

-  Santé et sécurité au travail

-  Droit du logement

-  Droits et libertés fondamentaux

Nous croyons que ces sujets couvrent la grande majorité des situations auxquelles on peut être confronté en commençant la vie d’adulte.  Les formations seront dispensées par des avocats-es qui pourront également offrir des exemples et répondre à des questions pour informer davantage les étudiants-es qui vont y assister.

Dans une société où la population est continuellement confrontée à des situations qui font intervenir des normes juridiques, il est essentiel qu’il y ait un minimum d’éducation sur ces normes ainsi que sur les recours qui existent pour assurer leur respect.

Nous avons besoin de votre aide pour concevoir les formations et éventuellement les offrir partout au Québec.  L’AJP est un organisme sans but lucratif qui ne bénéficie d’aucune subvention gouvernementale et qui fonctionne présentement à travers le seul travail de bénévoles. Cette indépendance financière permet aussi une indépendance politique. C'est un gage supplémentaire de qualité pour les formations que nous offrirons.

Tous les fonds ramassés durant cette campagne vont aller directement au financement de ce projet. Ils serviront principalement à la création de la formation et à la production du matériel de formation. Notamment, un livret sera donné à chacun-e des participants-es. Grâce à vous, des dizaines d'avocats-es accompliront des formations à des centaines, voire des milliers, d'étudiants-es collégiaux-les.

Si jamais il vous était impossible de nous aider financièrement, vous pouvez toujours nous donner un bon coup de main en partageant le plus possible notre projet et en incitant vos proches à y contribuer.

L’éducation juridique nous donne les outils pour nous impliquer dans la défense de nos droits. Aidez-nous, pour qu’on puisse vous aider à notre tour! 

(Pour plus d’information sur notre organisme et nos activités, visitez notre site web à l’adresse www.ajpquebec.org.)

essentiel qu’il y ait un minimum d’éducation sur ces normes ainsi que sur les
recours qui existent pour assurer leur respect.
Nous avons besoin de votre aide pour concevoir les formations et
éventuellement les offrir partout au Québec. 
L’AJP est un organisme sans but lucratif qui ne bénéficie d’aucune
subvention gouvernementale et qui fonctionne présentement à travers le seul travail de bénévoles. Cette indépendance financière permet aussi une indépendance politique. C'est un gage supplémentaire de qualité pour les formations que nous offrirons.
Tous les fonds ramassés durant cette campagne vont
aller directement au financement de ce projet. Ils serviront principalement à la création de la formation et à la production du matériel de formation. Notamment, un livret sera donné à chacun-e des participants-es. Grâce à vous, des dizaines d'avocats-es accompliront des formations à des centaines, voire des milliers, d'étudiants-es collégiaux-les.
Si jamais il vous était impossible de nous aider financièrement, vous pouvez toujours nous donner un bon coup de main en partageant le plus possible notre projet et en incitant vos proches à y contribuer.
L’éducation juridique nous donne les outils pour nous
impliquer dans la défense de nos droits. Aidez-nous, pour qu’on puisse vous
aider à notre tour! 
(Pour plus
d’information sur notre organisme et nos activités, visitez notre site web à
l’adresse www.ajpquebec.org.)

story:
Donate to the School of YOUR Choice!

Here you can view the progress of funding for the school of your choice! After your donation, simply state the "school" you would like the funds to be deposited in the comments. Then, watch as funds continue to increase! Invite your family and friends to "donate" to YOUR school!



Short Summary

Tami Van Dusen and Cindy Bowen have been in business for over 30 years --- teaching children life skills through the power of music and the stage!  With technology abundant in children’s lives, many are losing the ability to engage with an audience, let alone communicate one on one with another individual!  We believe that kids are “tech’d out” and that our program can make an incredible difference in their future by teaching them life skills that are being lost!


What We Need & What You Get

Ready? Set? You bet!  We have been teaching this program as a private business and have taught kids that are from more affluent families for years!  Therefore, this program, now being requested by teachers in public schools, is only waiting for funding to be able to put it in the hands of teachers and or aids in under privileged schools!  It costs only $2,500 for an entire year of curriculum per school!  This includes, choreography, sample concerts, orchestrations, sample vocals, notated music and lessons plans! 

    



Our perks are a demonstration of our creativity and enthusiasm to help spread the word about the pandemic of “kids that are tech’d out!” and the solution that EMP offers!  Our programs are already being tried in schools and we will continue to put programs into schools with every penny raised!  If we don’t meet our goal, we will use the money raised to fund as many schools as we can!  With $75,000, we can supply 30 schools!  As a non-profit organization, this funding will help us attract other interested donors to continue year after year and attack this growing problem among kids nationwide!  Ideally, we’d love children in every school in the nation to have access to this program!


 

     

                 


The Impact

Observing kids today, it doesn’t take much to realize that their communication skills are severely lacking and in danger of disappearing! In this era that is saturated with technology, life skills are being lost! If they are not taught, the lack of these skills will hamper relationships, and play havoc in the business world, in the home and families, and in running the cities, nation and the world!  We see a future of nonverbal, non-engaging human beings! We believe that the performing arts IS the key to teaching and recapturing these crucial life skills!  Our alumni have gone on to secure positions in student government, broadcast journalism, politics and a plethora of other successful careers. We have the track record!  We want other students who are in non-affluent communities to have the opportunity to have this program in their schools.

Risks & Challenges

In the past, our program has only been available to the affluent through private business opportunities in the community.  Our program has been taught after school in private business entities.  With the constant stifling of music and performing arts in the school, there is a danger of teachers not having the time or resources to teach our program!  With funding, we can give them the resources, but government stipulations may prohibit time in the classroom to teach it!  We are actively involved with lobbyists who are striving to keep music and performing arts programs in the schools.  With continued lobbying, we believe the statistics that back our convictions, will allow those in power to not only allow continuation but will also sanction these programs in public schools.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate your time in looking in to our campaign!  If, at this time, you are unable to contribute financially, we ask that you share our campaign on your own social media sites and get involved in your own community to spread the word of the need of music and performing arts programs in schools!  One person CAN and WILL make a difference!  Kids need our program to combat being tech’d out!  Have as many people that you know “check in” with us at EMP!

story:
Who are we? 

Between the three of us, none is a mentalist or a sports manager or an ad-maker. But we could have been. COULD HAVE BEEN. 

Sounds like an all-too-familiar story, right?

We need this pattern to change. We need the innovators. And the playwrights. And the storm-chasers. And the ocean-plumbers. And the smart alecs. And the panda-carers. And the mountain-tamers. And for that we need to tell them what all is possible.We strongly believe that children have the right to determine their career choice and wish to ensure that they are provided with an affordable and accessible support system to achieve their dreams. 

And thus we have started with building Curricooler (www.curricooler.com) , the planet’s first ever outcome-oriented, supplementary education platform, for students, to apply their learning, explore various career options through competition and collaboration and make informed choices. 

We have already rolled out the first version of our website with an initial set of courses on different topics. 

We have 250+ registrations on the site, with about 100 of them having enrolled for different courses.

We have conducted quite a few events and workshops (on Sports Analytics, Photography, Cricket History, to name a few)  which have seen very good participation and interaction.

We also have teamed up with a few companies and opened up internship and shadowing opportunities for students, thus keeping good on the promise of providing experiential learning 

What do we need? 

The students, having been exposed to a different, cooler way of learning and expressing themselves, have started asking for more - more courses, more workshops, more internships, more mentors!

Even though we have made some considerable progress, as a heavily-bootstrapped company we obviously need more help (financial and otherwise :)). And thus this campaign. We plan to use the money we raise under the following heads, in the given proportions:

Product (35%) - We'd love to host more courses on our platform, enhance our video qualities, add more functionalities that'd promote better collaboration between student groups and also students and mentors, build backend analytic capabilities and also improve the overall UI and UX of the site

Business Development (35%) - Create and publish more collateral both through traditional and digital media, arrange for more events and workshops, pursue more partnesrhips with school and professional institutes

Team Expansion (30%) - As of yesterday, we need to hire three full time employees: 

·  a technology architect

·  a developer

·  a marketer

The accrued fund would be able to help us perform these functions. Every penny counts for us (we are bootstrapping, need we say more? :)) and even if we fail to raise the targeted amount,  we can use whatever resources we manage to accrue in addressing some of the needs we mentioned above. 

How and why should you help us? 

The responses and requests have made us realize that we indeed are on the right track. The prototype has been successful, but now comes the obviously difficult task of scaling up! 
We'd love to have your financial support. However, we'd love more to have more immersive contributions from you wherein:
1. You create a course in your area of expertise, and teach others how to do the cool stuff that you do 
2. Join us as a mentor and help students navigate through a world of doubts :)
3. Connect us to students, mentors or companies who'd want to be a part of our journey!  
4. Please do spread the word about us among your network - tweet, scream, pout, snigger, blog on the official Curricooler social media channels. We need all the egging on.
5. And yes, above all, wish us courage and luck. We need loads of those!  

We know it'd never be enough, but we also have planned some cool perks for our backers - social mentions, customized Curricooler merchandise, chance to be run your own Curricooler workshop for students and much more! More on this in the next section! 
Finally, each and every feedback, suggestion and words of reference from you are equally priceless. We're looking for as many pairs of eyes possible to go through our product and strategy and  tell us where we are going absolutely wrong! Do mail us at info(at)curricooler(dot)com with your feedback and ideas and suggestions!

story:
At Catlilli Games, we create educational science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) games targeted for children in grades PK-12.  Our passion is to teach children complex STEM topics in a fun, engaging manner.  With your help, we hope to launch a national brand for STEM games that helps transform education.

 

Our Products

We offer STEM games from a variety of fields, focusing on the tabletop format (board and card games). We have already created five tabletop games and are in the process of converting them to corresponding mobile apps.  

We seek money to support development of a new game based on experimental chemistry, Alembic.

         chemistry memory/matching card game

             card game based on life & earth sciences                      dice game based on genetics, involves art

         engineering party game, materials testing

      strategy card/dice game based on evolution


Our Team

Catlilli Games was co-founded in January 2015 by a scientist and an engineer who each discovered a love for teaching and transitioned to careers in education.

                                             

Our Chief Executive Officer, Catherine Croft Swanwick, graduated from Duke University with a degree in Biology, earned her Ph.D. in Neuroscience from the University of Virginia, and conducted biomedical research for eight years (including five years at the National Institutes of Health) before teaching science in several formal and informal environments. 


 Our Chief Creative Officer, Jon Nardolilli, graduated from Carnegie Mellon University with a Civil Engineering degree before teaching in various settings, including inner-city DC as part of the KIPP program.  He currently teaches math at the School for Tomorrow, an independent school centered on project-based learning. 


Our Achievements

In July 2015, we were accepted for residency in the Virginia Serious Game Institute at George Mason University.  This is a business incubator for game companies established as an applied R&D arm of their Computer Game Design program. Although we are the only tabletop game company in the institute, we are taking advantage this opportunity to collaborate with other companies and convert each of our tabletop games into corresponding mobile apps.  Additionally, the Mason Game & Technology Academy has offered to use our games in their courses for students.

In December 2015, we were selected as semi-finalists in the Washington Post/1776 inGENuitY 2015 Pitch Contest.  We were one of 10 start-up companies chosen from a nationwide pool of 200 applicants.  Watch our one-minute pitch:


What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000 to produce our new game based on experimental chemistry, Alembic.  In an alchemy-like world, children ages 6+ will play cards and roll dice to perform chemical tests on a mystery element.  As they deduce its chemical properties, they will race to be the first one to identify it.  The player who guesses the most mystery elements correctly wins the game!


This money will be used for the following:
  • manufacturing 500 copies of the game
  • artistic costs associated with the game
  • intellectual property filings for the game

To reward you for donating to our goal, we are utilizing our STEM professional expertise to offer you unique PERKS!  

  • $5 - Young Apprentice - name on our website
  • $15 - Promising Student - name on a list of donors printed in the game
  • $30 - Chemical Dabbler - finished copy of the game
  • $60 - Alchemical Journeyman - signed finished copy of the game PLUS name on our website PLUS name on a list of donors printed in the game
  • $100 - Master of Elements - customized additional element for your copy of the finished game
  • $500 - Oracle of Forbidden Knowledge - in addition to customizing your own additional element for the game, you will receive an expansion pack featuring a sampling of four customized elements from other donors
  • $1000 - Archmage of the Institute - Party in Virginia!  We will host a fully customized STEM-themed event for you and 15 guests at the Virginia Serious Game Institute at George Mason University in Manassas, VA.  This can include anything from a session of Alembic in full costume to hands-on STEM activities such as brain dissections or engineering challenges.  
  • $5000 - Lord of the Aether - Party at your place!  We will come to you to host a fully customized STEM-themed event for you  and 15 guests.  This can include anything from a session of Alembic in full costume to hands-on STEM activities such as brain dissections or engineering challenges!  This is limited to backers located east of the Mississippi River.  For backers west of the Mississippi River, we will have to charge an additional fee for travel and lodging.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, we would greatly appreciate your help in other ways:

  • Please spread the word about our campaign to your circle of friends via Facebook, Twitter, or e-mail!  
  • Visit our Catlilli Games website to explore our STEM games
  • Promote STEM education in your community!

story:
nublaxity network 

to inform, connect, engage and support people of color.

nublaxity is 365 websites. Why so many? Two reasons: 1. it's Black History Year for us, and 2. "Black people" are not a homogeneous group.

nublaxity is a portal - to the news, media & opinions that are relevant to our lives




nublaxity is a platform - where we can share and discover the local news and firsthand accounts too often ignored by the mainstream media. (And by the alternative mainstream media, as well.)

nublaxity is a community - where we can see our own faces, and hear our own stories, in our own voices, in our own space.


Over the next 60 days, with your support, we can progress from alpha- to beta-stage production. We can improve our server hardware, upgrade software and plugins, and accept a couple of the part-time work offers we've received. 

We'll post network updates and new links here, and check in regularly for your questions and feedback. 

Help us build. Share. Get involved. Donate.

story:
On Australia Day, the Online Hate Prevention Institute (OHPI) is running a campaign to promote positive Australian values such as multiculturalism, religious pluralism and respecting people's dignity, mateship, volunteering, and a commitment to the rule of law. The campaign will also encourage the public to report online racial and religious vilification which goes against our shared values.

About the Campaign

Australia's Shared Values

We'll be asking the public to join us in promoting positive messages about Australia in celebration of Australia Day. These messages will re-enforce our shared Australian values on this our national day. Here's a few examples, more and further details about the campaign are available at http://ohpi.org.au/australiaday.

We also have material which shares the thoughts of our Indigenous supporters. For Indigenous Australians, the choice of January 26th as our national day is highly problematic. Read more about this here.


Reporting hate that undermines our unity

Far-right wing groups will be using Australia Day to promote their exclusionary narratives about our country (see examples here). Our campaign will encourage people to report messages of hate, racial vilification and religious vilification which undermine Australia's inclusive and multicultural society.

The campaign site, http://ohpi.org.au/australiaday, includes instructions for reporting this hate. 

Fundraising targets & budget

We've committed to spend over $1000 on advertising to promote the messages of this campaign. We haven't raised it before the start of Australia Day, but we hope support on the day will address the short fall. If you can, please help us reach our target. Anything over the target will fund a boost to this campaign, or will be used for our future work combating online hate.

Feedback & Accountability

This is a project of the Online Hate Prevention Institute (OHPI), an independent Australian charity on the Australian Government's register of Harm Prevention Charities. Australian donations are tax deductible.  OHPI reports to a range of Government Agencies and Regulators and is audited annually. 

Briefings and reports produced as part of this campaign will be freely available from the OHPI website. We will also promote them through the OHPI Facebook page and our mailing list.

We welcome your feedback by e-mail as well through our Facebook page. Ideas on promoting this campaign are particularly welcome.

We also have material which shares the thoughts of our Indigenous supporters. For Indigenous Australians, the choice of January 26th as our national day is highly problematic. Read more about this here.


Reporting hate that undermines our unityFar-right wing groups will be using Australia Day to promote their exclusionary narratives about our country (see examples here). Our campaign will encourage people to report messages of hate, racial vilification and religious vilification which undermine Australia's inclusive and multicultural society.
The campaign site, http://ohpi.org.au/australiaday, includes instructions for reporting this hate. 
Fundraising targets & budget
We've committed to spend over $1000 on advertising to promote the messages of this campaign. We haven't raised it before the start of Australia Day, but we hope support on the day will address the short fall. If you can, please help us reach our target. Anything over the target will fund a boost to this campaign, or will be used for our future work combating online hate.


Feedback & Accountability
This is a project of the Online Hate Prevention Institute (OHPI), an independent Australian charity on the Australian Government's register of Harm Prevention Charities. Australian donations are tax deductible.  OHPI reports to a range of Government Agencies and Regulators and is audited annually. 
Briefings and reports produced as part of this campaign will be freely available from the OHPI website. We will also promote them through the OHPI Facebook page and our mailing list.
We welcome your feedback by e-mail as well through our Facebook page. Ideas on promoting this campaign are particularly welcome.

story:
Summary

Hello my name is Benjamin Blackwell and my goal is to create a drone club in Gastonia, NC for teens who want to learn how to fly drones. 

Hello, my name is Shane Fogarty and I am the Co-Creator of this drone organization. I am excited to start working with local students and allow those who don't have access to drones learn to fly them.

We want to work to help make a Drone Club open to teens in Gastonia who can't afford a drone. We will provide them a drone so they can learn to fly in a group and they can take it home to learn more. We will also have community service projects in the area such as visiting schools and daycares such as the Boys and Girls Club. We will have at least two teachers per group, to make sure that every teen will have an equal learning chance.

What We Need & What You Get

  • For our drone club, we are looking at starting with 15 drones and an equal amount of battery sets, crash part replacements,cameras, and cases. Members will be able to bring their own drones but your funding will be used to greatly reduce the cost for teens who can't afford a drone. We will also be getting two HP Stream 7 tablets to help with in the field photo reviewing, and a soldering iron for on the spot drone maintenance.
  • In return for your contribution we offer many different levels of perks. Each perk has a different reward, such as your name on our website, t-shirt, or a personalized video thank-you message based on your donation amount.
  • In case we do not reach our fundraising goal, we will use the funds to get as many drones as we can for the existing (or future) members, because we believe in helping our community.

The Impact

  • This project is important because it helps our future generation prepare in a world where drones are becoming a bigger and bigger resource in business.
  • In return for your help we will post logs of our flights and display our pictures taken by our teen pilots for the world to see.
  • We will also attempt to team up with the Boys and Girls club to bring drones down to their establishments to have our team members teach other teens outside of our program how to fly a drone.

Budget

Fees are the amount of money taken out of our money raised for Indiegogo and for Paypal.

Conclusion

  • We would like to say thank you for looking over our project and hope that you would consider donating, to help our future generation become apart of the world of drones, as it becomes a bigger part in todays industry.

Updates

  • I would like to thank shAIRed SPACE youtube channel for the shoutout during their live hangout session, and I am glad you support my project. Please Check these guys out, they are great.

story:
Every child has the right to live in a Polio-free world.

Help us for the final push to end polio.

Polio is a crippling and potentially fatal infectious disease. There is no cure, but there are safe and effective vaccines. Therefore, the strategy to eradicate Polio is based on preventing infection by immunizing every child to stop transmission and ultimately make the world Polio-free place. The fight to end Polio is a massive effort and although we are so close to eradication, we need more than ever your help to ensure that no child will suffer from this crippling disease ever again.

WEP SA has been proactive in the battle against Polio. We offer our helping hand in the battle of eliminating Polio and support Rotary’s END POLIO NOW campaign. While joining forces with Rotary International and other international organizations, we have redesigned our world renowned "FIVE Extra Virgin Olive Oil" using the 'END POLIO NOW' logo, in a Limited Edition special design bottle for fundraising purposes towards eradicating Polio.


What We Need 

A minimal $50 contribution can save dozens of children’s lives and take us a step closer to eradicate Polio once and for all.

Our outmost goal is to raise $150,000 towards our contribution to ending polio now. We have also set a minimum goal of $60,000 in order to make a substantial difference and save thousands of lives.


What You Get

  • Donation of $50: Limited edition T-Shirt
  • Donation of $125: One (1) bottle of FIVE "END POLIO NOW" Extra Virgin Olive Oil Limited Edition
  • Donation of $250: Two (2) bottles of FIVE "END POLIO NOW" Extra Virgin Olive Oil Limited Edition, to share with your special someone!
  • Donation of $500: Five (5) bottles of FIVE "END POLIO NOW" Extra Virgin Olive Oil Limited Edition, to give out to your close friends and family!
  • Donation of $1.000: Ten (10) bottles of FIVE "END POLIO NOW" Extra Virgin Olive Oil Limited Edition, to give out to your co-workers, friends, family and more!
  • Donation of $10.000: For companies that want to support our cause. You will receive fifty (50) bottles of "END POLIO NOW" Extra Virgin Olive Oil Limited Edition and you are going to receive a certificate and a Paul Harris Fellow pin as a recognition for your generous contribution.

“FAILURE TO ERADICATE POLIO IS UNFORGIVABLE, FOREVER.” — Margaret Chan, Director-General, World Health Organization

“WE HAVE THE ABILITY TO PROTECT EVERY LAST PERSON, ESPECIALLY CHILDREN, FROM THIS ENTIRELY PREVENTABLE DISEASE.” — Anthony Lake, Executive Director, UNICEF

“POLIO ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD IS A RISK EVERYWHERE IN THE WORLD.” — Thomas Frieden, Director, U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention


What is polio

Polio, or poliomyelitis, is a crippling and potentially deadly infectious disease. It is caused by the poliovirus. The virus spreads from person to person and can invade an infected person’s brain and spinal cord, causing paralysis (can’t move parts of the body).


Symptoms

Most people who get infected with poliovirus (about 72 out of 100) will not have any visible symptoms.
About 1 out of 4 people with poliovirus infection will have flu-like symptoms that may include—

  • Sore throat
  • Fever
  • Tiredness
  • Nausea
  • Headache
  • Stomach pain

These symptoms usually last 2 to 5 days then go away on their own.
A smaller proportion of people with poliovirus infection will develop other more serious symptoms that affect the brain and spinal cord:

  • Paresthesia (feeling of pins and needles in the legs)
  • Meningitis (infection of the covering of the spinal cord and/or brain) occurs in about 1 out of 25 people with poliovirus infection
  • Paralysis (can’t move parts of the body) or weakness in the arms, legs, or both, occurs in about 1 out of 200 people with poliovirus infection

Paralysis is the most severe symptom associated with polio because it can lead to permanent disability and death. Between 2 and 10 out of 100 people who have paralysis from poliovirus infection die because the virus affects the muscles that help them breathe.
Even children who seem to fully recover can develop new muscle pain, weakness, or paralysis as adults, 15 to 40 years later. This is called post-polio syndrome.
Note that "poliomyelitis" (or "polio" for short) is defined as the paralytic disease. So only people with the paralytic infection are considered to have the disease.


Transmission

Poliovirus only infects humans. It is very contagious and spreads through person-to-person contact. The virus lives in an infected person’s throat and intestines. It enters the body through the mouth and spreads through contact with the feces (poop) of an infected person and, though less common, through droplets from a sneeze or cough. You can get infected with poliovirus if you have feces on your hands and you touch your mouth. Also, you can get infected if you put in your mouth objects like toys that are contaminated with feces (poop).
An infected person may spread the virus to others immediately before and about 1 to 2 weeks after symptoms appear. The virus can live in an infected person’s feces for many weeks. It can contaminate food and water in unsanitary conditions.
People who don’t have symptoms can still pass the virus to others and make them sick.


Prevention

Polio vaccine protects children by preparing their bodies to fight the polio virus. Almost all children (99 children out of 100) who get all the recommended doses of vaccine will be protected from polio.
There are two types of vaccine that can prevent polio: inactivated poliovirus vaccine (IPV) and oral poliovirus vaccine (OPV). Only IPV has been used in the United States since 2000; OPV is still used throughout much of the world.

story:
Short Summary

We are building a classroom for Brgy. Bucana's elementary school. Brgy. Bucana, according to information collected from the El Nido municipal office, is the poorest among the baranggays (villages) in El Nido, Palawan, Philippines. The school has a population of 712 students with only 10 functioning classrooms including 6 condemnable classrooms (that can collapse anytime soon) and 3 temporary shelter classrooms. The baranggay council was asking us to build them 6 classrooms but our budget can only cover one.


What We Need & What You Get

Max and Elma Koster helped us with our classroom design. The classroom would be wind and typhoon resistant and at the same time, easily maintainable. We will be using concrete, wood, and tarpaulin for our structure design.

We started with PHP150,000.00 (€3,000.00/$3,200.00) that Carlos Pampliega fundraised and we have spent PHP45,988.00 (€891.00/$993.00) so far and we have to spend another PHP172,118.00 (€3,335.00/$3,715.00) for materials to finish building the classroom and we only have PHP104,012.00 (€2,016.00/$2,245.00) on hand. Our fund is short of PHP68,106.00 (€1,320.00/$1,470.00). We also would want to raise additional funds to make the shelter classrooms as permanent classrooms and rehabilitate what we can.

For one classroom, these are the things we need and their costs/estimated costs:

We will be sending personalized video messages of the kids saying thank you to the donors and we will make a couple of short videos of the whole process of the project so you, the donors, get to see the progress of the whole building process.


The Impact

We feel that the kids in Bucana deserve better classrooms that would be conducive to their learning. They deserve to be at least comfortable as they learn and study. We believe that education is very important and it starts with a nice classroom.
This is our second community rehabilitation project. We had a successful series of community rehabilitation projects in 2013 that helped rebuild two island communities in Northern Iloilo after the devastation brought by Typhoon Haiyan/Yolanda. You can see snippets of our work at our YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPzWQ5wte2j7Gk....


Risks & Challenges

Our challenge now is obtaining good wood for the frame of the infrastructure. DENR hasn't contacted us yet if they are able to donate and the only available wood we can buy is mangium (which is easily eaten by termites). We want to get gmelina wood but the local wood shop's supplier is having difficulties with their documents in selling the wood. It may take time and it's gonna be expensive.


Other Ways You Can Help

We need all the help we can get. If you can't donate financially, maybe you can share this campaign around and help us our project get to donors. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share to your social networks.

We appreciate all the help we can get. Thank you, gracias, merci, salamat po!

story:
Summary

  • For 37 years the San Francisco Children’s Art Center has provided classes at Fort Mason Center and around the city with community programs in San Francisco public schools and with children in transitional housing.
  • Raising this money will allow the art center to keep its doors open.
  • We are the only non-profit art education center available for children ages 2-10 focusing on a process-oriented art experience.
  • Our program is inspired by the Reggio Emilia philosophy which fosters innovative thinking and creativity.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The Art Center is facing increased operating costs. We are asking for your generous donation to sustain and develop our programming.
  • Your donation will allow us to continue to keep our doors open.
  • It will allow us to improve marketing efforts and develop a sustainable future for the art center.
  • If the goal is not reached we will lose our home at Fort Mason Center, however, your donation will support our off-site programs in the San Francisco Public Preschools.

The Impact

  • Since 1978 the San Francisco Children’s Art Center has helped nurture the development and creative growth of thousands of children through imaginative self-expression and child-centered arts learning. 
  • We have strong community ties and a long history of providing a unique learning experience for children.
  • Saving the art center will help save San Francisco's rich legacy of fostering innovative, engaging learning experiences for the next generation.

Risks & Challenges

  • In the current economic environment for the arts due to numerous cuts in public funding, we are struggling to raise money to cover our operating costs.
  • We are expanding the board of directors, and this new team is implementing a new model to keep the organization alive.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word. Write a blog post. Talk to local media outlets.
  • Ask your company if they’re interested in matching your donation or sponsoring the art center.
  • Enroll your kids in our classes at http://childrensartcenter.org!
  • Share on Facebook http://igg.me/at/savetheartcenter
  • Share on Twitter #savetheartcenter http://igg.me/at/savetheartcenter

story:
Español

(If you're looking for the English version, please check down the page)

Resumen

¡Bienvenid@s a La Nueva Lotería!

Somos un equipo de 3 mujeres; ilustradora, psicóloga y tallerista/documentalista, residentes de Tijuana, Baja California, México. Aunque en toda Tijuana, hay índices altos de embarazos en niñas y adolescentes, matrimonios y maternidades forzadas, violencia de género, la mayoría de estas tasas, se concentran en las periferias. Estas problemáticas son comúnmente habladas en el centro de la ciudad ó en zonas donde hay mayor acceso a la información pero aún hay mucho trabajo por hacer por l@s niñ@s y adolescentes que viven en las periferias de la ciudad. 

La Nueva Lotería tiene la misma lógica que la lotería mexicana, la diferencia es que La Nueva Lotería tiene conceptos como: autocuidado, menstruación, sexualidad, derechos, métodos antifecundativos, el consentimiento, la igualidad salarial, entre otros temas así también habrá cartas sobre las mujeres en la historía que han fortalecido el movimiento con el objetivo de compartir lo que a todos nos une; ¡el juego!

 

 

 

 

¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos tu apoyo para realizar 45 cartas con estos conceptos, para poder reproducir 500 paquetes de juegos, llevarlos a estas comunidades de manera gratuita, con la finalidad de poder estimular un lenguaje visual a partir del juego, crear diálogos, redes de apoyo y mejorar la calidad de vida de estas niñ@s y adolescentes de estas comunidades.

    Producción:

    • La elaboración de 45 cartas desde el trabajo de bocetaje, ilustración a mano, digitalización y composición gráfica.
    • El trabajo escrito e informativo sobre los conceptos de cada carta, así como un enblema sobre cada concepto. Por ejemplo; "El Condón, ¡el que te protege!
    • La reproducción de 500 sets de La Nueva Lotería (Esto incluye 5 tablas para jugar, las 45 cartas y un manual sobre cada concepto ilustrado) 
    • El trabajo coordinación y acercamiento a estos espacios; albergues, escuelas y comunidades marginadas; una visita semanal en 12 espacios por 3 meses.
    • El trabajo de la documentalista, grabando el proceso de elaboración del juego, así como demostraciones y nuestros acercamientos con éstos grupos. 

    Post-Producción:

    • El trabajo de las 3 talleristas que lideará los juegos con cada comunidad. 
    • El transporte y gasolina para llegar a estos espacios.
    • Alimentación y bebida para el equipo de trabajo.

     

    ¿Qué recibirás a cambio? 

    Con tu donación podremos producir y reproducir a la Nueva Lotería a grande escala, para así poder llevarla a otras comunidades de Baja California y de ser posible, a otros espacios en el resto del país. Cruzamos los dedos por tener el alcance que deseamos con este proyecto, ya que de ser así, podremos invitar a otr@s ilustrador@s, psicólo@s y talleristas dentro del país a que se unan al proyecto y que puedan llevarse sets de la lotería para que puedan jugar con sus propias comunidades. 

    Tenemos variedad de contribuciones para tu donación, puedes ser de los primeros en tener un set listo para jugar, un póster sorpresa sobre una carta, un set de stickers, una ilustración original de alguna carta o acceso exclusivo a los vídeos del proceso creativo de La Nueva Lotería.

    Puedes checar la columna a tu mano derecha para tener más información sobre esto. 

     

    Otras Maneras de Apoyar

    • Sí cuentas con servicios de impresión, sería de mucha ayuda obtener un patrocinio de estos servicios para poder reproducir los 500 sets de la Nueva Lotería. 

    • Sí eres residente de México y no cuentas con tarjeta de débito o crédito para hacer una donación, te podemos compartir una cuenta de Saldazo para realizar donaciones por ese medio.
    • Sí no cuentas con recursos o no quieres donar, sería de mucha ayuda sí compartes nuestros enlaces con tu familia, amigos, compañeros de trabajo o de escuela en tus redes sociales.

     

    ¿Qué haremos sí no se recauda la cantidad esperada?

    De no llegar al objetivo, sólo tendremos que reajustar nuestros ingresos y gastos, pero no es una opción dejar de compartir este juego con las comunidades.

     

    Características:


     

     

     

     

     

     

    ¡GRACIAS!

    ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    English

    Summary

     

    Welcome to La Nueva Lotería!  We're a team of 3 women; Illustrator, psychologist, documentalist, all workshop experts, residents of Tijuana, Baja California, Mexico. Although throughout Tijuana, there are high rates of pregnancies girls and teenagers, forced marriages and maternities, gender violence, most of these rates, are concentrated in the peripheries of the city. These problems are spoken in the center of Tijuana or in areas where there is greater access to information but there is still much work to be done for kids and teens living in the peripheries of the city.

    La Nueva Lotería  has the same logic as the Mexican Loteria, the difference is that  La Nueva Lotería has concepts such as: self-care, menstruation, sexuality, rights, antifecundative methods, consent, salary equality, among other issues as well there will be cards about women in history that have  strengthened the movement with the objective of sharing what unites us all; playing!

     

     

     

     

    What are we looking for?

    We seek your support to make 45 cards with these concepts, in order to reproduce 500 game packages, in order to take them to these communities for free, in order to stimulate a visual language from playing, create dialogues, support networks and improve the quality of life of these kids and teens of these communities.

    Production

    • The development of  45 cards from the work of sketching, hand illustration, digitization, graphic composition and typography.
    • Written and informative work on the concepts of each card, as well as a verse about each concept.
    • The reproduction of 500 sets of The New Lottery (This includes 5 tables to play, the 45 cards and a manual with each illustrated concept)
    • The work coordination and approach to these spaces; shelters, schools and marginalized communities. A weekly visit in 12 spaces for 3 months.
    • The work of the documentalist, recording the process of the development, as well as demonstrations and our approaches with these groups.

    Post-Production:

    • The work of the workshop professionals that will lead the games with each community.
    • Transportation and gasoline to get to these spaces.
    • Food and drink for the work team.

     

    What will you receive in return?

    With your donation we will be to help us out  to produce and reproduce La Nueva Lotería on a large scale, in order to take it to other communities in Baja California and, if possible, to other spaces in the rest of the México. We cross our fingers for having the scope we want with this project, because if so, we can invite other illustrators, psychologists and workshop professionals in the country to join the project and can take sets of La Nueva Lotería to their communities. 

    We have a variety of contributions for your donation, you can be the first to have a set ready to play, a surprise poster of a card, a set of stickers, an original illustration of a card or exclusive access to the videos of the creative process of La Nueva Lotería. 

    You can check the column on your right hand to have more information about this.

     

    Other Ways to Support

    • If you have printing services, it would be very helpful to obtain a sponsorship of these services in order to reproduce the 500 sets of La Nueva Lotería.
    • If you are a resident of Mexico and do not have a debit or credit card to make a donation, we can share a Saldazo account to make donations through this means.
    • If you do not have resources or do not want to donate, it would be very helpful if you share our link with your family, friends, colleagues or school in your social networks.

     

     Characteristics

     

    ¡THANK YOU!

Aunque en toda Tijuana, hay índices altos de embarazos en niñas y adolescentes, matrimonios y maternidades forzadas, violencia de género, la mayoría de estas tasas, se concentran en las periferias. Estas problemáticas son comúnmente habladas en el centro de la ciudad ó en zonas donde hay mayor acceso a la información pero aún hay mucho trabajo por hacer por l@s niñ@s y adolescentes que viven en las periferias de la ciudad. La Nueva Lotería tiene la misma lógica que la lotería mexicana, la diferencia es que La Nueva Lotería tiene conceptos como: autocuidado, menstruación, sexualidad, derechos, métodos antifecundativos, el consentimiento, la igualidad salarial, entre otros temas así también habrá cartas sobre las mujeres en la historía que han fortalecido el movimiento con el objetivo de compartir lo que a todos nos une; ¡el juego!    ¿Qué buscamos?Buscamos tu apoyo para realizar 45 cartas con estos conceptos, para poder reproducir 500 paquetes de juegos, llevarlos a estas comunidades de manera gratuita, con la finalidad de poder estimular un lenguaje visual a partir del juego, crear diálogos, redes de apoyo y mejorar la calidad de vida de estas niñ@s y adolescentes de estas comunidades.Producción:

story:
About Design Hive

Design Hive is a creative technology studio inviting learners of all ages to explore process art and emerging technologies in an inclusive, family-friendly environment. Founded by two working teachers with a combined 25+ years of experience in science and technology education, Design Hive provides STEAM-based in-studio and virtual classes, workshops, camps, parties, and events for children and adults. Design Hive also produces hands-on educational kits, and provides support for schools and the educational community through classes, curriculum development, and professional development. [Read More]

Pivoting Past the Pandemic

We officially opened our doors on March 1, 2020 with a fabulous launch party, but had to promptly close and issue refunds due to the Covid-19 pandemic and statewide shutdowns. We quickly pivoted and shifted our model to offer virtual workshops, parties, events, and DIY project kits, and were able to remain open on a part-time basis. Despite our growing community support as we navigated the ever changing nature of this pandemic, we have not been able to secure any PPP, economic injury/disaster loans, or any SBA backed loans because we are too new and do not have proof of income prior to the pandemic. 

Why We're Raising $50,000

Although we’ve only been operating part time, we have seen the value and positive impact that we bring to our local and global communities. After a year of riding out the pandemic in our part-time model, we are ready to reopen full time and expand our operations to bring more hands-on creative STEAM to our communities.

What we’ll do with the money:

  • Laptops and tablets
  • Laser cutter
  • 3D printer
  • Create free online resources
  • Free community workshops
  • Improve product line
  • Hire creative experts
  • Build outdoor workshop in parking lot

Doesn't This Already Exist?

The Answer. Yes and no. 

While STEAM (science, technology, engineering, art and mathematics) has been a buzzword in education for at least a decade, it is difficult to find anyone offering a creative and exploratory process-based approach to engaging in STEAM education. Parents seeking creative enrichment for themselves or their kids will find art studios or coding labs that teach isolated subjects, but there isn’t an easily accessible place that offers opportunities for the whole family to explore and learn at the intersection of art and technology. 

Perks for Contributing

Every dollar helps us get closer to realizing this dream. You will have our eternal gratefulness for your contribution but some other exciting perks we are offering are:

  • $100 >> 20% discount on workshop, camp, party or our DIY Kits 
  • $250 >> 50% discount on workshop or our DIY Kits 
  • $500 >> Free workshop for you and a friend 
  • $1000 >> Free workshop for you and 2 friends OR 50% discount on camp or party 
  • $1000+ >> Private workshop, party or event 

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand that some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Here are some things you can do:

  • Follow us on Instagram and Facebook!
  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Check out the Indiegogo share tools!
