story:
www.thegenses.com

 

 

Hello Everyone, 

I'm Arjun. 21 years old. From New Delhi, India. Founder of Genses. It is a tiny startup company registered in the UK, and I am the only person behind it at the moment.

 

To describe the problem that Genses is trying to tackle in one sentence: 

 


There is a gigantic gap between how ordinary people think and how Successful people think.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Ordinary people percieve success and fulfillment as a matter of mere good luck or sometimes as a miracle. 

 

Not to sound cheesy, but I want to break this prejudice by showing that success is no miracle. That it involves a lot of struggle. And how it is still possible for ordinary people despite these struggles, to make their own success and find fulfillment.

 

 

Genses will be a platform (Website), where you can learn about the struggle stories of highly successful people in detail, and then ask them a lengthy question regarding their journey or advice regarding your own dire situations.

 

 

You will get a guaranteed response from them within a certain time-frame.

 

 

 

 

 

Before we get into the pitch, let's take an in-depth look at the problem.  

 

 

There is a gigantic gap between how ordinary people think and how successful people think.

 

 

This is a huge problem with many different dimensions.

 

These are the following 5 dimensions that Genses aims to tackle (and solve): 

 

 

 

 

• You lack enough validation and proof for the fact that you can find success in unconventional and difficult endeavors.

 

• Success is often percieved as a miracle. Successful people in turn are seen as super-human. This breeds anxiety and kills inspiration to even start something. Let alone, keep going when things get tough.

 

• There are a lot more successful people around the world, from different walks of life, than you know and are aware of. They’re just not that famous. But they do have some of the most inspiring stories that are less known or not known at all.

 

• There is no effective way for you to have a hearty interaction with a said successful person, from a different country and/or from a different walk of life.

 

• You are stuck with only the people you know or recommendations in your vicinity to get advice for critical decisions regarding something you may want to pursue. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

To make the wisdom of successful people attainable to ordinary people who are struggling in unconventional or difficult endeavors to find success. 

 

 

How? 

 

By doing two things: 

 

1) De-mystifying success stories and bringing the struggles associated with them into the light through detailed story-telling.

2) Enabling long and hearty interactions between the said ordinary people and successful people.

 

 

To read about the mission of Genses and it's background in more detail, visit: www.thegenses.com/mission

 

 

 

 

Adventurers, pioneering entrepreneurs, music composers, film-makers, self-made billionaires, endurance athletes, authors, actors and more from around the world.

 

Is there currently any way for you to discover people like these, their stories of struggle and have hearty interactions with them? 

 

 

(Image used just for the purpose of an illustrative example*)

 

 

At Genses, an Outlier is anyone who has overcome substantial struggles and found success and fulfillment in difficult and/or unconventional endeavors. (*With all due respect to Malcolm Gladwell, this has nothing to do with his philosophies.) 

 

Inspirational people who make life choices that lie outside the ordinary.

 

 

 

 

Outliers on Genses will be a community of these successful people, who will be sharing their stories of struggle and directly answering questions from you.


 

There are a ton of successful people around the world, who are not very famous, but have  inspiring stories. Genses will attempt to bring them to you. 

 

 

Take a look at some of the famous ones: www.thegenses.com/outliers

*Not currently associated with Genses.

 

 

 

 

 

Struggle is relatable. It is not often written about because it is not glamorous, yet it is the only real thing you can use to relate with a successful person.

 

 

Learning about successful people's struggles can reveal to us the attitude and philosophy used by those who've managed overcome substantial struggles in order to make their success through turbulence.

 

They chose to think through the difficult situations differently, to make their success. 

 

 

 

 

It's a simple three-step process

 

 

 

 1) You learn about the story of struggles of an Outlier crafted by Genses.

 2) You ask them a lengthy question.

 3) You get an answer.

 

 

1) Story of Struggle

 

The Outlier's real life story of struggle will be directly collected from them by the team at Genses. 

They will be displayed on the platform in two forms. You can either read these stories, or use the interactive story-telling feature (Work In Progress). 

 

These stories will be collected in rich detail and checked for high accuracy from and by the Outliers themselves. 

 

 

 

2) Asking a question to the Outlier

 

After you learn about the story of the Outlier, you will have two options to ask a lengthy question to the said Outlier. 

A) Ask a question related to their journey/struggles.

B) Ask a question related to your own dire situations.

 

(*Example)

 

Each question will have a 1500 character limit. Ample space to express yourself.

 

 

3) Your Answer

 

After you've crafted your question and made the payment, you will be sent a confirmation regarding whether or not your question needs to be re-framed. If it passes the screening, your question will be sent in to the Outlier.

It may take anywhere from 1-2 weeks for your question to get answered. You must understand that these Outliers operate on extremely busy schedules. 

 

 

To learn about how Genses will work in more detail, please visit:

www.thegenses.com/inner-workings

 

 

 

Trust & Inspiration

 

1) Trust in the Outliers. You want to ask questions and interact with people who don't just claim to be successful. You want to know that their talk has substance to it. Their real-life stories will help you build that trust that they have walked the walk before talking the talk.

 

2) Inspiration. One of the aims of Genses, is to inspire you to make your own success. Real-life stories of these successful people will be displayed on the platform as proof that it is very much possible.

 

Good story-telling  rouses you to a sense of  higher awareness and hence can be a highly potent source of inspiration.  

 

 

 

 

Why this price? 

 

It is not too cheap,  it is not too expensive. Spending $5 to learn about and interact with someone from a higher ethos is money well-spent.

 

Moreover, it is the cost of the two main services that Genses will be providing to its users:

 A) Crafting the story of the Outlier in rich detail and high accuracy.

 B) Being an intermediary by handling the logistics of the Q&A between the users and the Outliers. 

 

Furthermore, I do not wish to rely on advertisements as a source of revenue for Genses.

Ads eat into user experience in an extremely unhealthy way. Hence, I prefer to have a direct revenue stream rather than relying on advertisements which can be annoying for both the end user and for a company.

(This will later turn into a subscription model once the company hits a decent scale where the cost per question will go down further.) 

 

Visit here to learn more about pricing:  www.thegenses.com/pricing

 

 

 

Genses has a definite priority from day one. 

 

Maintaining a healthy user culture of mutual support and respect.

 

It always starts from day one. Hence, there are some rules while asking a question on Genses that every user is requested to understand and keep in mind. 

 

To Read about the user culture on Genses, visit: www.thegenses.com/user-culture

 

 

 

 

As with any startup, The challenges and obstacles are immense and it is impossible to foresee all of those at the outset. But the 2 biggest ones that have presented themselves as of yet, are: 

 

1) Finding Outliers and convincing them.

Successful people are hard to come in contact with. The only way that I've used that has proven effective is cold emailing. 

 

I have currently got 9 highly successful people interested in Genses through cold emailing.

 

 

2) Getting them to be regular and active on the platform. 

We all know how busy successful people are. After all, there is a reason they are successful. It will take some effort to get them to actively engage in the platform. It requires us to nourish and create strong relationships with these successful people. 

 

 

 

 

Plan to overcome these obstacles

 

 

1) Finding and convincing Outliers. 

If the campaign goal is met, I plan to use most of the funds to personally travel to each of these Outliers who are interested in Genses, and meet them in person, no matter where they are in the world. 

Meeting someone in person to convince them is not only 10x more effective, it will really help them to take this seriously. 

 

To quote Airbnb Co-founder Joe Gebbia, "Do things that don't scale."

 

 

2) Getting them to answer actively and engage regularly on the platform. 

The key here is to spend most of the time and energy to nourish and create strong relationships with the Outliers who will be the first to try it.  To create an experience for them where they will enjoy participating and feel fulfilled.

 

They have to know that their participation is making a real-time positive difference in other people's lives. 

 

 

 

How am I qualified to do this? 

 

I'm crazy enough to go to different countries to meet with them in person when the easy way would be to just talk to them on the phone or video calling them. 

But the easy way almost always means a highly ineffective way.

Meeting them in person would ensure that they take this seriously enough and know we take their participation extremely seriously.

 

 

 

 

As of now, there are currently

 

 

After hundreds of cold-emails, 9 highly successful people have show their interest in participating in Genses. This was done without any outside help, recommendations or connections. This was done just through cold emailing. 

 

 

I cannot and will not reveal their names before the launch so as to respect their privacy.

 The fact that they have agreed to share their stories and become part of this is a virtue of their good character. Sharing their names and involvement without their consent before launch would be disrespectful towards them.

 

 

I have only had agreements over email. Since these Outliers are spread out in 5 different countries, there is not enough capital available for me to afford travel to all 5 countries. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

1) They are almost all over the age of 45 They are at a point in their lives where they are taking it easy in their careers and are not as busy. This leads to a higher chance of them being willing to be part of a cause that is greater than themselves and devoting time to it.

 

 

2) They are not very widely known yet they have some huge accomplishments and have encountered some significant struggles to get there They have some of the most inspiring stories you will ever hear of finding success after encountering significant difficulties, yet they are not widely known. 

 

 

3) Reached the peak of their careers and looking back As mentioned before, they are in a more relaxed mindset at this point in their lives and spend a lot of time reflecting. 

 

 

4) Desire and enjoy reflecting on their own journey and sharing the wisdom learned from it . Some of them really do love to give back their wisdom and time. Genses aims to give them the platform to do so hoping that in the future, this brings about a cultural revolution among the successful.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Your investment will go into four main areas: 

 

1) Building a new platform/website

2) Covering travel expenses (Main expense)

3) Buying Equipment

4) Miscellaneous and Unexpected Expenses

 

 

If the campaign goal is met

 

$15,000

 

 

 

If the campaign exceeds the target. 

 

 

 

1) Building the platform/website

I will be building a new website as the current one is an explanatory one and not very functional. The platform will initially be a website.  Money will go towards, building and buying hosting services, SSL, G-Suite and security and rest of what is required.

 

2) Covering Travel Expenses

As mentioned earlier, it is one of my top priorities to meet with Outliers personally  to ensure their concrete interest of participation and ensure that they are actually enthusiastic about it. 

To make sure that they are enthusiastic and are excited about participation, it is absolutely imperative that they are each met in person and explained the concept of Genses to.  

 

3) Buying equipment

A small part of the money raised will be used to buy a new computer and some other necessary hardware. (I have been using a 10 year old desktop until now.)

 

4) Miscellaneous and Unexpected Expenses

As with any startup, there can be a plethora of unexpected expenses. And I am very well aware of how they can accrue. So the remaining money will be used/ kept for that.

 

 

And if the campaign exceeds its target...

 

 

5) Hiring

The excess capital will be used to hire 

a) A video-game designer to create interactive versions of the stories,

b) A web developer to add high functionality to the platform.

 

 

 

 

September & October

 

The two most important tasks during this period: 

 

1) New Website/Platform A whole new website with professional aesthetics, high functionality and easy payments system will be built.

2) Meeting Outliers All the current Outliers will be met in person and their participation will be finalized. Plus 1 More Outlier so the total number of Outliers on Launch day is 10.

 

 

 

 

 


 

The planned launch of Genses is subject to when it has 10 or more Outliers who are on board with participating in this. If the campaign goal is met, I plan to reach the aforementioned target of 10 Outliers, build the platform and launch in 

 

Late November 2018

 

This is still a tentative date as the launch is subject a multitude of potential obstacles. However, the priority will be to launch as early as November 2018 and no later than December 2018.

 

 

 

Perks for the Backers of this campaign Include

 

QUESTIONS

 

 

Get your first 5 questions for $2

 

Number Available: 30

 

 

 

 

Get your First 10 Questions for $10

 

Number Available: 25

 

 

 

HISTORY OF GENSES

 

 

The Super Believers: $500              Quantity: 10   

 

 

 

10 Backers, who believe in Genses more than everyone else, will have their Name, a picture of them, and the opportunity to pen a self-written note on why they believed in Genses, published on the history page of the platform.

www.thegenses.com/history


Note: It is recommended that you claim this perk ONLY if you believe in Genses that much.

 

 

 

The Believers: $2                   Quantity: Unlimited

 

 

 

Each and every backer, who wants to have their name down in the history of Genses, will have their Name and where they're from, published on the history page of the platform.


www.thegenses.com/history

 

 

 

Targets for year one: 

Spend time building and nourishing the community of Outliers. 

Target number of Active Outliers by the end of year 1 (i.e. November 2019): 50

 

 

Long term goals include (Within the next 5 years) 

Have successful people from all walks of life on the platform; Have Outliers from as many countries as possible; Bringing out the untold stories of successes after struggles; Creating a culture of giving back wisdom and time among Outliers (Successful people).

 

 

 

 

I incorporated Genses as a limited company on 23rd April, 2018, in the United Kingdom.

 

Genses Ltd. is a private limited company, registered in England and Wales.

Company registration number: 11322869.

Registered Office: Building/Unit 16238, West Central, London, W1A 6US. PO Box: 6945

 

 

SUPPORT & INQUIRIES

 

For all questions regarding Genses, please reach out to me directly at: 

 

strider.genses@gmail.com

 

NOTE: I am the only person behind this project at the moment. So I would like to request due patience on your part. I will try my best to answer as many individual queries as possible. 

 

Thank you.

 

 

 

 

I am Arjun Menon. I'm currently working alone on this project. However, I do plan to put together a talented team in the near future. (Depending how the campaign goes.)

 

I have a passion for good story-telling and it's potential as a source of inspiration through difficult times, and I have an equal excitement for what the world would look like if ordinary people like me and you could have hearty and meaningful interactions with highly successful people, whom you have no chance of interacting with otherwise. 

 

Genses is, at its core, an attempt at the amalgamation of these two things. 

 

I hope to launch Genses simply to express the idea that success is no miracle, and really it is always possible for ordinary people. That really is my WHY and reason for getting up in the morning.

 

 

 

 

I have dropped out of College and have been working full time on this. I've faced a ton of rejections from professional investors who've said that this could never commercially viable. I obviously do not believe them, and hence, here is the campaign. 

 

If the campaign goal is met, I promise to give everything I have within me to build Genses into a great product and service and in turn build a great company that supremely solves this problem. 

 

 

 

 

Thank you for your time if you got this far. 

I am extremely grateful if you have decided to fund this. Even if it's just a dollar. 

 

Arjun Menon.

Founder & CEO of Genses. 

Email: strider.genses@gmail.com

 

Please visit my blog: www.thegenses.com/blog
story_txt: www.thegenses.com  Hello Everyone, I'm Arjun. 21 years old. From New Delhi, India. Founder of Genses. It is a tiny startup company registered in the UK, and I am the only person behind it at the moment. To describe the problem that Genses is trying to tackle in one sentence:  There is a gigantic gap between how ordinary people think and how Successful people think.      Ordinary people percieve success and fulfillment as a matter of mere good luck or sometimes as a miracle.  Not to sound cheesy, but I want to break this prejudice by showing that success is no miracle. That it involves a lot of struggle. And how it is still possible for ordinary people despite these struggles, to make their own success and find fulfillment.  Genses will be a platform (Website), where you can learn about the struggle stories of highly successful people in detail, and then ask them a lengthy question regarding their journey or advice regarding your own dire situations.   You will get a guaranteed response from them within a certain time-frame.     Before we get into the pitch, let's take an in-depth look at the problem.    There is a gigantic gap between how ordinary people think and how successful people think.  This is a huge problem with many different dimensions. These are the following 5 dimensions that Genses aims to tackle (and solve):     • You lack enough validation and proof for the fact that you can find success in unconventional and difficult endeavors. • Success is often percieved as a miracle. Successful people in turn are seen as super-human. This breeds anxiety and kills inspiration to even start something. Let alone, keep going when things get tough. • There are a lot more successful people around the world, from different walks of life, than you know and are aware of. They’re just not that famous. But they do have some of the most inspiring stories that are less known or not known at all. • There is no effective way for you to have a hearty interaction with a said successful person, from a different country and/or from a different walk of life. • You are stuck with only the people you know or recommendations in your vicinity to get advice for critical decisions regarding something you may want to pursue.        To make the wisdom of successful people attainable to ordinary people who are struggling in unconventional or difficult endeavors to find success.   How?  By doing two things:  1) De-mystifying success stories and bringing the struggles associated with them into the light through detailed story-telling.2) Enabling long and hearty interactions between the said ordinary people and successful people.  To read about the mission of Genses and it's background in more detail, visit: www.thegenses.com/mission    Adventurers, pioneering entrepreneurs, music composers, film-makers, self-made billionaires, endurance athletes, authors, actors and more from around the world. Is there currently any way for you to discover people like these, their stories of struggle and have hearty interactions with them?   (Image used just for the purpose of an illustrative example*)  At Genses, an Outlier is anyone who has overcome substantial struggles and found success and fulfillment in difficult and/or unconventional endeavors. (*With all due respect to Malcolm Gladwell, this has nothing to do with his philosophies.)  Inspirational people who make life choices that lie outside the ordinary.    Outliers on Genses will be a community of these successful people, who will be sharing their stories of struggle and directly answering questions from you. There are a ton of successful people around the world, who are not very famous, but have  inspiring stories. Genses will attempt to bring them to you.   Take a look at some of the famous ones: www.thegenses.com/outliers*Not currently associated with Genses.     Struggle is relatable. It is not often written about because it is not glamorous, yet it is the only real thing you can use to relate with a successful person.  Learning about successful people's struggles can reveal to us the attitude and philosophy used by those who've managed overcome substantial struggles in order to make their success through turbulence. They chose to think through the difficult situations differently, to make their success.     It's a simple three-step process    1) You learn about the story of struggles of an Outlier crafted by Genses. 2) You ask them a lengthy question. 3) You get an answer.  1) Story of Struggle The Outlier's real life story of struggle will be directly collected from them by the team at Genses. They will be displayed on the platform in two forms. You can either read these stories, or use the interactive story-telling feature (Work In Progress).  These stories will be collected in rich detail and checked for high accuracy from and by the Outliers themselves.    2) Asking a question to the Outlier After you learn about the story of the Outlier, you will have two options to ask a lengthy question to the said Outlier. A) Ask a question related to their journey/struggles.B) Ask a question related to your own dire situations. (*Example) Each question will have a 1500 character limit. Ample space to express yourself.  3) Your Answer After you've crafted your question and made the payment, you will be sent a confirmation regarding whether or not your question needs to be re-framed. If it passes the screening, your question will be sent in to the Outlier.It may take anywhere from 1-2 weeks for your question to get answered. You must understand that these Outliers operate on extremely busy schedules.   To learn about how Genses will work in more detail, please visit: www.thegenses.com/inner-workings   Trust & Inspiration 1) Trust in the Outliers. You want to ask questions and interact with people who don't just claim to be successful. You want to know that their talk has substance to it. Their real-life stories will help you build that trust that they have walked the walk before talking the talk. 2) Inspiration. One of the aims of Genses, is to inspire you to make your own success. Real-life stories of these successful people will be displayed on the platform as proof that it is very much possible. Good story-telling  rouses you to a sense of  higher awareness and hence can be a highly potent source of inspiration.      Why this price?  It is not too cheap,  it is not too expensive. Spending $5 to learn about and interact with someone from a higher ethos is money well-spent. Moreover, it is the cost of the two main services that Genses will be providing to its users: A) Crafting the story of the Outlier in rich detail and high accuracy. B) Being an intermediary by handling the logistics of the Q&A between the users and the Outliers.  Furthermore, I do not wish to rely on advertisements as a source of revenue for Genses.Ads eat into user experience in an extremely unhealthy way. Hence, I prefer to have a direct revenue stream rather than relying on advertisements which can be annoying for both the end user and for a company.(This will later turn into a subscription model once the company hits a decent scale where the cost per question will go down further.)  Visit here to learn more about pricing:  www.thegenses.com/pricing   Genses has a definite priority from day one.  Maintaining a healthy user culture of mutual support and respect.  It always starts from day one. Hence, there are some rules while asking a question on Genses that every user is requested to understand and keep in mind.  To Read about the user culture on Genses, visit: www.thegenses.com/user-culture    As with any startup, The challenges and obstacles are immense and it is impossible to foresee all of those at the outset. But the 2 biggest ones that have presented themselves as of yet, are:  1) Finding Outliers and convincing them.Successful people are hard to come in contact with. The only way that I've used that has proven effective is cold emailing.  I have currently got 9 highly successful people interested in Genses through cold emailing.  2) Getting them to be regular and active on the platform. We all know how busy successful people are. After all, there is a reason they are successful. It will take some effort to get them to actively engage in the platform. It requires us to nourish and create strong relationships with these successful people.     Plan to overcome these obstacles  1) Finding and convincing Outliers. If the campaign goal is met, I plan to use most of the funds to personally travel to each of these Outliers who are interested in Genses, and meet them in person, no matter where they are in the world. Meeting someone in person to convince them is not only 10x more effective, it will really help them to take this seriously.  To quote Airbnb Co-founder Joe Gebbia, "Do things that don't scale."  2) Getting them to answer actively and engage regularly on the platform. The key here is to spend most of the time and energy to nourish and create strong relationships with the Outliers who will be the first to try it.  To create an experience for them where they will enjoy participating and feel fulfilled. They have to know that their participation is making a real-time positive difference in other people's lives.    How am I qualified to do this?  I'm crazy enough to go to different countries to meet with them in person when the easy way would be to just talk to them on the phone or video calling them. But the easy way almost always means a highly ineffective way.Meeting them in person would ensure that they take this seriously enough and know we take their participation extremely seriously.    As of now, there are currently  After hundreds of cold-emails, 9 highly successful people have show their interest in participating in Genses. This was done without any outside help, recommendations or connections. This was done just through cold emailing.   I cannot and will not reveal their names before the launch so as to respect their privacy. The fact that they have agreed to share their stories and become part of this is a virtue of their good character. Sharing their names and involvement without their consent before launch would be disrespectful towards them.  I have only had agreements over email. Since these Outliers are spread out in 5 different countries, there is not enough capital available for me to afford travel to all 5 countries.         1) They are almost all over the age of 45 They are at a point in their lives where they are taking it easy in their careers and are not as busy. This leads to a higher chance of them being willing to be part of a cause that is greater than themselves and devoting time to it.  2) They are not very widely known yet they have some huge accomplishments and have encountered some significant struggles to get there They have some of the most inspiring stories you will ever hear of finding success after encountering significant difficulties, yet they are not widely known.   3) Reached the peak of their careers and looking back As mentioned before, they are in a more relaxed mindset at this point in their lives and spend a lot of time reflecting.   4) Desire and enjoy reflecting on their own journey and sharing the wisdom learned from it . Some of them really do love to give back their wisdom and time. Genses aims to give them the platform to do so hoping that in the future, this brings about a cultural revolution among the successful.      Your investment will go into four main areas:  1) Building a new platform/website2) Covering travel expenses (Main expense)3) Buying Equipment4) Miscellaneous and Unexpected Expenses  If the campaign goal is met $15,000   If the campaign exceeds the target.    1) Building the platform/websiteI will be building a new website as the current one is an explanatory one and not very functional. The platform will initially be a website.  Money will go towards, building and buying hosting services, SSL, G-Suite and security and rest of what is required. 2) Covering Travel ExpensesAs mentioned earlier, it is one of my top priorities to meet with Outliers personally  to ensure their concrete interest of participation and ensure that they are actually enthusiastic about it. To make sure that they are enthusiastic and are excited about participation, it is absolutely imperative that they are each met in person and explained the concept of Genses to.   3) Buying equipmentA small part of the money raised will be used to buy a new computer and some other necessary hardware. (I have been using a 10 year old desktop until now.) 4) Miscellaneous and Unexpected ExpensesAs with any startup, there can be a plethora of unexpected expenses. And I am very well aware of how they can accrue. So the remaining money will be used/ kept for that.  And if the campaign exceeds its target...  5) HiringThe excess capital will be used to hire a) A video-game designer to create interactive versions of the stories,b) A web developer to add high functionality to the platform.    September & October The two most important tasks during this period:  1) New Website/Platform A whole new website with professional aesthetics, high functionality and easy payments system will be built.2) Meeting Outliers All the current Outliers will be met in person and their participation will be finalized. However, the priority will be to launch as early as November 2018 and no later than December 2018.   Perks for the Backers of this campaign Include QUESTIONS  Get your first 5 questions for $2 Number Available: 30    Get your First 10 Questions for $10 Number Available: 25   HISTORY OF GENSES  The Super Believers: $500              Quantity: 10      10 Backers, who believe in Genses more than everyone else, will have their Name, a picture of them, and the opportunity to pen a self-written note on why they believed in Genses, published on the history page of the platform.www.thegenses.com/historyNote: It is recommended that you claim this perk ONLY if you believe in Genses that much.   The Believers: $2                   Quantity: Unlimited   Each and every backer, who wants to have their name down in the history of Genses, will have their Name and where they're from, published on the history page of the platform.www.thegenses.com/history   Targets for year one: Spend time building and nourishing the community of Outliers. Target number of Active Outliers by the end of year 1 (i.e. November 2019): 50  Long term goals include (Within the next 5 years) Have successful people from all walks of life on the platform; Have Outliers from as many countries as possible; Bringing out the untold stories of successes after struggles; Creating a culture of giving back wisdom and time among Outliers (Successful people).    I incorporated Genses as a limited company on 23rd April, 2018, in the United Kingdom. Genses Ltd. is a private limited company, registered in England and Wales.Company registration number: 11322869.Registered Office: Building/Unit 16238, West Central, London, W1A 6US. PO Box: 6945  SUPPORT & INQUIRIES For all questions regarding Genses, please reach out to me directly at:  strider.genses@gmail.com NOTE: I am the only person behind this project at the moment. story:
In 2018 I had a vision. I wanted to amplify the voices of Women of Color entrepreneurs and show the world that we are leaders who have valuable information to share. Making this dream come true began on March 1, 2018 with the launch of WinHers United the podcast. Since March 1, 2018 I have interviewed 108 Women of Color entrepreneurs and provided a platform for these ladies to shine. To date WinHers United has been listened to in 96 countries across the globe and has received over 23,500 downloads.

Recently I rebrand my podcast, changing the name from She Leads Podcast: Leadership Empowerment for Women of Color to WinHers United. With this change came the expansion of adding events to the mix, thus birthing the WinHers United Virtual Summit.

My Why

  • Women of Color are at a double systematic disadvantage by being both a woman and a person of color. We represent for the underrepresented by solely showcasing Women of Color.
  • Women of Color are a conduit to effect positive change, promote growth, and spread knowledge which is why we share the personal and professional insight of our speakers.
  • Many people take a long time to understand the importance of self-leadership and the necessity of having a positive mindset which can derail or prolong their journey to greatness. WinHers United provides the insight and tools needed to stay inspired, maintain motivation, and take action both personally and professionally.

WinHers United Accolades

  • Player FM deemed WinHers United as one of the Best Women of Color Podcasts around in 2019 and 2020, and one of the 50 Best Women Leadership Podcasts in 2020.
  • Feedspot Blog ranked WinHers United number 5 out of 20 in the Top 20 Women Leadership Podcasts of 2019 and 2020.
  • Listen Notes ranked WinHers United number 2 of the Ten Best Female Leadership Podcasts to Tune into on International Women's Day.
  • The Women’s Public Leadership blog named WinHers United as One of the 7 Podcasts to Listen to During the Pandemic
  • The Black Podcasting Awards voted WinHers United the Best Black Business Podcast of 2020

My life has literally changed since starting WinHers United, and I want to continue to help change the lives of others who consume the content we offer. My goal is to provide examples of effective leadership via Women of Color entrepreneurs and show that women can come together and celebrate each other. I feel truly blessed to have done this with WinHers United the podcast, and look forward to doing this with the WinHers United Virtual Summit.

Why you should partner with us?

Partnering with the WinHers United Virtual Summit will substantiate you as a proponent for diversity and inclusion, and further expose your brand to the largest growing group of entrepreneurs (Women of Color). Our goal is to provide this content at no cost to those that attend, and we need your help to make this happen. Please join us on this journey to enrich the lives of Women of Color entrepreneurs.

You can help by making a financial contribution and/or by sharing this campaign with individuals in your network to help us spread the word, and ensure we give our attendees the experience they deserve.

story:
Lit. Schools: Bring Diversity To The Bookshelf

Help close the literacy gap by bringing minority authors and characters to elementary classrooms and curriculums across the country. 

Books have the power to change cultures, shape perspectives, and boost literacy.

And it all starts in the classroom.

 

 

THE PROBLEM

A 2018 study by CCBC found that just 23% of children/young adult books received depicted characters from diverse backgrounds: 10% African American, 7% Asian Pacific Islander/ Asian Pacific American, 5% Latinx, and 1% American Indians/First Nations.¹

Compared to 46% of white students, only 17% of Black students in eighth grade had reading percentages at or above the proficient level². The apparent lack of culturally relevant (CR) literature in elementary education is partially to blame.

 

 

Since 1990, Dr. Gloria Ladson-Billings has analyzed the effect of CR material on reading achievement. She and other authorities agree that by using “culturally relevant reading materials in their literacy lessons, [educators] can engage the learner in the concepts being taught on a more meaningful and personal level.”²

Since 2014, minority students have made up the majority of public school enrollment, projected to reach 54.7% by 2022.³

 

 

Shouldn’t it follow that these students are represented by the books in their classrooms?

We think so. 

And with your help,  we can do something about it.  

 

 

THE SOLUTION

Lit. Schools is a nonprofit committed to connecting elementary educators with culturally relevant material for their classrooms, boosting literacy rates of at-risk readers, and increasing awareness of minority authors and their work.

 

 

With your donations teachers, librarians, and school leaders will have the opportunity to apply to receive a curated set of books free of charge, plus access to classroom resources and materials to provide culturally relevant instruction. 

Together, we can increase the literacy and success of all students, especially minorities.

 

 

THE NEED

Our initial goal of $10,000 will fund the establishment and maintenance of Lit. Schools and our online bookstore, Lit. Books. 

$700: Register Lit. Schools as a nonprofit, 501(c)3

$5,000: Create and build Lit. Books online presence

$4,300+: Initial donation to fund classroom libraries in underserved communities

If we do not reach our goal, all funds collected will go towards registering Lit. Schools as nonprofit 501(c)3 and Initial donation to fund classroom libraries.

If you are unable to donate, you can help us out by sharing this campaign on social media or with friends and family. Once Lit. Books is operational, you can help by purchasing titles from our curated inventory.

 

 

THE PERKS*

$1 - $500 donation: Personalized thank you note and your name on the donor page.

$501 - $1000 donation: Personalized thank you note and your name on the donor page AND Curated set of books for a school/teacher of your choice. 

$1000+ donation: Personalized thank you note and your name on the donor page AND Curated set of books for a school/teacher of your choice AND official sponsor listed on all marketing materials for one year. 

 

 

THE ORGANIZER

I’m Shante Williams, a BIPOC 5th and 6th-grade teacher with a Master’s degree in Teaching and Early Childhood Education. For three years, I’ve worked for charter schools in underserved, predominantly minority communities in Houston, TX. 

 

 

Appalled by the lack of diversity in my own classroom bookshelf, I used my own money to purchase culturally relevant books to use in my curriculum. 

And I’m not alone. 94 percent of U.S. teachers spend their own money on school supplies, including books.⁴

 

 

I believe access to CR literature shouldn’t be the financial responsibility of teachers like me. So I started Lit. Schools.

Your donation would mean the world to me, the students I teach every day, and classrooms like mine across the country. 

Sincerely, 

 

 

THE SOURCES

¹ Data on books by and about people of color and from First/Native Nations published for children and teens compiled by the Cooperative Children’s Book Center, School of Education, University of Wisconsin-Madison. More information here: http://ccbc.education.wisc.edu/books/pcstats.asp

²Gwendolyn Cartledge, Susan Keesey, Jessica G. Bennett, Rajiv Ramnath & Morris R. Council III (2015): Culturally Relevant Literature: What Matters Most to PrimaryAge Urban Learners, Reading & Writing Quarterly: Overcoming Learning Difficulties, DOI: 10.1080/10573569.2014.955225 http://dx.doi.org/10.1080/10573569.2014.955225

³Chen, Grace. “White Students Are Now the Minority in U.S. Public Schools.” Public School Review, 31 Oct. 2014, www.publicschoolreview.com/blog/white-students-....

⁴Chokshi, Niraj. “94 Percent of U.S. Teachers Spend Their Own Money on School Supplies, Survey Finds.” The New York Times, The New York Times, 16 May 2018, www.nytimes.com/2018/05/16/us/teachers-school-s....

And it all starts in the classroom.
 
 
THE PROBLEM
A 2018 study by CCBC found that just 23% of children/young adult books received depicted characters from diverse backgrounds: 10% African American, 7% Asian Pacific Islander/ Asian Pacific American, 5% Latinx, and 1% American Indians/First Nations.¹
Compared to 46% of white students, only 17% of Black students in eighth grade had reading percentages at or above the proficient level². The apparent lack of culturally relevant (CR) literature in elementary education is partially to blame.
 

 
Since 1990, Dr. Gloria Ladson-Billings has analyzed the effect of CR material on reading achievement. She and other authorities agree that by using “culturally relevant reading materials in their literacy lessons, [educators] can engage the learner in the concepts being taught on a more meaningful and personal level.”²
Since 2014, minority students have made up the majority of public school enrollment, projected to reach 54.7% by 2022.³
 

 
Shouldn’t it follow that these students are represented by the books in their classrooms?
We think so. 
And with your help,  we can do something about it.  
 
 
THE SOLUTION
Lit. Schools is a nonprofit committed to connecting elementary educators with culturally relevant material for their classrooms, boosting literacy rates of at-risk readers, and increasing awareness of minority authors and their work.
 

 
With your donations teachers, librarians, and school leaders will have the opportunity to apply to receive a curated set of books free of charge, plus access to classroom resources and materials to provide culturally relevant instruction. 
Together, we can increase the literacy and success of all students, especially minorities.
 
 
THE NEED
Our initial goal of $10,000 will fund the establishment and maintenance of Lit. Schools and our online bookstore, Lit. Books. 
$700: Register Lit. Schools as a nonprofit, 501(c)3
$5,000: Create and build Lit. Books online presence
$4,300+: Initial donation to fund classroom libraries in underserved communities
If we do not reach our goal, all funds collected will go towards registering Lit. Schools as nonprofit 501(c)3 and Initial donation to fund classroom libraries.
If you are unable to donate, you can help us out by sharing this campaign on social media or with friends and family. Once Lit. Books is operational, you can help by purchasing titles from our curated inventory.
 
 
THE PERKS*
$1 - $500 donation: Personalized thank you note and your name on the donor page.
$501 - $1000 donation: Personalized thank you note and your name on the donor page AND Curated set of books for a school/teacher of your choice. 
$1000+ donation: Personalized thank you note and your name on the donor page AND Curated set of books for a school/teacher of your choice AND official sponsor listed on all marketing materials for one year. 
 
 
THE ORGANIZER
I’m Shante Williams, a BIPOC 5th and 6th-grade teacher with a Master’s degree in Teaching and Early Childhood Education. For three years, I’ve worked for charter schools in underserved, predominantly minority communities in Houston, TX. 
 

 
Appalled by the lack of diversity in my own classroom bookshelf, I used my own money to purchase culturally relevant books to use in my curriculum. 
And I’m not alone. 94 percent of U.S. teachers spend their own money on school supplies, including books.⁴
 

 
I believe access to CR literature shouldn’t be the financial responsibility of teachers like me. So I started Lit. Schools.
Your donation would mean the world to me, the students I teach every day, and classrooms like mine across the country. 
Sincerely, 

 
 
THE SOURCES
¹ Data on books by and about people of color and from First/Native Nations published for children and teens compiled by the Cooperative Children’s Book Center, School of Education, University of Wisconsin-Madison. More information here: http://ccbc.education.wisc.edu/books/pcstats.asp
²Gwendolyn Cartledge, Susan Keesey, Jessica G. Bennett, Rajiv Ramnath & Morris R. Council III (2015): Culturally Relevant Literature: What Matters Most to PrimaryAge Urban Learners, Reading & Writing Quarterly: Overcoming Learning Difficulties, DOI: 10.1080/10573569.2014.955225 http://dx.doi.org/10.1080/10573569.2014.955225
³Chen, Grace. “White Students Are Now the Minority in U.S. Public Schools.” Public School Review, 31 Oct. 2014, www.publicschoolreview.com/blog/white-students-....
⁴Chokshi, Niraj. “94 Percent of U.S. Teachers Spend Their Own Money on School Supplies, Survey Finds.” The New York Times, The New York Times, 16 May 2018, www.nytimes.com/2018/05/16/us/teachers-school-s....

story:
At Ditch Your Fund Investing our goal is to help the individual break free from the traditional means of investing, create wealth, and provide for the future. We are not brokers, we don't offer trading advice, and are not selling a get-rich-quick scheme.

As average, middle-class families we started our retirement planning the way most do, through mutual funds and 401k's.  Quickly though, we realized how poorly these tend to perform, and how expensive they are to maintain.  So we started researching and discovered value investing, a wildly effective and safe way to invest that eliminates the middle man (the mutual fund manager) and all his costly hidden fees.

Trying it, we were amazed by the consistency of the results.  For us, it proved to be a fantastic alternative to traditional retirement investing, allowing us total control with far greater returns (around 15% on average).  And we wanted to share it with everyone we knew! But not everyone had the time to do all the research to find these perfect investing scenarios. 

So we set out to simplify it and create something that literally anyone could use.  And from this DYF Investing was born. A website that does all the tedious and time-consuming work for you. We give a score to quantify the "health" of a company, and information on pricing indicating when is or isn't a good time to buy.  With it, you can make safe investment decisions in a fraction of the time it took us in the beginning.

But doing the research is expensive and amassing complete data points proves challenging.  It requires analyzing enormous amounts of data (10 years' worth in fact, for every single company) which is where you come in!  We are asking for contributions so that we can access all the required information needed to provide you with the best investment tool you will ever find.  Empowering you to invest with confidence and with ease.

Eventually, we hope to share this system as a monthly subscription.  As a perk for being an early backer, we offer different tiers of access, ranging from a month free, to a lifetime membership.  We genuinely believe the conventional ways of investing (mutual funds and 401k's) do not work in the favor of people like you and us, so it is our goal to make this information available to as many people as possible.

Please join us in our endeavor!  Whether it's contributing financially or just helping to spread the word, we want to get this in as many hands as possible because we believe the ability to create wealth and financial security should be available to everyone.
